text:
Which position is particularly important for this object when transporting a patient in shock?
A. Fowler's position
B. Upright position
C. Trendelenburg position
D. Flat position
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The feet can be raised to what is called the Trendelenburg position, indicated for patients in shock.

text:
Which characteristic is NOT typical for the temperament of this object?
A. Very intelligent and loyal
B. Easily bored and highly energetic
C. Quiet and suspicious of strangers
D. Highly aggressive and loud
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Giant Schnauzers are usually a quiet breed... It has the potential to be aggressive, but Giant Schnauzers are usually reserved

text:
What is the traditional color combination of this object's coat?
A. Black with white markings
B. Solid red
C. Red with white markings
D. White with black markings
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The breed's coat only comes in a single colour combination of white with red markings, usually in a piebald pattern.

text:
What steering mechanism is traditionally associated with this object when it possesses four wheels?
A. A rudder
B. Turntable or fifth wheel
C. Flap control
D. A steering wheel
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A four-wheeled vehicle is also steered by the shafts or pole, which are attached to the front axle; this swivels on a 'turntable' or 'fifth wheel' beneath the vehicle.

text:
What is a notable behavior of this object during mating?
A. Males compete in physical combat
B. Releases a sound to attract mates
C. The female releases a pheromone to reduce aggression in males
D. Both sexes change color to a brighter hue
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The female releases a pheromone which causes the males to become less aggressive and to begin courtship.

text:
Which of the following is known as the world's largest this object?
A. The LEGO Store
B. Hamleys
C. Toys "R" Us
D. FAO Schwarz
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Notable Examples. - Hamleys, the world’s largest toy shop

text:
In which habitats is this object predominantly found?
A. Low-altitude woodlands and forest edges
B. Polar and subpolar zones
C. Temperate forests and grasslands
D. Desert and arid regions
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: They are principally birds of low-altitude woodlands and forests, and particularly of forest edge and canopy.

text:
In which type of climates does this object predominantly thrive?
A. Mediterranean
B. Subarctic
C. Tropical rainforest
D. Desert
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The plant tolerates seasonal drought, and the Middle Eastern and Mediterranean climates are especially suitable to it.

text:
Which of the following features was introduced by Philips in the development of this object?
A. Eight-to-fourteen modulation (EFM)
B. Diagonal error correction
C. Anti-shock buffering
D. Cross-interleaved Reed-Solomon Coding (CIRC)
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Philips also contributed eight-to-fourteen modulation (EFM), which offers a certain resilience to defects such as scratches and fingerprints.

text:
What is a common contemporary use for this object in urban settings?
A. Display in museums
B. Storing chilled goods for retail
C. Transporting large amounts of heavy equipment
D. Delivering business mail across the city
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Messenger bag: one long strap worn across the body, inspired by bags worn by urban messengers to deliver business mail, a modern silhouette

text:
Which classification below correctly includes this object?
A. Nematoda
B. Angiosperms
C. Basidiomycetes
D. Cnidaria
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Old systems of classification place all agarics in the Agaricales and some (mostly older) sources use 'agarics' as the colloquial collective noun for the Agaricales.

text:
Which of the following materials is NOT traditionally used to make this object?
A. Gourd
B. Metal
C. Wood
D. Leather
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Rattles made from gourds (Lagenaria) are being shaken by the natural grip... Modern maraca balls are also made of leather, wood or plastic.

text:
What is the primary purpose of this object when used with books?
A. To store additional notes about the book
B. To serve as a bookmark
C. To protect book covers from damage
D. To enhance the aesthetic appeal of a webpage
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In addition to its promotional role, the dust jacket protects the book covers from damage.

text:
What is the specific style of slicing this object found particularly in St. Louis?
A. Sliced vertically multiple times
B. Not sliced at all, sold whole
C. Diced into small cubes
D. Sliced horizontally
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The St. Louis style bagel...The St. Louis style bagels are sliced vertically multiple times, instead of the traditional single horizontal slice.

text:
Which historical factor significantly influenced the variety and proliferation of products offered in this object during the Middle Ages in Europe?
A. The introduction of corn
B. The rise of wheat cultivation
C. The discovery of sugar cane from the Indian subcontinent
D. The use of salt as a preservative
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Between the 6th and 4th centuries BC, the Persians, followed by the Greeks, adopted and then spread sugar and sugarcane agriculture.

text:
What is the primary purpose of this object mounted above the pilot in private aircraft?
A. To monitor engine performance
B. To help prevent collisions during landing or taxiing
C. To enhance communication signals
D. To serve navigation purposes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In 1956, the Civil Aeronautical Administration proposed a rear-view mirror mounted right above the pilot to keep an eye when private aircraft are landing or taxiing on the runway to prevent collisions.

text:
What is the primary food source for this object during the winter months?
A. Tree bark
B. Small mammals
C. Seeds of grasses
D. Leaves
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The diet of the indigo bunting consists primarily of insects during the summer months and seeds during the winter months.

text:
Which health condition does this object NOT commonly suffer from?
A. Entropion
B. Diabetes
C. Hip dysplasia
D. Boxer cardiomyopathy
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Leading health issues to which Boxers are prone include cancers, heart conditions such as aortic stenosis and arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy (the so-called 'Boxer cardiomyopathy'), hypothyroidism, hip dysplasia, and degenerative myelopathy and epilepsy.

text:
Which of the following regions is NOT a natural habitat for any species of this object?
A. Northern Europe
B. Central Africa
C. Southern Asia
D. Southwestern United States
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Eurasian lynx ranges from central and northern Europe across Asia up to Northern Pakistan and India.

text:
Which Canadian provider is one of the operators of this object?
A. Freedom Mobile
B. Rogers
C. Virgin Mobile
D. Bell
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Most payphones in Canada are owned and operated by large telecom providers such as Bell, Telus, and SaskTel.

text:
What is an alternative name for this object in Italian American communities in the northeastern United States?
A. Autumn mushroom
B. Signorina mushroom
C. King of mushrooms
D. Dancing mushroom
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Throughout Italian American communities in the northeastern United States, it is commonly known as the signorina mushroom.

text:
What behavioral trait does this object display that is unique among its kind?
A. It lives in large social groups.
B. It migrates seasonally over long distances.
C. It climbs trees to escape predators.
D. It carries its young on its back.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Sloth bear mothers carry their cubs up trees as the primary defense against attacks by predators.

text:
During what period do females of this object typically give birth?
A. During the rainy season
B. Only in winter months
C. Continuously throughout the year
D. During the dry season
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Females give birth to young during the rainy season, after a 150- to 170-day gestation.

text:
What homeomorphic shape is this object equivalent to in the field of topology?
A. Doughnut
B. Cone
C. Cylinder
D. Sphere
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Thus in topology, a mug is equivalent (homeomorphic) to a doughnut (torus)...

text:
What is the range of wingspan found in this object?
A. 72-91 cm
B. 30-60 cm
C. 80-100 cm
D. 65-85 cm
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: They range from 40 to 60 cm (16 to 24 in) in length and from 72 to 91 cm (28 to 36 in) in wingspan.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object?
A. Fish and marine invertebrates
B. Small mammals and birds
C. Primarily fruits and vegetables supplemented with small rodents
D. Large wild hooved mammals and occasionally smaller animals or livestock
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mantises are generalist predators of arthropods. Larger mantises sometimes eat smaller individuals of their own species, as well as small vertebrates such as lizards, frogs, small birds and fishes.

text:
Where was this object first described scientifically?
A. Germany, 1788
B. England, 1833
C. South Africa, 1833
D. France, 1798
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: "P. sebae" was first described by Johann Friedrich Gmelin, a German naturalist, in 1788.

text:
Originating in the United States, this object is primarily known for what purpose?
A. Companion pet
B. Raccoon hunting
C. Sled pulling
D. Guarding
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Bluetick Coonhound is most commonly used as a raccoon hunting dog, but may also be kept as a pet.

text:
What type of coat does this object have?
A. Shaggy harsh double coat
B. Curly and moisture-resistant
C. Silky and single-layered
D. Long and smooth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Shelties have a double coat, which means that they have two layers of fur that make up their coat.

text:
Which area was this object predicted to spread to from its current areas of inhabitance?
A. Australia and New Zealand
B. Canada and the United States
C. Scandinavia
D. South America
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: it was predicted to spread to Australia and New Zealand

text:
Considering the design objectives of separate this object, which characteristic is considered critical for matching this object to the morphology of its user?
A. Length and internal volume of the tube
B. The number of straps for securing the object
C. Flexibility of the mouthpiece
D. External color
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Although snorkels come in many forms, they are primarily classified by their dimensions and secondarily by their orientation and shape. The length and the inner diameter (or inner volume) of the tube are paramount...

text:
What is the effect of increased tactile stimulation of the hind legs on this object in crowded conditions?
A. Immediate death
B. Color change and increased breeding
C. Decreased serotonin levels
D. No visible changes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Increased tactile stimulation of the hind legs causes an increase in levels of serotonin. This causes the grasshopper to change color, feed more and breed faster.

text:
What does recent molecular studies suggest about the relationship of this object?
A. They are closely related to grebes
B. They are closely related to pigeons
C. They are closely related to penguins
D. They are closely related to ducks
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Recent molecular studies have suggested a relation with grebes

text:
What is the typical lifespan of this object in the wild?
A. 1-3 years
B. 6-8 years
C. 3-5 years
D. 8-10 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Maximum lifespan in the wild is estimated to be 8 to 10 years, but one frog lived for almost 16 years in captivity.

text:
What type of biome is the preferred breeding habitat for this object?
A. Temperate forests
B. Mountainous areas
C. Sub-tropical swamps
D. Desert regions
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The little blue heron's breeding habitat is sub-tropical swamps.

text:
What is the recommended way to measure the effective protection provided by this object?
A. The Sun Protection Factor (SPF) rating
B. The Protection Grade of UVA (PA) system
C. The Persistent Pigment Darkening (PPD) method
D. The Ultraviolet Protection Factor (UPF) rating
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The sun protection factor (SPF rating, introduced in 1974) is a measure of the fraction of sunburn-producing UV rays that reach the skin.

text:
Which family does this object belong to?
A. Felidae
B. Hyaenidae
C. Herpestidae
D. Viverridae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family (family Brassicaceae, genus 'Brassica')

text:
What colors does the AKC accept for showing this object?
A. Merle
B. All colors
C. Blue and fawn
D. Solid or stag red and the black or chocolate with rust points
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: For showing in the United States, the AKC disqualifies all colors but the solid or stag red and the black or chocolate with rust points.

text:
Which term is specifically used for this object that has a particularly wide flood plain or flat bottom?
A. Rift valley
B. Vale
C. Glen
D. Cove
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In geography, a "vale" is a wide river valley, usually with a particularly wide flood plain or flat valley bottom.

text:
Which of the following characteristics does not describe this object?
A. Short legs
B. High risk of Canine Diabetes
C. Topknot of hair
D. Elongated body
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The breed has a very long body, short legs, and a distinctive topknot of hair on the head.

text:
What is the primary nesting choice of this object?
A. On the ground
B. In shallow water
C. In high rocky cliffs
D. In trees
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: They nest on the ground and have a diet consisting of seeds, grapes and insects.

text:
What additional benefit can this object provide besides toning the face?
A. It can be used as a facial cleanser
B. It can act as a sunscreen
C. It can hydrate the skin
D. It can reduce facial hair growth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Besides toning the face, some powders with sunscreen can also reduce skin damage from sunlight and environmental stress.

text:
Which group is this object a part of according to the American Kennel Club?
A. Toy
B. Sporting
C. Non-Sporting
D. Herding
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Like most dogs of the American Kennel Club Sporting group, the Irish Water Spaniel is essentially an active, willing and energetic companion.

text:
Which factor contributes to variations in the size of this object between different geographic locations?
A. Variations in genetic makeup
B. Availability and type of food resources
C. Predation pressure from other animals
D. Climate and temperature variations
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: American black bears on the East Coast tend to be heavier on average than those on the West Coast, although American black bears follow Bergmann's rule and bears from the Northwest are often slightly heavier than the bears from the Southeast.

text:
How does this object primarily obtain its food?
A. Hunting in packs
B. Scavenging during the day
C. Eating primarily vegetation
D. Nocturnally hunting small animals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Jacamars are insectivores, taking a variety of insect prey by hawking in the air.

text:
What classic mechanical principle does this object demonstrate?
A. None of the above
B. Third-class lever
C. Second-class lever
D. First-class lever
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The wheelbarrow is designed to distribute the weight of its load between the wheel and the operator, so enabling the convenient carriage of heavier and bulkier loads than would be possible were the weight carried entirely by the operator. As such it is a second-class lever.

text:
What does the term 'mandarins' refer to concerning this object?
A. The characteristic gait of the run
B. The facial hair resembling a Fu Manchu mustache
C. A special diet followed
D. A unique training method developed
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A specimen may have facial hair that looks like a Fu Manchu mustache. The mustache is called mandarins.

text:
Which of the following was not a use of this object during its early development in Europe?
A. Siege weapon
B. Field artillery
C. Naval artillery
D. Anti-cavalry weapon
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: By the end of the 14th century cannon were widespread throughout Eurasia. Cannon were used primarily as anti-infantry weapons until around 1374 when cannon were recorded to have breached walls for the first time in Europe.

text:
Which disease affects this object and requires specific fungicide treatment in both autumn and spring?
A. Leaf rust
B. Botrytis
C. Canker
D. Powdery mildew
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Canker causes leaf spotting, and premature ripening and weakening of the stem

text:
How does this object typically react when threatened?
A. It hides its head and exposes its tail
B. It curls its tail, exposing a brightly colored underside
C. It immediately attacks the predator
D. It releases a toxic spray
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Rather than trying to bite a predator, the snake winds up its tail into a corkscrew, exposing its brightly colored belly.

text:
How often do this object's origins require access to water?
A. Regular swimming
B. Occasionally for cleaning
C. Only in hot weather
D. Never
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Golden retrievers have an instinctive love of water.

text:
What is a traditional material used to manufacture this object?
A. Plastic
B. Wood
C. Ceramic
D. Steel
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Historically, wood has been the most popular material used for picket fences.

text:
Which statement is accurate about the use of 'this object' in Roman Catholic liturgy?
A. It entered liturgy simply to give light in processions.
B. It was originally used as a symbol of authority.
C. It was first introduced during the Second Vatican Council.
D. It replaced candles entirely in modern practices.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In former times, liturgical torches were carried in Eucharistic processions simply to give light.

text:
Which of the following features is advisable to include in the construction of this object to prevent aid to predators?
A. Outside perches
B. Drainage holes
C. Bright colors
D. None of the above
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Nest boxes should be made from untreated wood with an overhanging, sloped roof, a recessed floor, drainage and ventilation holes, a way to access the interior for monitoring and cleaning, and have no outside perches which could assist predators.

text:
What is the primary material used in the construction of this object?
A. Clay
B. Stone
C. Wood
D. Metal
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The archetypical drumstick is turned from a single piece of wood, most commonly of hickory.

text:
Which anatomical feature is absent in this object?
A. Tail
B. Forepaws
C. Ears
D. Nose
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: It is easily recognisable by its stout, tailless body and large head with round, fluffy ears and large, spoon-shaped nose.

text:
Which of the following scenarios is the most common for application of this object?
A. During physical exercise
B. Post-surgical breast operation
C. In cases of chronic back pain
D. After a traumatic head or neck injury
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: It is also applied by emergency personnel to those who have had traumatic head or neck injuries...

text:
What type of coat does this object have?
A. Thick and double-layered
B. Sparse and rough
C. Silky and often wavy or slightly curly
D. Short and smooth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Shelties have a double coat, which means that they have two layers of fur that make up their coat.

text:
What is the primary function of this object when used in conjunction with a water distribution system?
A. To reserve water for non-potable uses
B. To beautify the urban landscape
C. To decrease water pressure
D. To pressurize the water distribution system
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A water tower is an elevated structure supporting a water tank constructed at a height sufficient to pressurize a water distribution system for the distribution of potable water, and to provide emergency storage for fire protection.

text:
What is the typical size of an adult this object?
A. Approximately 1 meter in length and 10 kilograms
B. Approximately 2.5 meters in length and 30 kilograms
C. Up to 2 meters in length and 50 kilograms
D. About 3 meters in length and 70 kilograms
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In the wild, adult Komodo dragons usually weigh around , although captive specimens often weigh more.

text:
What is a distinctive reproductive behavior of this object?
A. Laying eggs under tree bark
B. Females brood their eggs in their hind limbs
C. Males deposit a spermatophore on the ground
D. Depositing large clutches on aquatic vegetation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: He deposits a spermatophore on the ground, then attempts to lower the female's cloaca into contact with it.

text:
What is the typical lifespan of this object as reported in a UK Kennel Club survey?
A. A little over 8 years
B. A little over 12 years
C. About 10 years
D. Around 15 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A UK Kennel Club survey puts the median lifespan of Miniature Schnauzers at a little over 12 years.

text:
Which location experiences nearly 300 days of clear skies and hosts an early modern version of this object?
A. Ural Mountains, Russia
B. Pyrenees, France
C. Appalachian Mountains, USA
D. Alps, Switzerland
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The first modern solar furnace is believed to have been built in France in 1949 by Professor Félix Trombe. It is now still in place at Mont Louis, near Odeillo. The Pyrenees were chosen as the site because the area experiences clear skies up to 300 days a year.

text:
What unique respiratory feature does this object possess?
A. It has multiple gills on each side for efficient oxygen absorption
B. It breathes exclusively through skin absorption
C. It possesses both lungs and gills for breathing
D. Its vascularized swim bladder can function as lungs
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Unusually, their vascularised swim bladders can function as lungs, and most gars surface periodically to take a gulp of air.

text:
What feature in this object allows it to display events that briefly occur over time?
A. Probe configuration
B. Storage capability
C. Focus control
D. Horizontal controls
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A storage oscilloscope can capture a single event and display it continuously, so the user can observe events that would otherwise appear too briefly to see directly.

text:
What distinctive physical feature does this object have on its tail?
A. Smooth with a tuft of curls at the base
B. Fully feathered
C. Hairless
D. Bushy throughout
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The most distinguishing characteristic of these dogs is the smooth 'rat tail', completely free of long coat except at the base where it is covered for 2–3 inches with curls.

text:
What is the typical diet of this object?
A. Primarily insects
B. Fish and aquatic organisms
C. Small mammals and birds
D. Grass and small plants
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The eastern diamondback rattlesnake forages actively or lies in ambush for small mammals, especially rabbits and rice rats ("Oryzomys"). The diet also includes birds.

text:
What is a common characteristic shape of this object when it develops in water bodies?
A. Triangular and pointed
B. Irregular and fragmented
C. Long and narrow
D. Circular and compact
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Shoals are characteristically long and narrow (linear) ridges.

text:
What is an alternative name for this object in Italian American communities in the northeastern United States?
A. Autumn mushroom
B. Signorina mushroom
C. King of mushrooms
D. Dancing mushroom
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Throughout Italian American communities in the northeastern United States, it is commonly known as the signorina mushroom.

text:
What unique physical characteristic does the male of the hamadryas species of this object display?
A. Extra long tail
B. A vibrant blue facial color
C. A black stripe down its back
D. Large white manes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Males of the hamadryas baboon species also have large white manes.

text:
Which other breed was crossed with this object in a notable backcross project to address a specific health issue?
A. English Pointer
B. Golden Retriever
C. Labrador Retriever
D. German Shepherd
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The backcross used a single English Pointer; subsequent breedings have all been to purebred Dalmatians.

text:
Which of these items is similar in function to this object?
A. Elbow pad
B. Sunglasses
C. Baseball cap
D. Wrist watch
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: See also: Elbow pad

text:
Which of the following is a traditional belief about the purpose of the horns and frill of this object?
A. For attracting mates
B. For regulating body temperature
C. For digging up roots
D. For defensive purposes against predators
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Traditionally, these have been viewed as defensive weapons against predators.

text:
What innovation was primarily responsible for the decline in use of this object from the 1980s onward?
A. Wireless communication
B. Internet-based calling
C. DTMF (dual-tone multi-frequency) push-button dialing
D. Optical fiber technology
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: From the 1980s onward, the rotary dial was gradually supplanted by DTMF (dual-tone multi-frequency) push-button dialing.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object?
A. Insects
B. Berries
C. Small birds
D. Earthworms
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mantises are generalist predators of arthropods. Larger mantises sometimes eat smaller individuals of their own species, as well as small vertebrates such as lizards, frogs, small birds and fishes.

text:
Which term is specifically used for this object that has a particularly wide flood plain or flat bottom?
A. Rift valley
B. Vale
C. Glen
D. Cove
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In geography, a "vale" is a wide river valley, usually with a particularly wide flood plain or flat valley bottom.

text:
In which countries is this object commonly found?
A. Russia, Mongolia, China, and Japan
B. Malaysia, Indonesia, Philippines, and Thailand
C. India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and Bhutan
D. Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, and Fiji
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Indian cobra is native to the Indian subcontinent and can be found throughout India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and southern Nepal.

text:
What ecological role does this object typically fulfill in its native environment?
A. Scavenger
B. Apex predator
C. Primary herbivore
D. Middle-level omnivore
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Dingoes are regarded as apex predators and possibly perform an ecological key function. Likely (with increasing evidence from scientific research), they control the diversity of the ecosystem by limiting the number of prey and keeping the competition in check.

text:
Which of the following functions is not commonly included in a digital version of this object?
A. Global positioning system
B. Date function
C. External sensor connectivity
D. Time-of-day function
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Because they contain a microchip, they often include date and time-of-day functions as well. Some may have a connector for external sensors...

text:
Which of the following animals is known to prey occasionally on this object?
A. Killer whale
B. Common dolphin
C. Blue whale

text:

text:

B. Air

D. Heliox

text:

text:

text:

Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Barn spiders are predominantly yellow and brown in coloration with striped legs.

text:
At what age does this object typically reach sexual maturity?
A. 4-5 years
B. 1-2 years
C. 10-12 years
D. 7-8 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Sexual maturity is attained at the age of four to five years.

text:
What related object shares some functional characteristics with this object?
A. Rocking chair
B. Dining table
C. Sofa bed
D. Canopy bed
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: See also. - Canopy bed

text:
What type of life cycle does this object exhibit?
A. Holometabolous
B. Hemimetabolous
C. Metamorphosis
D. Ametabolous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: They have a hemimetabolous life cycle with three stages: egg, nymph and adult.

text:
What was the primary reason for the historical shift in the usage of this object from utilitarian to lifestyle in the 1950s?
A. Consumer desire for more comfortable vehicles
B. Introduction of automatic transmissions
C. Government regulations on vehicle emissions
D. Decrease in manufacturing costs
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Once a work tool with few creature comforts, in the 1950s consumers began purchasing pickups for lifestyle reasons.

text:
What common nickname is associated with this object due to its behavioral characteristics?
A. Small tiger
B. Tiny bear
C. Little black fox
D. Little lion
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Schipperke is sometimes referred to as the 'little black fox'

text:
What is the primary historical use of this object?
A. Guarding livestock
B. Performing in circuses
C. Guiding blind persons
D. Hunting game animals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Mention of the breed can be found in old Hungarian texts. They have historically been royal guard dogs, or guarded livestock, but have been increasingly found in homes as pets over the last seventy years.

text:
From an ecological perspective, what are the main uses of this object?
A. Insect habitat and carbon sequestration
B. Ornamental and medicinal purposes
C. Soil improvement and moisture retention
D. Animal feed, vegetable oils, and biodiesel
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Rapeseed is grown for the production of animal feed, edible vegetable oils, and biodiesel

text:
What does the name of this object translate to in English?
A. Stick
B. Roll
C. Slice
D. Wave
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Although the word 'baguette' was not used to refer to a type of bread until 1920, the word itself simply means 'wand', 'baton' or 'stick'.

text:
What unique vocalization is this object known for?
A. Bark
B. Meow
C. Howl
D. Yodel-like sound
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Basenji produces an unusual yodel-like sound (commonly called a 'baroo')

text:
What is the typical longevity range for this object?
A. 10-12 years
B. 12-15 years
C. 8-10 years
D. 15-18 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The typical longevity of beagles is 12–15 years, which is a common lifespan for dogs of their size.

text:
What distinctive physical feature does this object have on its tail?
A. Smooth with a tuft of curls at the base
B. Fully feathered
C. Hairless
D. Bushy throughout
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The most distinguishing characteristic of these dogs is the smooth 'rat tail', completely free of long coat except at the base where it is covered for 2–3 inches with curls.

text:
What is the average lifespan of this object in the wild?
A. Up to 30 years
B. Up to 20 years
C. Up to 10 years
D. Up to 15 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Their average lifespan is 9 years with 19 years and 2 months being the longest recorded.

text:
How is this object most commonly packaged?
A. In a spray bottle
B. As a compact or loose powder
C. In a roll-on applicator
D. In a tube
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: It comes packaged either as a compact or as loose powder.

text:
In which type of climates does this object predominantly thrive?
A. Mediterranean
B. Subarctic
C. Tropical rainforest
D. Desert
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The plant tolerates seasonal drought, and the Middle Eastern and Mediterranean climates are especially suitable to it.

text:
How does this object typically respond to a perceived threat?
A. Burrowing into sand
B. Curling into a ball
C. Extending and displaying a dewlap
D. Emitting a loud noise
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: If cornered by a threat, the green iguana will extend and display the dewlap under its neck, stiffen and puff up its body, hiss, and bob its head at the aggressor.

text:
How is this object primarily identified from photographs?
A. By the scars and patches from parasites
B. From distinctive fin markings
C. Using color variations on the belly
D. Through unique tail patterns
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Individual whales are typically identified using photographs of their dorsal surface and matching the scars and patches associated with parasites that have fallen off the whale or are still attached.

text:
In terms of social structure, what trait is significant about this object?
A. It forms highly social groups where a female dominates.
B. It is known for being solitary and rarely interacts with others of its kind.
C. It establishes a male-dominant hierarchy within its group.
D. It engages in monogamous relationships that last a lifetime.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The ring-tailed lemur is highly social, living in groups of up to 30 individuals. It is also female dominant, a trait common among lemurs.

text:
In which habitats can this object typically be found?
A. Urban areas and city parks
B. Forests and woodlands
C. Deserts and polar ice caps
D. Open oceans and beaches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Echidnas are found in forests and woodlands, hiding under vegetation, roots or piles of debris.

text:
Which of the following is the correct scientific name for this object?
A. Cinclus mexicanus
B. Cinclus schulzii
C. Cinclus pallasii
D. Cinclus cinclus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The genus contains five species: ... - American dipper "Cinclus mexicanus"

text:
Which uniformed groups in the UK specifically require the use of this object when wearing their black tie?
A. All branches of the British Armed Forces
B. The Royal Navy and Marines
C. The British Army and Navy
D. The Royal Air Force and Royal Air Force Cadets
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Windsor knot is the only tie knot that is to be used by all personnel in the Royal Air Force and the Royal Air Force Cadets (ATC and CCF(RAF)) in the UK when wearing their black tie while in uniform.

text:
Which animal was this object historically bred to hunt?
A. Wolves
B. Bears
C. Boars
D. Deer
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Originally used to pursue game by speed; it was also famed as a guardian dog, specializing in protection against and for the hunting of wolves.

text:
Which of the following features is advisable to include in the construction of this object to prevent aid to predators?
A. Outside perches
B. Drainage holes
C. Bright colors
D. None of the above
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Nest boxes should be made from untreated wood with an overhanging, sloped roof, a recessed floor, drainage and ventilation holes, a way to access the interior for monitoring and cleaning, and have no outside perches which could assist predators.

text:
What related item might be stored inside this object?
A. Toiletry kit
B. Books
C. Cooking utensils
D. Clothing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Toiletry kit

text:
What does the 'pad-' prefix in the term for this object suggest about its origin?
A. It is derived from a craftsman's name who specialized in these objects.
B. Its origin is unknown and combined with the noun lock.
C. It indicates a specific type of lock mechanism used.
D. It suggests a security feature that is specific to this object.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The term padlock is from the late fifteenth century. The prefix pad- is of unknown origin; it is combined with the noun lock, from Old English 'loc', related to German 'loch', 'hole'.

text:
What is the average lifespan of this object in the wild?
A. Up to 30 years
B. Up to 20 years
C. Up to 10 years
D. Up to 15 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Their average lifespan is 9 years with 19 years and 2 months being the longest recorded.

text:
What is the range of wingspan found in this object?
A. 72-91 cm
B. 30-60 cm
C. 80-100 cm
D. 65-85 cm
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: They range from 40 to 60 cm (16 to 24 in) in length and from 72 to 91 cm (28 to 36 in) in wingspan.

text:
What is the standard tuning for this object's strings, from lowest to highest?
A. A, D, G, C
B. E, A, D, G
C. G, D, A, E
D. C, G, D, A
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Its four strings are usually tuned in perfect fifths: from low to high, C, G, D and A.

text:
Which of these materials is NOT commonly used for this object's fabric?
A. Nylon
B. Silk
C. Cotton
D. Polyester
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Tent fabric may be made of many materials including cotton (canvas), nylon, felt and polyester.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object?
A. Fish and marine invertebrates
B. All of the above
C. Berries and plant material
D. Seals and other pinnipeds
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mantises are generalist predators of arthropods. Larger mantises sometimes eat smaller individuals of their own species, as well as small vertebrates such as lizards, frogs, small birds and fishes.

text:
Which term is used to describe a collector of these objects?
A. Helixophile
B. Bottlenophile
C. Corkophile
D. Vinophile
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A person who collects corkscrews is a "helixophile."

text:
What is the effect of increased tactile stimulation of the hind legs on this object in crowded conditions?
A. Immediate death
B. Color change and increased breeding
C. Decreased serotonin levels
D. No visible changes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Increased tactile stimulation of the hind legs causes an increase in levels of serotonin. This causes the grasshopper to change color, feed more and breed faster.

text:
This object, due to its original breeding purpose, should be observed cautiously around which type of pets?
A. Cats
B. Fish
C. Birds
D. Rodents
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Norwich are generally good with children, and if introduced to other household pets as a puppy they generally co-habit peacefully, though caution should be observed around rodent pets as they may be mistaken for prey.

text:
What historic event contributed significantly to the decline of this object's numbers?
A. The Industrial Revolution
B. The French Revolution
C. World War I
D. The signing of the Magna Carta
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: During World War I breeding was stopped entirely causing their numbers to decrease to a record low.

text:
What is the primary food source for this object during the winter months?
A. Tree bark
B. Small mammals
C. Seeds of grasses
D. Leaves
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The diet of the indigo bunting consists primarily of insects during the summer months and seeds during the winter months.

text:
How are the eyes and mandibles described for the oldest fossil of this object found?
A. Wide eyes and long mandibles shaped like sickles
B. No eyes and very long mandibles
C. Small eyes and short rounded mandibles
D. Compound eyes with no visible mandibles
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Traits that identify 'Cretotetracha' as Cicindelinae include long mandibles shaped like sickles, simple teeth arranged along the mandible's inner surface, antennae that attach to the head between the base of the mandibles and the eye.

text:
Which of the following physical features is NOT common between the North American and Eurasian species of this object?
A. Size of nasal bones
B. Number of toes
C. Color of fur
D. Shape of the tail
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Although superficially similar to each other, there are several important differences between the two species. Fur colour is also different.

text:
What kind of temperament is this object known for?
A. Shy and reserved
B. Aggressive and energetic
C. Dominant and territorial
D. Docile and friendly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Scottish Deerhound is gentle and extremely friendly, docile and eager to please, with a bearing of gentle dignity.

text:
Which of the following best describes the technological evolution of this object from the 1990s to early 2000s?
A. Shift from analog to digital video projectors.
B. Change from monochrome to color output.
C. Transition from hydraulic to electric functioning.
D. Development from mechanical to electronic interfaces.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Video projectors are digital replacements for earlier types of projectors such as slide projectors and overhead projectors.

text:
What is the traditional shape of this object?
A. T-shaped
B. Triangle-shaped
C. Rectangular
D. Circular
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The traditional pretzel shape is a distinctive symmetrical form...

text:
Regarding the materials used in constructing beginner versions of this object, which type of wood is often preferred?
A. Sycamore Maple
B. Mahogany
C. Birch
D. Cedar
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A modern beginner's bassoon is generally made of maple, with medium-hardness types such as sycamore maple and sugar maple preferred.

text:
How does this object primarily obtain its food?
A. Foraging on the ground
B. Filter feeding in water
C. Hawking insects from a perch
D. Scavenging from carcasses
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Jacamars are insectivores, taking a variety of insect prey by hawking in the air.

text:
Which types of game is this object primarily used to hunt?
A. Pheasants and quails
B. Rabbits and foxes
C. Raccoons and deer
D. Elk and moose
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Treeing Walker Coonhound was bred primarily to hunt raccoons, but it is also used on other game such as deer, bear or mountain lion.

text:
Which of the following describes the life cycle stage missing in this object compared to other members of its phylum?
A. Polyp stage
B. Medusa stage
C. Adult stage
D. Larval stage
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Unlike jellyfish, sea anemones do not have a medusa stage in their life cycle.

text:
Which Canadian provider is one of the operators of this object?
A. Freedom Mobile
B. Rogers
C. Virgin Mobile
D. Bell
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Most payphones in Canada are owned and operated by large telecom providers such as Bell, Telus, and SaskTel.

text:
How is this object secured when worn?
A. Clips attached to the hair
B. A single button at the neck
C. Ribbons tied under the chin
D. An elastic band around the head
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Typically, the bonnet would be secured by ribbons tied under the chin, which might also wrap around the bottom of the bonnet's crown, similar to a hatband.

text:
Who typically steers this object?
A. The rear rider
B. The front rider
C. It is automatically steered
D. Both riders equally
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: On conventional tandems, the front rider steers as well as pedals the bicycle and is known as the 'captain', 'pilot', or 'steersman'; the rear rider only pedals and is known as the 'stoker', 'navigator' or 'rear admiral'.

text:
What unique features does this object typically have?
A. Flat crown and extra-wide brim
B. Flat crown and narrow brim
C. High pointed crown and extra-wide brim
D. High pointed crown and narrow brim
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: It usually has a high pointed crown, an extra-wide brim

text:
Which materials are most commonly used for the mesh of this object?
A. Nylon and polyester
B. Copper and stainless steel
C. Bronze and brass
D. Aluminum and fiberglass
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The most common materials used for the mesh of window screens are aluminum and fiberglass.

text:
Which of the following best describes the technological evolution of this object from the 1990s to early 2000s?
A. Shift from analog to digital video projectors.
B. Change from monochrome to color output.
C. Transition from hydraulic to electric functioning.
D. Development from mechanical to electronic interfaces.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Video projectors are digital replacements for earlier types of projectors such as slide projectors and overhead projectors.

text:
How many species are estimated to be classified under the family associated with this object?
A. Approximately 50
B. Approximately 100
C. Approximately 80
D. Approximately 64
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Approximately 64 species are classified in this family.

text:
What order is this object classified under?
A. Pelecaniformes
B. Gruiformes
C. Passeriformes
D. Ciconiiformes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The limpkin is placed in its own monotypic family, Aramidae, which is in turn placed within the crane and rail order Gruiformes.

text:
Which substance was historically used to decrease friction on the bottom of this object?
A. Mineral grease
B. Animal fat
C. Beeswax
D. Vegetable oil
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The long ski supporting the weight of the skier was treated with animal fat in a similar manner to modern ski waxing.

text:
Which component is typically used to facilitate the opening of drawers in metal versions of this object?
A. A push button
B. A thumblatch
C. A rotating knob
D. A lever switch
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: To open a drawer on most metal filing cabinets, a small sliding mechanism known as a 'thumblatch' must be pressed to release and open the drawer.

text:
What physical characteristic is common to this object?
A. Webbed feet
B. Long, down-curved bills and bright plumage
C. Muted, earth-tone plumage
D. Short, blunt bills
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: They are characterised by richly coloured plumage, slender bodies, and usually elongated central tail feathers. All have long down-turned bills and medium to long wings, which may be pointed or round.

text:
Which of the following features is characteristic of this object's coat?
A. Silky and long
B. Thick and wavy
C. Straight and wiry
D. Curly and soft
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The outer part of the double coat should be straight and wiry in texture.

text:
Where does this object originate from?
A. The Scottish Highlands
B. The Swiss Alps
C. The Lake District in England
D. Welsh Countryside
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Lakeland Terrier is a dog breed, which takes its name from its place of origin, the Lake District in England.

text:
In which Chinese province would this object traditionally contain mushrooms without strong spices to preserve the original flavor?
A. Sichuan
B. Fujian
C. Guangdong
D. Yunnan
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In neighbouring Yunnan, although spicy broths are equally popular, there is another predominant type of hot pot that is made with various wild or planted mushrooms.

text:
Which of the following features is characteristic of this object's coat?
A. Silky and long
B. Thick and wavy
C. Straight and wiry
D. Curly and soft
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The outer part of the double coat should be straight and wiry in texture.

text:
Which type of propellants were popularly used in this object following the phase-out of CFCs?
A. Hydrocarbons such as propane and butane
B. Nitrous oxide
C. Hydrofluorocarbons
D. Compressed natural gas
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Since the phase-out of CFCs in the 1980s, hydrocarbons are popular propellants. These include propane, butane, isobutane, and related volatile hydrocarbons.

text:
Which of these is not a modern variation of this object?
A. Ballbarrow
B. Hovering version
C. Power-assisted version
D. Dual-wheel model
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the 1970s, British inventor James Dyson introduced the Ballbarrow, an injection molded plastic wheelbarrow with a spherical ball on the front end instead of a wheel. Power assisted wheelbarrows are now widely available from a number of different manufacturers.

text:
What ecological role does this object typically fulfill in its native environment?
A. Scavenger
B. Apex predator
C. Primary herbivore
D. Middle-level omnivore
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Dingoes are regarded as apex predators and possibly perform an ecological key function. Likely (with increasing evidence from scientific research), they control the diversity of the ecosystem by limiting the number of prey and keeping the competition in check.

text:
Which component is typically used to facilitate the opening of drawers in metal versions of this object?
A. A push button
B. A thumblatch
C. A rotating knob
D. A lever switch
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: To open a drawer on most metal filing cabinets, a small sliding mechanism known as a 'thumblatch' must be pressed to release and open the drawer.

text:
What unique features does this object typically have?
A. Flat crown and extra-wide brim
B. Flat crown and narrow brim
C. High pointed crown and extra-wide brim
D. High pointed crown and narrow brim
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: It usually has a high pointed crown, an extra-wide brim

text:
How were the earliest forms of this object constructed by primitive people?
A. Forging iron into a fence
B. Piling loose field stones
C. Baking clay bricks
D. Using dried mud and straw
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The first stone walls were constructed by farmers and primitive people by piling loose field stones into a dry stone wall.

text:
What is a common characteristic of types of this object that have a higher fat content?
A. Requires more water
B. Develops more gluten
C. Less elastic
D. More elastic
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Doughs with higher fat content have a lesser water content, develop less gluten and are therefore generally less elastic than bread doughs; these doughs are often called 'short' by bakers.

text:
What characteristic evolved in the design of this object by the middle of the 18th century?
A. Metallic finishes
B. Integration with digital technology
C. Simpler, more compact designs
D. Especially elaborate doors
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: By the middle of the 18th century, china cabinets were typically more elaborate; later cabinets had especially elaborate doors and were lighter weight.

text:
What is the typical diet of this object?
A. Primarily insects
B. Fish and aquatic organisms
C. Small mammals and birds
D. Grass and small plants
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The eastern diamondback rattlesnake forages actively or lies in ambush for small mammals, especially rabbits and rice rats ("Oryzomys"). The diet also includes birds.

text:
How accurate are the volume markings typically found on this object?
A. Within about 5%
B. Within about 10%
C. Within about 1%
D. Within about 20%
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Most beakers are accurate to within ~10%.

text:
What is a unique reproductive behavior observed in this object?
A. Copulations tend to last for half a minute
B. Males gestate and give birth to young
C. Females lay eggs
D. Copulations last for hours
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Copulations tend to last for half a minute.

text:
What significant change occurred in the mid-20th century regarding the production of this object?
A. Production completely ceased
B. They became predominantly decorative
C. They started being made from plastics
D. Revival of their carving and cultural significance
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Beginning in the late 1930s, a combination of cultural, linguistic, and artistic revivals... led to a renewal and extension of this artistic tradition.

text:
At what age does this object typically reach sexual maturity?
A. 4-5 years
B. 1-2 years
C. 10-12 years
D. 7-8 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Sexual maturity is attained at the age of four to five years.

text:
Which of these is not a correct description of the physical traits of this object?
A. Black faces with distinctive white markings
B. Tails vary in length depending on the species
C. Has long, prominent ears with high mobility
D. Has short, wide bodies and short legs for digging
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Badgers have rather short, wide bodies, with short legs for digging. They have elongated, weasel-like heads with small ears.

text:
From what types of breeds is this object descended?
A. Terrier and hound breeds
B. Molosser type dogs from the Romans
C. Spitz and primitive types
D. Herding and gun dog breeds
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: These dogs are thought to be descendants of molosser type dogs brought into the Alps by the ancient Romans.

text:
Where did this object originate?
A. Kent, England
B. Brittany, France
C. Bavaria, Germany
D. Normandy, France
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The name "Brittany" is taken from the Brittany region in northwestern France where the dog originated.

text:
The bars of this object are best struck at which location for producing the fullest sound?
A. Just off center of the bar
B. At the very edge of the bar
C. In the center of the bar
D. Near the end of the bar
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Marimba bars produce their fullest sound when struck just off center.

text:
Which genus does the Northern this object belong to?
A. Abronia
B. Elgaria
C. Sceloporus
D. Gerrhonotus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Northern alligator lizard ("Elgaria coerulea")

text:
What is the primary material used in the construction of this object?
A. Clay
B. Stone
C. Wood
D. Metal
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The archetypical drumstick is turned from a single piece of wood, most commonly of hickory.

text:
Originating in the United States, this object is primarily known for what purpose?
A. Companion pet
B. Raccoon hunting
C. Sled pulling
D. Guarding
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Bluetick Coonhound is most commonly used as a raccoon hunting dog, but may also be kept as a pet.

text:
Which genus does the Northern this object belong to?
A. Abronia
B. Elgaria
C. Sceloporus
D. Gerrhonotus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Northern alligator lizard ("Elgaria coerulea")

text:
From which two Latin words is the term for this object derived, and what do they mean?
A. Vinculum - bond, Ducere - to lead
B. Via - way, Amicus - friend
C. Vectis - lever, Durus - hard
D. Via - road, Ducere - to lead
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The term 'viaduct' is derived from the Latin 'via' for road and 'ducere', to lead.

text:
What type of mouthparts does this object possess?
A. Piercing
B. Siphoning
C. Sucking
D. Chewing

text:

D. Alps, Switzerland
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B

text:
What is the conservation status of this object globally according to the IUCN Red List?

B. Endangered
C. Data deficient
D. Critically Endangered

text:

B. White
C. Brown
D. Black
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
What is a distinctive reproductive behavior of this object?

B. 1985

D. 2000

D. Compression fitting

D. Romans and Greeks

text:
What natural phenomena did Patricia Blackwell Gary and Richard Talcott suggest influenced the design of this object?

The pyramid and obelisk's significance have been previously overlooked, especially the astronomical phenomena connected with sunrise and sunset: the zodiacal light and sun pillars respectively.

text:

text:

wiki: Washing is conducted with 65–71 °C / 150–160 °F temperatures and sanitation is achieved by either the use of a booster heater that will provide the machine 82 °C / 180 °F 'final rinse' temperature or through the use of a chemical sanitizer.
