Which loom technique is used to produce this object?
A. Double weft integration
B. Dual-layer simultaneous weaving
C. Triple cross-thread knitting
D. Single warp weaving
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Velvet is woven on a special loom that weaves two thicknesses of the material at the same time.

text:
What is typically the minimum roof pitch recommended to ensure effectiveness in shedding water for this object?
A. 60 degrees
B. 30 degrees
C. 40 degrees
D. 50 degrees
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A roof pitch of at least 50 degrees allows precipitation to travel quickly down slope so that it runs off the roof before it can penetrate the structure.

text:
What is the primary purpose for which this object was originally bred?
A. Guarding property
B. Herding sheep
C. Hunting hare
D. Companion pet
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Basset is a scent hound that was originally bred for the purpose of hunting hare.

text:
What is the geographic range of this object in the United States?
A. Throughout all continental states
B. Mostly the eastern states including forests and coastal areas
C. Primarily the southwestern desert regions
D. Mainly in the northern regions near the Great Lakes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: "Heterodon", which occur mainly in the United States and northern Mexico

text:
What material is not typically used for making this object?
A. Microfiber
B. Cotton
C. Linen
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Dishcloths are typically made of cotton or other cloth, such as microfiber.

text:
Which gene mutation has led to the creation of white-colored individuals of this object?
A. TYRP1 gene mutation
B. ASIP gene mutation
C. SLC45A2 gene mutation
D. MC1R gene mutation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Although this is consistent with albinism, the proper characterization of the mutation is currently unknown. The animals are commonly known as tyrosinase-positive albinoids, lacking melanin in oculocutaneous structures. This condition is caused by a partial deletion in the SLC45A2 gene.

text:
How is the fur of this object described?
A. Short, coloured black at the shoulders and yellowish orange on its back
B. Spotted with green patches
C. Long and woolly
D. Completely white to blend in with snowy environments
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A squirrel monkey's fur is short and close, coloured black at the shoulders and yellowish orange on its back and extremities.

text:
What is essential for the upkeep of this object's mental and physical health?
A. Consistent cooling periods to manage fur heat
B. Regular exercise and extensive training
C. Minimal exercise and frequent grooming
D. Frequent social outings
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Groenendael needs a large amount of exercise as a rule. It should include not only a walk but also a training session to keep the dog mentally stimulated.

text:
Which of the following is NOT a feature traditionally found on this object?
A. Shoulder straps
B. Removable wool liners
C. Button-close pockets
D. Hood attachment
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Traditionally this garment is double-breasted with 10 front buttons, and has wide lapels, a storm flap, and pockets that button-close.

text:
Which health condition is this object NOT predisposed to?
A. Canine pemphigus
B. Diabetes mellitus
C. Chronic ear infections
D. Lymphoma
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Chow-Chow can suffer from entropion, glaucoma, juvenile cataracts, lymphoma, hip dysplasia, diabetes mellitus, canine pemphigus, and gastric cancer.

text:
What distinctive physical feature does this object have on its tail?
A. Smooth with a tuft of curls at the base
B. Fully feathered
C. Hairless
D. Bushy throughout
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The most distinguishing characteristic of these dogs is the smooth 'rat tail', completely free of long coat except at the base where it is covered for 2–3 inches with curls.

text:
What significant social impact did the introduction of this object have in the UK during the early 19th century?
A. Introduction of factory laws
B. Reduced urban migration
C. Led to the Swing Riots
D. Increased farm productivity
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Swing Riots in the UK were partly a result of the threshing machine.

text:
What technical advancement in the early 20th century significantly contributed to the development of this object?
A. Development of durable Nichrome wire
B. Creation of non-stick surfaces
C. Discovery of microwave radiation
D. Invention of the vacuum tube
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The problem of the heating element was solved in 1905 by a young engineer named Albert Marsh, who designed an alloy of nickel and chromium, which came to be known as Nichrome.

text:
Which of the following is a process associated with the formation of this object?
A. Wave refraction
B. Volcanic activity
C. Thermal erosion
D. Chemical precipitation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Shoaling can also diffract waves, so the waves change direction. Refraction also occurs as waves move towards a beach.

text:
In which orchestral work did Ludwig van Beethoven first incorporate this object?
A. Symphony No. 5 in C minor
B. Symphony No. 4
C. Symphony No. 3
D. Symphony No. 9 in D minor
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Ludwig van Beethoven in Symphony No. 5 in C minor (1808).

text:
Which of the following cities has not been mentioned as having this object?
A. London
B. San Francisco
C. Cairo
D. Tokyo
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Cities with fireboats are usually located on a large body of water with port facilities.

text:
What innovative use during a wartime scenario was this object known for?
A. Evasive driving training for military personnel
B. Transporting food supplies to affected areas
C. Acting as a mobile command center
D. Carrying soldiers to the front line in a battle
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Paris taxis played a memorable part in the French victory at First Battle of the Marne in the First World War... about six hundred taxicabs at Les Invalides in central Paris to carry soldiers to the front...

text:
How does this object primarily defend itself from predators?
A. By releasing a toxic substance
B. By emitting a loud sound to scare predators away
C. By shedding its tail
D. By camouflaging with the surroundings
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: This lizard sometimes sheds its tail (autotomy) to evade the grasp of a predator, regrowing it later.

text:
In which year did the first electric version of this object appear?
A. 1971
B. 1932
C. 1963
D. 1951
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The first electric golf cart was custom-made in 1932, but did not gain widespread acceptance.

text:
How does this object generally move through its habitat?
A. Burrowing underground
B. Mainly by jumping from tree to tree
C. Flying short distances
D. Quadrupedal movement on the tops of branches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Howler monkeys generally move quadrupedally on the tops of branches, usually grasping a branch with at least two hands or one hand and the tail at all times.

text:
What type of breathing apparatus does this object use to allow the diver to breathe while diving?
A. Closed-circuit rebreather
B. Open-circuit scuba
C. Semi-closed rebreather
D. All of the above
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Most recreational scuba diving is done using a half mask which covers the diver's eyes and nose, and a mouthpiece to supply the breathing gas from the demand valve or rebreather.

text:
Where in its phylogenetic lineage does this object stand according to genetic studies?
A. A direct descendant of the fox
B. Descended directly from the gray wolf
C. A non-canine related species
D. A basal member of the domestic dog clade
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Whole genome sequencing indicates the dog to be a genetically divergent subspecies of the grey wolf, the dog is not a descendant of the extant grey wolf, but these are sister taxa which share a common ancestor from a ghost population of wolves that went extinct at the end of the Late Pleistocene, and the dingo and the Basenji are basal members of the domestic dog clade.

text:
How did this object get its name?
A. Originated from the Dutch word for 'pot'
B. From its invention in the Netherlands
C. From the Dutch method of brass working
D. Named after a Dutch royal
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Darby learned that when making castings, the Dutch used molds made of sand, rather than the traditional loam and clay...

text:
Which country is credited with the origin of this object?
A. Australia
B. United States
C. France
D. United Kingdom
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The Granny Smith Cultivar originated in Eastwood, New South Wales, Australia in 1868.

text:
In which region is this object historically named after?
A. Prussia
B. Bavaria
C. Saxony
D. Pomerania
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Pomeranian is named for the Pomerania region in north-west Poland and north-east Germany in Central Europe.

text:
Which of these is not a modern variation of this object?
A. Ballbarrow
B. Hovering version
C. Power-assisted version
D. Dual-wheel model
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the 1970s, British inventor James Dyson introduced the Ballbarrow, an injection molded plastic wheelbarrow with a spherical ball on the front end instead of a wheel. Power assisted wheelbarrows are now widely available from a number of different manufacturers.

text:
Which of the following is the correct scientific name for this object?
A. Cinclus mexicanus
B. Cinclus schulzii
C. Cinclus pallasii
D. Cinclus cinclus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The genus contains five species: ... - American dipper "Cinclus mexicanus"

text:
What is the standard power supply voltage commonly used for this object?
A. 600-volt DC
B. 1000-volt DC
C. 120-volt AC
D. 240-volt AC
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Power is most commonly supplied as 600-volt direct current.

text:
What is the original purpose of this object?
A. Herding cattle
B. Hunting gamebirds
C. To be kept as a luxury pet
D. Guarding properties
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The original purpose of the breed was to hunt gamebirds.

text:
During which time period did the tunic dress, featuring this object that matched the length of the underskirt, become prevalent?
A. 1900 to 1935
B. 1650 to 1700
C. 1700 to 1740
D. 1815 to 1890
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Tunic dress—A tunic that reached below the waistline and which covered a dress or petticoat. The overskirt was the same length as the underskirt. It was popular in Europe and the Americas from 1815 to 1890.

text:
What characteristic skeletal feature does this object possess?
A. Primarily cartilaginous skeleton
B. No skeleton
C. Exoskeletal structure
D. Entirely bony skeleton
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Sturgeons retain several primitive characters among the bony fishes. Along with other members of the subclass Chondrostei, they are unique among bony fishes because their skeletons are almost entirely cartilaginous.

text:
Which of the following is a common method used for the commercial cultivation of this object?
A. Hydroponics
B. Aeroponics
C. Terracing
D. Plasticulture
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The bulk of modern commercial production uses the plasticulture system.

text:
What is the term used to describe the person in charge of this object?
A. Hotelier
B. Chef
C. Bartender
D. Restaurateur
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A restaurant's proprietor is called a 'restaurateur', this derives from the French verb 'restaurer', meaning 'to restore'.

text:
In what century were shaving versions of this object developed?
A. 19th Century
B. 18th Century
C. 20th Century
D. 16th Century
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A shaving scuttle and shaving mug were developed around the 19th century; the first patent for a shaving mug is dated 1867.

text:
What is the typical reproductive characteristic of this object compared to similar species?
A. Born underground
B. Born blind and helpless
C. Born without fur
D. Born fully furred and with eyes open
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Young hares are adapted to the lack of physical protection, relative to that afforded by a burrow, by being born fully furred and with eyes open.

text:
What characteristic skeletal feature does this object possess?
A. Primarily cartilaginous skeleton
B. No skeleton
C. Exoskeletal structure
D. Entirely bony skeleton
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Sturgeons retain several primitive characters among the bony fishes. Along with other members of the subclass Chondrostei, they are unique among bony fishes because their skeletons are almost entirely cartilaginous.

text:
What type of life stages does this object undergo?
A. Metamorphosis from larva to adult
B. Binary fission
C. Complete metamorphosis with pupal stage
D. Partial metamorphosis with egg, nymph, and adult stages
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mantises go through three life stages: egg, nymph, and adult (mantises are among the hemimetabolous insects).

text:
What material is not typically used for making this object?
A. Microfiber
B. Cotton
C. Linen
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Dishcloths are typically made of cotton or other cloth, such as microfiber.

text:
Which of the following is not a recognized coat color for this object when registered under ANKC for show?
A. Fawn
B. Red
C. Yellow/Cream
D. Black
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Kelpies that are bred under the ANKC registrations are registered for show (Main Register) only in the following colours: Black, Chocolate, Red, Smoky Blue, Fawn, Black and Tan and Red and Tan.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object?
A. Fish and marine invertebrates
B. Small mammals and birds
C. Primarily fruits and vegetables supplemented with small rodents
D. Large wild hooved mammals and occasionally smaller animals or livestock
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mantises are generalist predators of arthropods. Larger mantises sometimes eat smaller individuals of their own species, as well as small vertebrates such as lizards, frogs, small birds and fishes.

text:
Which of the following species of this object is also known as 'snow morel'?
A. Gyromitra tasmanica
B. Gyromitra anthracobia
C. Gyromitra montana
D. Gyromitra perlata
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Gyromitra montana – North American snow morel, possibly a synonym of "G. gigas"

text:
What does the name of this object translate to in English?
A. Stick
B. Roll
C. Slice
D. Wave
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Although the word 'baguette' was not used to refer to a type of bread until 1920, the word itself simply means 'wand', 'baton' or 'stick'.

text:
What is the lifespan of this object when living in the wild?
A. Up to 30 years
B. Up to 10 years
C. Up to 40 years
D. Up to 20 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Baboons in captivity live up to 45 years, while in the wild they live up to 30 years.

text:
In which countries is this object commonly found?
A. Russia, Mongolia, China, and Japan
B. Malaysia, Indonesia, Philippines, and Thailand
C. India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and Bhutan
D. Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, and Fiji
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Indian cobra is native to the Indian subcontinent and can be found throughout India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and southern Nepal.

text:
What is the defining characteristic of this object's rig configuration?
A. The foremast being taller than the mainmast
B. The use of only lateen sails
C. The foremast being slightly shorter than the mainmast
D. The use of only square sails
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Typically it has two or more masts, the foremast being slightly shorter than the mainmast.

text:
Which of the following materials has NOT been traditionally used in the construction of this object?
A. Rubber
B. Glass
C. Plastic
D. Metal
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Domes have been constructed from mud, snow, stone, wood, brick, concrete, metal, glass, and plastic over the centuries.

text:
What is the primary use of this object in medical settings?
A. To deliver oxygen for therapy
B. To monitor heart rates
C. To reduce physical pain
D. To measure blood pressure
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Medical plastic oxygen masks are used primarily by medical care providers for oxygen therapy because they are disposable and so reduce cleaning costs and infection risks.

text:
How does this object primarily obtain its food?
A. Hunting in packs
B. Scavenging during the day
C. Eating primarily vegetation
D. Nocturnally hunting small animals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Jacamars are insectivores, taking a variety of insect prey by hawking in the air.

text:
What is the primary material used for this object when designed for swimming?
A. Silk
B. Cotton
C. Nylon
D. Polyester
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: though most are made of nylon with a mesh lining for quick drying.

text:
Where was a historic version of this object found?
A. In the remains of Herculaneum
B. Near the River Thames in London
C. In the catacombs of Paris
D. In the ruins of Athens
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A carbonized cradle was found in the remains of Herculaneum left from the destruction of the city by the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE.

text:
Which of the following elements must be included in a routine performed on this object at international competitions?
A. A forward roll
B. A pike jump
C. A split leap
D. An element in the upper arm position
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A parallel bar routine should contain at least one element from all element groups: II. Elements starting in upper arm position

text:
How does this object typically interact with its environment to feed?
A. Filtering food particles from water
B. Using teeth to chew food
C. Absorbing nutrients from the water
D. Capturing prey with tentacles
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Some sea cucumbers position themselves in currents and catch food that flows by with their open tentacles.

text:
Which of the following coat colors is NOT recognized by the AKC for this object?
A. Pure White
B. Belge
C. Red
D. Black and tan
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The FCI and KC breed standards specifies that the coat must be black, but the AKC also allows grey, silver, red, black and tan, and belge.

text:
What unique health condition is this object genetically predisposed to?
A. Hip dysplasia
B. Epilepsy
C. Deafness
D. Blindness
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A genetic predisposition for deafness is a serious health problem for Dalmatians.

text:
During which time period did the tunic dress, featuring this object that matched the length of the underskirt, become prevalent?
A. 1900 to 1935
B. 1650 to 1700
C. 1700 to 1740
D. 1815 to 1890
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Tunic dress—A tunic that reached below the waistline and which covered a dress or petticoat. The overskirt was the same length as the underskirt. It was popular in Europe and the Americas from 1815 to 1890.

text:
Regarding the breeding habits of this object, what is true?
A. They are monogamous but only for one season
B. They do not have a fixed mating pattern
C. They are monogamous for life
D. They are polygamous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Spoonbills are monogamous, but, so far as is known, only for one season at a time.

text:
Which feature of this object's sensory capabilities is most developed?
A. Electroreception
B. Auditory perception
C. Vision
D. Olfactory senses
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The platypus's electroreception is the most sensitive of any monotreme.

text:
In what era did the Italian nightgown, characterized by a stayed bodice and an almost skirt-long contrasting this object, become popular in the United Kingdom?
A. 1800s to 1850s
B. 1750s to 1790s
C. 1880s to 1920s
D. 1600s to 1650s
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Italian nightgown—Also known as an 'Italian robe' and 'Italian polonaise', this was an informal garment. This dress appeared in the United Kingdom from the 1750s to 1790s.

text:
What is the historical precursor of this object, particularly noted during the Renaissance period?
A. Cornett
B. Natural trumpet
C. Shawm
D. Sackbut
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: During the Renaissance, the equivalent English term was 'sackbut'.

text:
During which stages does this object live a primarily aquatic life?
A. Only as an adult
B. Only as a larva
C. Throughout its life
D. As a larva and an adult
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Newts metamorphose through three distinct developmental life stages: aquatic larva, terrestrial juvenile (eft), and adult.

text:
When was this object first documented for its intended use in China?
A. 14th century
B. 6th century AD
C. 19th century
D. 2nd century BC
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Although paper had been known as a wrapping and padding material in China since the 2nd century BC, the first documented use of toilet paper in human history dates back to the 6th century AD, in early medieval China.

text:
Which of the following functions is not commonly included in a digital version of this object?
A. Global positioning system
B. Date function
C. External sensor connectivity
D. Time-of-day function
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Because they contain a microchip, they often include date and time-of-day functions as well. Some may have a connector for external sensors...

text:
What is the primary habitat of this object's species found in Africa?
A. Deserts
B. Rainforest
C. Grasslands
D. Mountainous regions
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: While different species are found in a wide range of habitats, the African species are predominantly found in rainforest.

text:
Which category does this object belong to based on its morphological structure?
A. Agarics
B. Gasteromycetes
C. Polypores
D. Boletes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: "Bolete" is also the English common name for fungal species having this kind of morphology.

text:
When is National Day for this object celebrated in the United States?
A. July 4
B. September 18
C. November 28
D. December 25
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the United States, National Cheeseburger Day is celebrated annually on 18 September.

text:
How is this object primarily identified from photographs?
A. By the scars and patches from parasites
B. From distinctive fin markings
C. Using color variations on the belly
D. Through unique tail patterns
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Individual whales are typically identified using photographs of their dorsal surface and matching the scars and patches associated with parasites that have fallen off the whale or are still attached.

text:
What is the common Japanese name for this object, by which it is also known in the United States' supplement market?
A. Shiitake
B. Maitake
C. Umeboshi
D. Enoki
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the United States' supplement market, as well as in Asian grocery stores, the mushroom is known by its Japanese name maitake (舞茸, "dancing mushroom").

text:
What kind of switch mechanism might this object have if not directly attached to its body?
A. Motion detector
B. Timer
C. Remote control
D. Power cable switch
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Fixtures may also have a switch to control the light, either attached to the lamp body or attached to the power cable.

text:
Which evolutionary trait is evident in the physical build of this object?
A. It exhibits nocturnal characteristics
B. It has developed strong flying capabilities
C. It shows significant sexual dimorphism
D. It has adapted to aquatic environments
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In most bustards, males are substantially larger than females, often about 30% longer and sometimes more than twice the weight. They are among the most sexually dimorphic groups of birds.

text:
Regarding physical capacity, what is an exceptional feature of this object?
A. Exceptional digging ability
B. Able to jump exceptionally high
C. Capable of running at remarkable speeds
D. Capable of swimming long distances
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In 1996, The Guinness Book of Records listed a Saluki as being the fastest dog, capable of reaching a speed of 68.8 km/h.

text:
What are the common health issues that may affect this object's lifespan?
A. Common colds
B. Cancer and neurological disorders
C. Skin allergies
D. Mostly injury related
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The most common causes of death for the breed were cancer (28.3%), old age (24.6%), and neurological disorders (15.2%).

text:
What is unique about the physical features of this object's hind legs?
A. Unique double dewclaws
B. Presence of webbed feet
C. Extraordinarily long hind limbs
D. Absence of hind toes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: One singular characteristic of the Great Pyrenees is the unique double dewclaws on each hind leg.

text:
What unique genetic feature is found in the white color morph of this object?
A. A mutation in the MC1R gene
B. A mutation in the SLC45A2 gene
C. A recessive gene on the Y chromosome
D. An autosomal dominant trait
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The mutation changes a single amino acid in the transporter protein SLC45A2.

text:
Which country was the leading producer of this object in 2017?
A. Thailand
B. Brazil
C. Costa Rica
D. Philippines
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In 2017, world production of pineapples was 27.4 million tons, led by Costa Rica, the Philippines, Brazil, and Thailand as the largest producers.

text:
Which loom technique is used to produce this object?
A. Double weft integration
B. Dual-layer simultaneous weaving
C. Triple cross-thread knitting
D. Single warp weaving
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Velvet is woven on a special loom that weaves two thicknesses of the material at the same time.

text:
Which of the following health issues is NOT commonly found in this object?
A. Asthma
B. Hip dysplasia
C. Hypothyroidism
D. Progressive retinal atrophy
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: the breed has fewer genetic health problems than many breeds, but cases can be found of hypothyroidism, entropion, ectropion, distichiasis, skin problems including allergies, autoimmune problems including demodex, Addison's disease, Cushing's disease, missing teeth, malocclusion, cardiac problems, seizures, epilepsy, progressive retinal atrophy (PRA), cataracts, and small ear canals with a tendency for infection.

text:
What is the primary mode of locomotion for this object?
A. Hopping
B. Flying
C. Walking on all fours
D. Brachiation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Their primary mode of locomotion, brachiation, involves swinging from branch to branch.

text:
What is the scientific classification of this object?
A. Canis dingo
B. Felis catus
C. Canis lupus
D. Equus ferus caballus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The dingo (scientific name: 'Canis dingo', taxonomic classification: 'Canis familiaris', 'Canis familiaris dingo', 'Canis lupus dingo', or 'Canis dingo') is a dog that is found in Australia.

text:
What is the primary material composition of this object?
A. Magnesium sulfate
B. Organic plant fibers
C. Calcium carbonate
D. Silicate minerals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C

text:

text:

text:

D. Heliox
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

C. Migrates to warmer inland regions
D. Isolates itself in dense foliage
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The dunlin is highly gregarious in winter, sometimes forming large flocks on coastal mudflats or sandy beaches.

text:
What is a unique physical characteristic of this object compared to other lemurs?
A. It lacks hind limbs
B. It has blue fur
C. It has a rudimentary tail
D. It has a long, bushy tail
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Unlike any other living lemur, the indri has only a rudimentary tail.

text:
Which group is this object a part of according to the American Kennel Club?
A. Toy
B. Sporting
C. Non-Sporting
D. Herding
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Like most dogs of the American Kennel Club Sporting group, the Irish Water Spaniel is essentially an active, willing and energetic companion.

text:
Which of the following features is advisable to include in the construction of this object to prevent aid to predators?
A. Outside perches
B. Drainage holes
C. Bright colors
D. None of the above
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Nest boxes should be made from untreated wood with an overhanging, sloped roof, a recessed floor, drainage and ventilation holes, a way to access the interior for monitoring and cleaning, and have no outside perches which could assist predators.

text:
In terms of taxonomy, where are species resembling this object classified?
A. Gasteromycetes
B. Boletales
C. Polyporales
D. Agaricales
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The boletes are classified in the Boletales; however, not all members of that order are boletes.

text:
This object has an unusual anatomical feature in its neck. What is it?
A. Flexible joint allowing 270-degree rotation
B. Fusion of the first two neck vertebrae
C. Ability to extend its neck to twice its original length
D. Presence of four additional vertebrae compared to similar species
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: They are the only birds in which the first and second neck vertebrae (the atlas and axis respectively) are fused together; this probably provides a more stable platform for carrying the bill.

text:
What is the common Japanese name for this object, by which it is also known in the United States' supplement market?
A. Shiitake
B. Maitake
C. Umeboshi
D. Enoki
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the United States' supplement market, as well as in Asian grocery stores, the mushroom is known by its Japanese name maitake (舞茸, "dancing mushroom").

text:
What were the primary duties of this object when originally bred?
A. Companion pet
B. Bird hunting
C. Guarding
D. Ratting
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Brittany is a breed of gun dog bred primarily for bird hunting.

text:
In which setting are the 'variable-pitch' styles of this object used?
A. In residential ceiling installations
B. For industrial large-volume air displacement
C. In portable personal cooling devices
D. For precise control of static pressure within supply ducts
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A variable-pitch fan is used where precise control of static pressure within supply ducts is required.

text:
Regarding its conservation status, how is this object currently classified according to IUCN?
A. Critically Endangered
B. Endangered
C. Not Evaluated
D. Least Concern
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: This snake species is classified as Least Concern on the IUCN Red List (v3.1, 2001).

text:
What distinguishes this object from scooters in terms of physical and regulatory characteristics?
A. This object does not require any form of licensing or regulation.
B. This object tends to be less powerful and has pedals for propulsion.
C. This object tends to have a larger engine and no pedals.
D. This object is usually electric powered without any pedals.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Mopeds typically travel only a bit faster than bicycles on public roads, and possess both a motorcycle engine and pedals for propulsion. Mopeds are distinguished from scooters in that the latter tend to be more powerful and subject to more regulation.

text:
What is the primary function of this object when used in conjunction with a water distribution system?
A. To reserve water for non-potable uses
B. To beautify the urban landscape
C. To decrease water pressure
D. To pressurize the water distribution system
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A water tower is an elevated structure supporting a water tank constructed at a height sufficient to pressurize a water distribution system for the distribution of potable water, and to provide emergency storage for fire protection.

text:
Which family does this object belong to?
A. Cardinalidae
B. Passeridae
C. Fringillidae
D. Corvidae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family (family Brassicaceae, genus 'Brassica')

text:
In which of the following places is this object most popular as a men's swimsuit?
A. North America
B. Europe
C. Asia
D. South America
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Trunks are the most popular type of male swimsuit in North America.

text:
Which family does this object belong to?
A. Brassicaceae
B. Rosaceae
C. Asteraceae
D. Fabaceae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family (family Brassicaceae, genus 'Brassica')

text:
Under which law is this object protected in Malaysia?
A. Wildlife Protection Act
B. Forest Conservation Statute
C. Animal Rights and Welfare Legislation
D. Marine Wildlife Preservation Act
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In Malaysia, it is protected by a number of laws including the Wildlife Protection Act (federal law), the Wildlife Protection Ordinance 1998 (Chapter 26) and Wildlife Conservation Enactment 1997 (Sabah state law).

text:
What is a common ingredient found in this object?
A. Bentonite clay
B. Mineral oil
C. Aloe vera gel
D. Talcum powder
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: BULLET::::- Talcum powder

text:
What characteristic behavior does this object exhibit when threatened by predators?
A. Stotting
B. Swimming
C. Climbing
D. Hiding
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Like many other prey species, Tommies and springboks exhibit a distinctive behaviour of stotting (running and jumping high before fleeing) when they are threatened by predators.

text:
During the 1950s, what new type of fuel did these objects begin using more consistently for its advantages such as controllable flame and reduced odour?
A. Alcohol
B. Butane
C. Naphtha
D. Propane
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the 1950s, there was a switch in the fuel of choice from naphtha to butane, as butane allows for a controllable flame and has less odour.

text:
What is the general habitat depth range where this object can be found?
A. 50 to 100 meters
B. Surface to 50 meters
C. 100 to 200 meters
D. Above low tide line to 200 meters
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Rock crabs live over a large depth range, from well above the low tide line to as deep as 200 meters.

text:
What genetic condition is known to affect some of these objects, as noted within the related research?
A. Canine cyclic neutropenia or Grey Collie Syndrome
B. Hip dysplasia commonly found in large breeds
C. Progressive retinal atrophy, leading to blindness
D. High prevalence of congenital heart defects
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Collies may have a genetic disease, na canine cyclic neutropenia, or Grey Collie Syndrome.

text:
What is the typical preparation method for this object in a home kitchen?
A. Grilled on a barbecue
B. In a skillet over a stovetop
C. Deep fried in oil
D. Cooked in a slow cooker
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Pot pie can be prepared in a number of ways including in a skillet over a stovetop, in a baking dish in an oven, or in a Mountain Pie Iron over a campfire.

text:
During what period do females of this object typically give birth?
A. During the rainy season
B. Only in winter months
C. Continuously throughout the year
D. During the dry season
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Females give birth to young during the rainy season, after a 150- to 170-day gestation.

text:
Which term is NOT commonly used to refer to a person who plays this object?
A. Flutist
B. Harmonist
C. Flautist
D. Fluter
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A musician who plays the flute can be referred to as a flute player, flautist, flutist, less commonly, fluter or flutenist.

text:
What adaptation does this object have to prevent sand and dust from entering its eyes during strong windstorms?
A. Ability to retract its eyes
B. Bushy eyebrows and a double row of eyelashes
C. A transparent third eyelid
D. Moisture-absorbing eye sockets
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The bushy eyebrows and the double row of eyelashes prevent sand and dust from entering the eyes during strong windstorms.

text:
What type of coat does this object have?
A. Thick and double-layered
B. Sparse and rough
C. Silky and often wavy or slightly curly
D. Short and smooth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Shelties have a double coat, which means that they have two layers of fur that make up their coat.

text:
During what period do females of this object typically give birth?
A. During the rainy season
B. Only in winter months
C. Continuously throughout the year
D. During the dry season
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Females give birth to young during the rainy season, after a 150- to 170-day gestation.

text:
Which of the following elements must be included in a routine performed on this object at international competitions?
A. A forward roll
B. A pike jump
C. A split leap
D. An element in the upper arm position
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A parallel bar routine should contain at least one element from all element groups: II. Elements starting in upper arm position

text:
Which substance was historically used to decrease friction on the bottom of this object?
A. Mineral grease
B. Animal fat
C. Beeswax
D. Vegetable oil
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The long ski supporting the weight of the skier was treated with animal fat in a similar manner to modern ski waxing.

text:
Which of the following best describes the physical characteristics of this object's carapace?
A. Thick, leathery skin with embedded minuscule osteoderms
B. Smooth and soft with no distinct textures
C. Highly flexible with a rubber-like consistency
D. Covered with hard, bony scutes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Instead of scutes, it has thick, leathery skin with embedded minuscule osteoderms.

text:
What is the typical body length of mature female specimens of this object?
A. 0.5 to 1.5 inches
B. 1.0 to 1.5 inches
C. 1.5 to 2.0 inches
D. 2.0 to 3.5 inches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The body length (excluding legs) of the mature female is 1.0 to 1.5 cm.

text:
How is this object generally described in terms of its reproduction?
A. Polygamous
B. It reproduces asexually
C. Polyandrous
D. Monogamous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The bulbuls are generally monogamous.

text:
Which of the following historical functions did not describe the role of this object in ancient cultures?
A. Used for fur and clothing
B. Spiritual protector in the afterlife
C. Guardian of homes
D. Sacrificial animal in ceremonies
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In ancient times the Xolos were often sacrificed and then buried with their owners to act as guide to the soul on its journey to the underworld.

text:
What is the median lifespan of this object, according to a health survey mentioned?
A. 13.6 years
B. 10.5 years
C. 15.2 years
D. 11.8 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Basenjis in the 2004 UK Kennel Club survey had a median lifespan of 13.6 years

text:
Where did this object originate?
A. Kent, England
B. Brittany, France
C. Bavaria, Germany
D. Normandy, France
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The name "Brittany" is taken from the Brittany region in northwestern France where the dog originated.

text:
What is primarily the diet of this object?
A. Insectivorous, primarily feeding on insects
B. Carnivorous, consuming mainly meats
C. Frugivorous, mainly consuming fruits
D. Herbivorous, mainly consuming plants but occasionally small animals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: They are largely herbivorous, but occasionally also eat small animal food.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object in its natural habitat?
A. Insects and small birds
B. Fish and aquatic creatures
C. Fruits and vegetation
D. Small to mid-sized mammals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: It feeds on a wide range of animals from white-tailed deer, reindeer, roe deer, small red deer, and chamois, to smaller, more usual prey: snowshoe hares, fish, foxes, sheep, squirrels, mice, turkeys and other birds, and goats.

text:
Which of the following is not a traditional purpose of this object?
A. Commemorate ancestral lineage
B. Used as a weapon during conflicts
C. Act as a mortuary vessel
D. Serve as a functional architectural feature
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The poles may also serve as functional architectural features, welcome signs for village visitors, mortuary vessels for the remains of deceased ancestors, or as a means to publicly ridicule someone.

text:
Which area is not a leading producer of this object as of 2017?
A. China
B. India
C. Brazil
D. Italy
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In 2017, 73 million tonnes of oranges were grown worldwide, with Brazil producing 24% of the world total, followed by China and India.

text:
Which type of trials is this object known to participate in due to its physical capabilities?
A. Tracking events
B. Retrieval trials
C. Lure coursing events
D. Herding trials
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Afghan hounds are frequent participants in lure coursing events and are also popular in the sport of conformation showing.

text:
How has this object been generally used in terms of dress code?
A. Strictly as outdoor winter apparel
B. Predominantly in formal business settings
C. Mainly as ceremonial clothing
D. As athletic wear to raise the core body temperature
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A sweatshirt worn with sweatpants forms a sweatsuit, an exercise outfit designed to raise the core body temperature and cause perspiration in order to lose body weight before a weigh-in for a weight-divided sport.

text:
Which of the following is NOT a true characteristic of this object as a surname?
A. They have not been domesticated
B. Their young can fend for themselves soon after birth
C. They generally live in warrens
D. The European species can run up to 70 km/h
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: All rabbits (except the cottontail rabbits) live underground in burrows or warrens, while hares (and cottontail rabbits) live in simple nests above the ground, and usually do not live in groups.

text:
Which country is credited with the origin of this object?
A. Australia
B. United States
C. France
D. United Kingdom
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The Granny Smith Cultivar originated in Eastwood, New South Wales, Australia in 1868.

text:
Where does this object originate from?
A. The Scottish Highlands
B. The Swiss Alps
C. The Lake District in England
D. Welsh Countryside
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Lakeland Terrier is a dog breed, which takes its name from its place of origin, the Lake District in England.

text:
What best describes the habitat of this object?
A. Deserts and temperate forests
B. Mountaintop ice fields
C. Strictly aquatic environments
D. Deep oceanic trenches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Porcupines occupy a short range of habitats in tropical and temperate parts of Asia, Southern Europe, Africa, and North and South America. They live in forests and deserts.

text:
What is the primary reason for this object being originally bred?
A. For companionship
B. For sports like racing
C. For guarding and protection
D. For herding livestock
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: As a personal protection dog, the Dobermann was originally bred for these traits: it had to be large and intimidating, fearless, and willing to defend its owner from attackers.

text:
What is the primary material used in the construction of this object?
A. Clay
B. Stone
C. Wood
D. Metal
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The archetypical drumstick is turned from a single piece of wood, most commonly of hickory.

text:
Which material is NOT commonly used to construct this object?
A. Polyester
B. Cotton
C. Polyethylene
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mosquito netting can be made from cotton, polyethylene, polyester, polypropylene, or nylon.

text:
This object is closely related to which of the following geographical features?
A. Rivers and lakes
B. Plateaus and plains
C. Headlands and bays
D. Mountains and valleys
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: See also: Headlands and bays

text:
Which family does this object belong to?
A. Brassicaceae
B. Rosaceae
C. Asteraceae
D. Fabaceae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family (family Brassicaceae, genus 'Brassica')

text:
What illegal activity involving this object is mentioned as being unethical and cruel?
A. Illegal hunting for fur
B. Use in traditional medicine
C. Organized fights with snakes
D. Pet trade smuggling
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Snake charmers keep mongooses for mock fights with snakes. This practice is looked at as unethical and cruel across the rest of the world.

text:
What social structure does this object typically exhibit?
A. Small groups of 6-15 animals with a mix of males and females
B. Large herds with complex hierarchies
C. Pairs
D. Solitary
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Most howler species live in groups of six to 15 animals, with one to three adult males and multiple females.

text:
Traditionally, what primary function did this object serve?
A. Shepherding
B. Companionship
C. Hunting
D. Guarding
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Borzois were bred to pursue or 'course' game

text:
How has this object been generally used in terms of dress code?
A. Strictly as outdoor winter apparel
B. Predominantly in formal business settings
C. Mainly as ceremonial clothing
D. As athletic wear to raise the core body temperature
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A sweatshirt worn with sweatpants forms a sweatsuit, an exercise outfit designed to raise the core body temperature and cause perspiration in order to lose body weight before a weigh-in for a weight-divided sport.

text:
Which conservation status has been assigned to this object by the IUCN?
A. Data Deficient
B. Vulnerable
C. Least Concern
D. Endangered
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Since 1998, the black stork has been rated as a species of least concern on the IUCN Red List of Endangered Species.

text:
What was used to protect this object against the heat of reentry into the Earth's atmosphere?
A. Titanium alloy plates
B. Ablative heat shield
C. Ceramic tiles
D. Reinforced carbon-carbon
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: NASA experienced significant delays in the development of the Space Shuttle's thermal protection system... NASA chose to use ceramic tiles for thermal protection.

text:
Which characteristic describes the larval stage of this object?
A. Larvae are herbivorous.
B. Larvae are aquatic.
C. Larvae are winged.
D. Larvae live in cylindrical burrows up to a meter deep.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The larvae of tiger beetles live in cylindrical burrows as much as a meter deep.

text:
Which description best matches the coloration of this object?
A. Predominantly green and white with smooth legs
B. Predominantly red and blue with spotted legs
C. Predominantly yellow and brown with striped legs
D. Completely black with no distinctive marks
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Barn spiders are predominantly yellow and brown in coloration with striped legs.

text:
What is the primary method of prey incapacitation used by this object?
A. Venom injection
B. Constriction
C. Stunning with its tail
D. Biting and shaking
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The boa first strikes at the prey, grabbing it with its teeth; it then proceeds to constrict the prey until death before consuming it whole.

text:
Which of these materials is commonly used for making this object?
A. Coir
B. Porcelain
C. Glass fibers
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Doormats are usually made from tough, long-lasting material such as coir, palmyra (palm) fibres and stalks, nylon, rubber, cloth, or aluminium and other metals.

text:
Which evolutionary trait is evident in the physical build of this object?
A. It exhibits nocturnal characteristics
B. It has developed strong flying capabilities
C. It shows significant sexual dimorphism
D. It has adapted to aquatic environments
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In most bustards, males are substantially larger than females, often about 30% longer and sometimes more than twice the weight. They are among the most sexually dimorphic groups of birds.

text:
What is the primary material composition of this object?
A. Magnesium sulfate
B. Organic plant fibers
C. Calcium carbonate
D. Silicate minerals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: As the name implies, coral reefs are made up of coral skeletons from mostly intact coral colonies. As other chemical elements present in corals become incorporated into the calcium carbonate deposits, aragonite is formed.

text:
Regarding its conservation status, how is this object currently classified according to IUCN?
A. Critically Endangered
B. Endangered
C. Not Evaluated
D. Least Concern
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: This snake species is classified as Least Concern on the IUCN Red List (v3.1, 2001).

text:
What is a specialized use of this object in a medical setting?
A. For patient meals
B. For administering medications
C. For carrying surgical instruments
D. For storing medical records
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Surgical trays are used to carry surgical instruments, are rectangular and made of stainless steel to resist the heat of sterilization without corrosion.

text:
Which of the following features was introduced by Philips in the development of this object?
A. Eight-to-fourteen modulation (EFM)
B. Diagonal error correction
C. Anti-shock buffering
D. Cross-interleaved Reed-Solomon Coding (CIRC)
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Philips also contributed eight-to-fourteen modulation (EFM), which offers a certain resilience to defects such as scratches and fingerprints.

text:
How is this object classified in dog competitions in the United States?
A. Sporting group
B. Herding group
C. Toy group
D. Non-sporting group
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: English Setters are classified within the gundog group in the UK and the Sporting group in America and Canada.

text:
Which of the following does NOT correctly describe the larvae of this object?
A. They primarily infect aquatic plants
B. They are known as roundheaded borers
C. Occasionally, they can damage wood in buildings
D. They bore into wood, causing damage
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The larvae, called roundheaded borers, bore into wood, where they can cause extensive damage

text:
What significant development in this object's use occurred during the year 1878-79?
A. It was used for the first time in Olympic sports
B. It was first utilized in theatrical sound effects
C. It became a standard tool in automated manufacturing processes
D. It replaced handkerchiefs for signaling in football matches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: This became the first referee object used at association football matches during the 1878-79 Football Association Cup match.

text:
How is this object's coat typically maintained if not shown in conformation shows?
A. Naturally shed
B. No grooming required
C. Clipped
D. Regular shaving
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: However, if they are not shown, Sealyhams can be clipped and this is often the preferred grooming approach for pets.

text:
Which style of this object, used by servers for efficient operation and showmanship, was patented by Karl Wienke in 1882?
A. Winged corkscrew
B. Sommelier knife
C. Mounted corkscrew
D. Lever corkscrew
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A sommelier knife, waiter's friend or wine key is a corkscrew in a folding body similar to a pocket knife. It was conceived by the German Karl Wienke in 1882 and patented in Germany, England, and America.

text:
For what purpose are this object's variants with grids used?
A. To filter finer particles
B. To enhance visibility under a microscope
C. To measure the density of cultures
D. To maintain constant temperature
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Petri dishes may have grids printed on the bottom to help measuring the density of cultures.

text:
What is the primary material used in the construction of this object?
A. Metal and leather
B. Plastic and fabric
C. Wood and canvas
D. Bamboo and silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The archetypical drumstick is turned from a single piece of wood, most commonly of hickory.

text:
What is the primary material used in the construction of this object?
A. Plastic
B. Bamboo
C. Hickory
D. Steel
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The archetypical drumstick is turned from a single piece of wood, most commonly of hickory.

text:
Which country is credited with the invention of this object?
A. France
B. Germany
C. United States
D. United Kingdom
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The development of pencil sharpeners began in France.

text:
Which country was the leading producer of this object in 2017?
A. Thailand
B. Brazil
C. Costa Rica
D. Philippines
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In 2017, world production of pineapples was 27.4 million tons, led by Costa Rica, the Philippines, Brazil, and Thailand as the largest producers.

text:
What is a specific grooming need of this object?
A. Minimal brushing and no need for shampoo
B. Daily brushing and regular shampooing
C. Regular clipping of its long coat
D. Seasonal shedding management
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The coat requires quite a lot of regular grooming and shampooing to retain its silkiness.

text:
Which is NOT a name used to describe a group of these objects?
A. Pack
B. Mob
C. Wisdom
D. Colony
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A group of wombats is known as a wisdom, a mob, or a colony.

text:
What is the structure of the frame of this object?
A. A circular rim usually made of wood
B. An oval shaped rim commonly made of fiberglass
C. A triangular frame often made of metal
D. A rectangular body typically made of plastic
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The body, or 'pot', of a modern banjo typically consists of a circular rim (generally made of wood, though metal was also common on older banjos)...

text:
What major health issue is this object most likely to develop according to the data?
A. Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
B. Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM)
C. Hypothyroidism
D. Hip dysplasia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Dilated cardiomyopathy is a major cause of death in Dobermanns. This disease affects the breed more than any other.

text:
What special characteristic does this object's venom have?
A. It is extremely potent and dangerous to humans
B. It is acidic and causes burns
C. It contains a mild neurotoxin
D. It is primarily used to digest food
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Garter snakes were long thought to be nonvenomous, but discoveries in the early 2000s revealed that they in fact produce a neurotoxic venom. Despite this, garter snakes cannot seriously injure or kill humans with the small amounts of comparatively mild venom they produce.

text:
What is the primary reproductive mode utilized by this object's genus?
A. Obligate parthenogenesis
B. Sexual reproduction with both male and female
C. Budding
D. Spore formation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: These all-female species reproduce by obligate parthenogenesis.

text:

B. Progressive retinal atrophy
C. Von Willebrand's disease
D. Elbow dysplasia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Commonly, Pembrokes can suffer from monorchidism, Von Willebrand's disease, hip dysplasia, degenerative myelopathy (DM), and inherited eye problems such as progressive retinal atrophy.

text:
How is this object classified in dog competitions in the United States?
A. Sporting group
B. Herding group
C. Toy group
D. Non-sporting group
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A

text:
Which predator is known to prey on the larvae of this object after eggs are laid in flowers?
A. Coccinella septempunctata
B. Polistes carolina
C. Formica rufa
D. Apis mellifera
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Some species of wasps, such as "Polistes carolina", have been known to prey upon Chrysomelidae larvae after the eggs are laid in flowers.

text:
During what season does the commercial fishing for this object peak in Alaska?
A. Summer
B. Fall
C. Winter
D. Spring
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Alaskan king crab fishing is carried out during the fall months in the waters off the coast of Alaska and the Aleutian Islands.

text:
This object is frequently used in a specific religious practice in Christian churches. What is this practice?

B. Baptismal rites
C. Confessional practices
D. Seating of bishops or higher-ranking officials
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D

text:
What is the primary reproductive mode utilized by this object's genus?
A. Obligate parthenogenesis
B. Sexual reproduction with both male and female
C. Budding
D. Spore formation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: These all-female species reproduce by obligate parthenogenesis.

text:

A. Easter
B. Christmas
C. Super Bowl Sunday
D. Thanksgiving
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

A. North America
B. Europe
C. Asia
D. South America
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: Trunks are the most popular type of male swimsuit in North America.

text:
From which two Latin words is the term for this object derived, and what do they mean?

C. Vectis - lever, Durus - hard

Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

text:

B. Carboniferous period
C. Triassic period
D. Jurassic period
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: Ants evolved from wasp-like ancestors in the Cretaceous period, about 140 million years ago, and diversified after the rise of flowering plants.

text:
During which time period did the tunic dress, featuring this object that matched the length of the underskirt, become prevalent?
A. 1900 to 1935
B. 1650 to 1700
C. 1700 to 1740
D. 1815 to 1890
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Tunic dress—A tunic that reached below the waistline and which covered a dress or petticoat. The overskirt was the same length as the underskirt. It was popular in Europe and the Americas from 1815 to 1890.

text:

B. Northern Germany
C. Western Austria
D. Southern German areas
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: The pretzel has been in use as an emblem of bakers and formerly their guilds in southern German areas since at least the 12th century.

text:
Which of the following activities is this object NOT commonly used for?

B. Herding
C. Mountain rescue
D. Police work
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: The breed is used as a working dog for tasks including detection of odors such as explosives, accelerants (for arson investigation), and narcotics; tracking humans for suspect apprehension in police work; and search and rescue missions.

text:
In addition to its primary function, this object may sometimes double as which of the following?

B. A wallet
C. A sewing kit
D. A makeup bag

text:

text:
How does this object primarily defend itself against predators like tigers?

C. By running away swiftly
D. By charging and crying loudly

text:

B. The Industrial Revolution
C. The Roaring Twenties
D. The Hippie Era
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. Oak

D. Birch

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

B. Horsehide and cowhide

D. Sheepskin and deerskin

text:

B. Racing
C. Herding
D. Swimming

text:

A. 1965
B. 1950
C. 1945
D. 1936

text:

D. To measure blood pressure
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. Kangaroos

D. Nile crocodiles

text:

C. Wood and canvas
D. Bamboo and silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: The archetypical drumstick is turned from a single piece of wood, most commonly of hickory.

text:
As of the data available, how many extant species does the family of this object have?
A. Three
B. Five
C. Four
D. Six
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: With only four extant species (in three genera), it is the fifth-smallest biological family in the Carnivora.

text:

text:

D. It emits a loud sound to scare off predators

text:

text:
What is the primary material this object is designed to work with?
A. Metal
B. Stone
C. Wood
D. Plastic
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A hatchet (from the Old French , a diminutive form of "hache", 'axe' of Germanic origin) is a single-handed striking tool with a sharp blade on one side used to cut and split wood...

text:
What mathematical concept does this object exemplify through its shape?
A. Least surface area for a given volume
B. Constant volume displacement
C. Optimal gas exchange ratio
D. Maximum volume enclosure
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: will assume the shape of least surface area possible containing a given volume.

text:
Which area was this object predicted to spread to from its current areas of inhabitance?
A. Australia and New Zealand
B. Canada and the United States
C. Scandinavia
D. South America
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: it was predicted to spread to Australia and New Zealand

text:

B. In large groups
C. In nuclear families
D. Solitary
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: They live in groups, but in different group forms.

text:

text:

text:
In terms of social structure, what trait is significant about this object?
A. It forms highly social groups where a female dominates.
B. It is known for being solitary and rarely interacts with others of its kind.
C. It establishes a male-dominant hierarchy within its group.
D. It engages in monogamous relationships that last a lifetime.
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: The ring-tailed lemur is highly social, living in groups of up to 30 individuals. It is also female dominant, a trait common among lemurs.

text:

D. Its body temperature is the highest among primates.

text:

B. It flies with its neck retracted.
C. It cannot fly.
D. It flies with its neck fully extended.
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

A. Germany
B. England
C. China
D. Russia

text:

C. A metal box used on trains for goods transit
D. A woven basket used by farmers for crop collection

text:
In what century were shaving versions of this object developed?
A. 19th Century
B. 18th Century
C. 20th Century
D. 16th Century
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

text:

B. Boiled leather
C. Plastic
D. Metal

text:
During what season does the commercial fishing for this object peak in Alaska?
A. Summer
B. Fall
C. Winter
D. Spring
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Alaskan king crab fishing is carried out during the fall months in the waters off the coast of Alaska and the Aleutian Islands.

text:
Which of the following historical functions did not describe the role of this object in ancient cultures?
A. Used for fur and clothing
B. Spiritual protector in the afterlife
C. Guardian of homes
D. Sacrificial animal in ceremonies
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In ancient times the Xolos were often sacrificed and then buried with their owners to act as guide to the soul on its journey to the underworld.

text:
When did the transition from the term 'brassiere' to this object's modern name occur?
A. Early 1900s
B. 1930s
C. Late 1800s
D. 1950s
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: In the 1930s "brassiere" was gradually shortened to "bra".

text:
Which type of propellants were popularly used in this object following the phase-out of CFCs?

text:
Which state has named this object as the official state bird, without specifying the particular kind?
A. Maine
B. Minnesota
C. Michigan
D. Massachusetts
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Maine has named the chickadee as the official state bird, but never specified which particular kind of chickadee.

text:
Which state has named this object as the official state bird, without specifying the particular kind?
A. Maine
B. Minnesota
C. Michigan
D. Massachusetts
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Maine has named the chickadee as the official state bird, but never specified which particular kind of chickadee.

text:
Which technique is employed when the base of this object does not match the plan of the supporting walls?
A. Corbelling
B. Tensioning
C. Cantilevering
D. Compression fitting
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: One technique is to use corbelling, progressively projecting horizontal layers from the top of the supporting wall to the base of the dome.

text:
What is a specific grooming need of this object?

D. Seasonal shedding management
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B

text:
What are the particular spots on the back of this object's ears thought to play a role in?
A. Camouflage
B. Communication
C. Hunting
D. Attracting mates

text:
What is the traditional shape of this object?
A. A single loop

wiki: The traditional pretzel shape is a distinctive symmetrical form...

text:
What characteristic evolved in the design of this object by the middle of the 18th century?

B. Integration with digital technology
C. Simpler, more compact designs
D. Especially elaborate doors
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
What kind of switch mechanism might this object have if not directly attached to its body?

D. Power cable switch

text:
Which device implemented in this object uses wind pressure to amplify the force exerted by the player's fingers?

C. Silent movie lever
D. Electric action
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
What is a feature of the modern versions of this object that differs from earlier designs?

C. Made purely from organic materials
D. Incorporates a retractable razor blade
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
Which of these vehicles is historically associated as a precursor to the modern design of this object?

wiki: The 1956-1969 Fiat Multipla also had many features in common with modern minivans. The Multipla was based on the chassis of the Fiat 600 and had a rear engine and cab forward layout.

text:

B. Swimming
C. Climbing
D. Hiding

text:
Which description best fits the natural habitat of this object?
A. Rivers, lakes, and mangrove swamps
B. Deserts and arid regions
C. Tropical rainforests
D. Deep oceanic waters
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The common hippo inhabits rivers, lakes and mangrove swamps...

text:
In addition to its primary function, this object may sometimes double as which of the following?
A. A mobile phone case
B. A wallet
C. A sewing kit
D. A makeup bag
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Some pencil cases double as make up bags.

text:
Which of the following physical features is NOT common between the North American and Eurasian species of this object?
A. Size of nasal bones
B. Number of toes
C. Color of fur
D. Shape of the tail
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Although superficially similar to each other, there are several important differences between the two species. Fur colour is also different.

text:
What is the structure of the frame of this object?
A. A circular rim usually made of wood
B. An oval shaped rim commonly made of fiberglass
C. A triangular frame often made of metal
D. A rectangular body typically made of plastic
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A

text:
Which term derives from the Dharug language and describes this object frequently seen in Australia?

B. Emu
C. Wallaby
D. Wombat
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The name 'wallaby' comes from Dharug 'walabi' or 'waliba'.

text:
Which life stage is NOT part of this object's lifecycle?
A. Adult
B. Nymph
C. Larva
D. Pupal
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
How does this object ensure its eggs receive enough oxygen?

B. Symbiotic algae within the eggs photosynthesize and produce oxygen
C. Parental care includes regularly moving eggs to the water surface
D. The eggs possess lungs for direct air breathing

text:
What is the recommended way to measure the effective protection provided by this object?
A. The Sun Protection Factor (SPF) rating
B. The Protection Grade of UVA (PA) system
C. The Persistent Pigment Darkening (PPD) method
D. The Ultraviolet Protection Factor (UPF) rating
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. Screwing
C. Clamp
D. Pouch

text:

text:
Which of these was NOT a common reason for this object's decline in residential use?

C. Structural damage from natural disasters

text:

C. Topknot of hair
D. Elongated body

text:
This object is commonly used for which of the following cooking methods?
A. Steaming
B. Frying
C. Deep frying
D. Poaching

wiki: A frying pan, frypan, or skillet is a flat-bottomed pan used for frying, searing, and browning foods.

text:
This object's ancestry includes which types of breeds?

C. Siberian Huskies and Alaskan Malamutes
D. Labradors and Golden Retrievers
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

text:

C. All of the above
D. As a bulletproof vest
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A

text:

C. Acting as a mobile command center
D. Carrying soldiers to the front line in a battle
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

A. 1916
B. 1886
C. 1923
D. 1963
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

text:

B. Cone
C. Cylinder
D. Sphere

text:
What is the average lifespan of this object in the wild?

D. Around 9 years

wiki: Their average lifespan is 9 years with 19 years and 2 months being the longest recorded.

text:

B. Southeast Asia

D. Europe

B. Vikings
C. Zulu
D. Inca
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

A. Yellow
B. Dark green
C. White
D. Red

text:

B. Canada
C. United States
D. Australia
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

text:

C. Webbed feet

Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B

text:

B. Toshiba
C. Sony
D. Panasonic
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. For regulating body temperature
C. For digging up roots
D. For defensive purposes against predators

text:

B. Plastic and fabric
C. Wood and canvas
D. Bamboo and silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. Herding
C. Mountain rescue
D. Police work
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The breed is used as a working dog for tasks including detection of odors such as explosives, accelerants (for arson investigation), and narcotics; tracking humans for suspect apprehension in police work; and search and rescue missions.

text:
Which gene mutation has led to the creation of white-colored individuals of this object?
A. TYRP1 gene mutation
B. ASIP gene mutation
C. SLC45A2 gene mutation
D. MC1R gene mutation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Although this is consistent with albinism, the proper characterization of the mutation is currently unknown. The animals are commonly known as tyrosinase-positive albinoids, lacking melanin in oculocutaneous structures. This condition is caused by a partial deletion in the SLC45A2 gene.

text:
What is the typical color of the flower heads of this object when fully developed?
A. Yellow
B. Dark green
C. White
D. Red
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Broccoli has large flower heads, usually dark green in color

text:

B. It spins

text:

B. Aztec
C. Moche people of ancient Peru

text:

text:

text:

B. Leg support
C. Platform
D. Forearm

text:

text:

D. It is used as a string instrument.
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

C. 65 km/h
D. 55 km/h

text:

Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
Which of the following features was introduced by Philips in the development of this object?

C. Anti-shock buffering
D. Cross-interleaved Reed-Solomon Coding (CIRC)

text:

C. 20-22 cm
D. 33-35 cm
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A

text:
Which type of this object is primarily used by individuals with long-term disabilities outside of Europe?

C. Platform
D. Forearm

text:

text:
What distinct tail feature does this object commonly have according to American breeding standards?

text:

text:

D. Silicate minerals

text:

A. Cluster
B. Flight
C. Pack
D. Mob
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. Berries

text:

B. Oak
C. Cedar
D. Birch

text:
What physical characteristic is common to this object?

text:

B. Polyvinyl chloride (PVC)

text:
Which of the following is NOT a feature introduced in the third-generation of this object according to the device's history?

B. External headphone amplifier
C. Weak bass response
D. Wi-Fi connectivity
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. San Francisco
C. Cairo
D. Tokyo

text:

text:

text:

text:
Which of the following best describes the technological evolution of this object from the 1990s to early 2000s?

text:

text:
