text:
What primary function does this object serve in the mining industry?
A. Transporting minerals to the surface
B. Exploring mineral deposits and structural geology
C. Refining extracted materials
D. Operating as a lift system for miners
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Mining drilling rigs are used for two main purposes, exploration drilling which aims to identify the location and quality of a mineral, and production drilling, used in the production-cycle for mining.

text:
Which technique is employed when the base of this object does not match the plan of the supporting walls?
A. Corbelling
B. Tensioning
C. Cantilevering
D. Compression fitting
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: One technique is to use corbelling, progressively projecting horizontal layers from the top of the supporting wall to the base of the dome.

text:
What was an unconventional but historical use of this object as a symbol at public events?
A. A token of surrender
B. A signal of approval
C. An object for barter
D. A sign of mourning
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: From the late 18th century white handkerchiefs were waved, generally by women (men usually waved their hats), to demonstrate approval at public events such as processions or political rallies.

text:
Which of the following is a traditional method of seasoning or modifying this object?
A. Drenching in vinegar
B. Frying in animal fat
C. Soaking in wine
D. Topping with seeds and melting cheese
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Often, they are sliced horizontally, buttered, and sold as 'Butterbrezel', or come with slices of cold meats or cheese. Sesame, poppy, sunflower, pumpkin, or caraway seeds, melted cheese, and bacon bits are other popular toppings.

text:
What ancient device inspired the concept behind this object?
A. Sundials
B. Levers
C. Catapults
D. Aqueducts
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The ancient Greeks used aqueducts and gravity-powered fountains to distribute water.

text:
Which style of this object, used by servers for efficient operation and showmanship, was patented by Karl Wienke in 1882?
A. Winged corkscrew
B. Sommelier knife
C. Mounted corkscrew
D. Lever corkscrew
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A sommelier knife, waiter's friend or wine key is a corkscrew in a folding body similar to a pocket knife. It was conceived by the German Karl Wienke in 1882 and patented in Germany, England, and America.

text:
What typically distinguishes this object visually in its placement within a room?
A. Against a wall opposite the door or windows
B. Under a staircase
C. Placed centrally in the room
D. Next to a fireplace
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: China cabinets are typically placed against a wall, opposite the door or windows.

text:
Which of the following best describes the origin and development of this object?
A. Originated in Southeast Asia and developed in the Mediterranean region
B. Has its ancestry in the Americas and was later cultivated in northern Italy
C. Developed in South America and brought to North America in the 20th century
D. Native to Northern Europe and popularized in the Americas during the colonial period
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Zucchini, like all squash, has its ancestry in the Americas, specifically Mesoamerica. However, the varieties of green, cylindrical squash harvested immature and typically called 'zucchini' were cultivated in northern Italy.

text:
How is the fur of this object described?
A. Short, coloured black at the shoulders and yellowish orange on its back
B. Spotted with green patches
C. Long and woolly
D. Completely white to blend in with snowy environments
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A squirrel monkey's fur is short and close, coloured black at the shoulders and yellowish orange on its back and extremities.

text:
What is the primary nesting choice of this object?
A. On the ground
B. In shallow water
C. In high rocky cliffs
D. In trees
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: They nest on the ground and have a diet consisting of seeds, grapes and insects.

text:
What characteristic dental feature is most prominent in this object for processing its typical diet?
A. Underdeveloped molars
B. Powerful carnassials
C. Multiple sets of teeth
D. Long, sharp incisors
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The carnassials, especially the upper, are very powerful and are shifted far back to the point of exertion of peak pressure on the jaws.

text:
This object often contains which of the following materials to absorb impact?
A. Metal shavings
B. Grains, sand, rags
C. Liquid gel
D. Air only
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Punching bags are often filled with grains, sand, rags, or other material...

text:
What primary material was this object traditionally made from in ancient times?
A. Clay
B. Metal
C. Calabash
D. Stone
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In ancient times ladles were often made from plants such as calabash (bottle gourd) or even sea-shells.

text:
How does this object achieve locomotion?
A. By swimming using fins
B. By crawling using tentacles
C. Via flagellar motion
D. By creeping on a pedal disc
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Sea anemones can move however, being able to creep around on their bases.

text:
In which habitats can this object typically be found?
A. Urban areas and city parks
B. Forests and woodlands
C. Deserts and polar ice caps
D. Open oceans and beaches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Echidnas are found in forests and woodlands, hiding under vegetation, roots or piles of debris.

text:
What kind of feeding habit is exhibited by all species of this object?
A. Herbivorous
B. Omnivorous
C. Parasitic
D. Carnivorous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Adult and larval leaf beetles feed on all sorts of plant tissue, and all species are fully herbivorous.

text:
Which of these materials is commonly used for making this object?
A. Coir
B. Porcelain
C. Glass fibers
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Doormats are usually made from tough, long-lasting material such as coir, palmyra (palm) fibres and stalks, nylon, rubber, cloth, or aluminium and other metals.

text:
Which of the following health issues is NOT commonly found in this object?
A. Asthma
B. Hip dysplasia
C. Hypothyroidism
D. Progressive retinal atrophy
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: the breed has fewer genetic health problems than many breeds, but cases can be found of hypothyroidism, entropion, ectropion, distichiasis, skin problems including allergies, autoimmune problems including demodex, Addison's disease, Cushing's disease, missing teeth, malocclusion, cardiac problems, seizures, epilepsy, progressive retinal atrophy (PRA), cataracts, and small ear canals with a tendency for infection.

text:
In which region is this object historically named after?
A. Prussia
B. Bavaria
C. Saxony
D. Pomerania
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Pomeranian is named for the Pomerania region in north-west Poland and north-east Germany in Central Europe.

text:
When was the unified standard for this object created?
A. 1965
B. 1950
C. 1945
D. 1936
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A unified Bouvier des Flandres standard was created in 1936 by a joint French-Belgian committee.

text:
What is the characteristic physical trait of this object compared to other members of the same family?
A. Longer beaks
B. Brighter colors
C. Shorter necks
D. Larger size
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Bitterns tend to be shorter-necked and more secretive than other members of the family.

text:
Which part of the plant does this object mostly consume?
A. Fruit
B. Seeds
C. Bark
D. Roots
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The siamang eats mainly various parts of plants.

text:
What group classification does this object belong to according to the FCI?
A. Group 1 (Sheepdogs and Cattle Dogs)
B. Group 9 (Companion and Toy Dogs)
C. Group 7 (Pointer group)
D. Group 5 (Spitz and primitive types)
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: belongs to the FCI group 7 (Pointer group)

text:
What is the historical precursor of this object, particularly noted during the Renaissance period?
A. Cornett
B. Natural trumpet
C. Shawm
D. Sackbut
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: During the Renaissance, the equivalent English term was 'sackbut'.

text:
Which of the following best describes the origin and development of this object?
A. Originated in Southeast Asia and developed in the Mediterranean region
B. Has its ancestry in the Americas and was later cultivated in northern Italy
C. Developed in South America and brought to North America in the 20th century
D. Native to Northern Europe and popularized in the Americas during the colonial period
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Zucchini, like all squash, has its ancestry in the Americas, specifically Mesoamerica. However, the varieties of green, cylindrical squash harvested immature and typically called 'zucchini' were cultivated in northern Italy.

text:
In which of the following settings is this object NOT typically used?
A. Urban streets
B. Desert regions
C. Major airports
D. Railway tracks
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Large custom snowplows are commonly used at major airports... Snowplows can also be mounted on rail cars... In other cases, pickup trucks and front end loaders are outfitted...

text:
Which characteristic describes the physical appearance and behavior of this object during the breeding period?
A. Develops a brightly colored coat
B. Develops subcutaneous armor for protection
C. Testicles decrease in size
D. Sheds its mane
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Prior to mating, the males develop their subcutaneous armour in preparation for confronting rivals.

text:
In the Hornbostel-Sachs classification system, this object is classified as which type of instrument?
A. Membranophone
B. Chordophone
C. Aerophone
D. Idiophone
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The drum is a member of the percussion group of musical instruments. In the Hornbostel-Sachs classification system, it is a membranophone.

text:
What significant change began to appear in this object's design during the early Ming Dynasty?
A. Changing from vertical to horizontal use
B. The introduction of 1:5 bead configuration
C. The removal of the bamboo frame
D. The use of metal beads instead of wood
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the early Ming Dynasty, the abacus began to appear in the form of 1:5 abacus.

text:
Which material is NOT typically used in the construction of this object?
A. Plastic
B. Metal
C. Wood
D. Stone
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Blinds can be made in a variety of materials, some expensive, and some less so. Cheaper blinds are usually made in polyester, aluminum, or PVC.

text:
What is a major difference between the conformation show lines and field trial lines of this object?
A. Field lines are bred to have a lower energy level
B. Show lines are generally taller and lighter
C. Show lines are purposefully bred with longer muzzles
D. Field lines are usually heavier and have a thicker coat
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Dogs bred for hunting and field-trial work are selected first for working ability, where dogs bred to compete in conformation shows are selected for their conformation to the standards and characteristics sought by judges in the show ring.

text:
What is the primary method of prey incapacitation used by this object?
A. Venom injection
B. Constriction
C. Stunning with its tail
D. Biting and shaking
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The boa first strikes at the prey, grabbing it with its teeth; it then proceeds to constrict the prey until death before consuming it whole.

text:
What is the typical hunting technique of this object?
A. Hunting by sound
B. Tracking by scent
C. Digging for prey
D. Chasing by sight
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Salukis are sighthounds – hunting by sight more than scent or sound – and run their quarry down to kill or retrieve it.

text:
What feature is distinctive about the newborn appearance of this object?
A. They are completely white with a pink face.
B. They are completely black with no additional markings.
C. They are born without fur.
D. They have striped patterns on their bodies.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Newborn colobi are completely white with a pink face.

text:
What is the typical dietary composition of this object?
A. Primarily fruits and insects
B. Exclusively plant-based
C. Mainly small mammals and birds
D. Primarily fish and aquatic invertebrates
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Squirrel monkeys are omnivores, eating primarily fruits and insects.

text:
What is the native region of this object?
A. South America
B. Africa
C. Asia
D. Australia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The custard apple is native to the New World

text:
Which ingredient is NOT typically found in the making of this object?
A. Sugar
B. Vinegar
C. Flour
D. Water
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Dough is typically made by mixing flour with a small amount of water and/or other liquid, and sometimes includes flour yeast or other leavening agents as well as other ingredients such as various fats or flavorings.

text:
In which setting are the 'variable-pitch' styles of this object used?
A. In residential ceiling installations
B. For industrial large-volume air displacement
C. In portable personal cooling devices
D. For precise control of static pressure within supply ducts
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A variable-pitch fan is used where precise control of static pressure within supply ducts is required.

text:
Which family does this object belong to?
A. Felidae
B. Hyaenidae
C. Herpestidae
D. Viverridae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family (family Brassicaceae, genus 'Brassica')

text:
How is this object classified in dog competitions in the United States?
A. Sporting group
B. Herding group
C. Toy group
D. Non-sporting group
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: English Setters are classified within the gundog group in the UK and the Sporting group in America and Canada.

text:
What is the primary purpose for which this object was originally bred?
A. Guarding property
B. Herding sheep
C. Hunting hare
D. Companion pet
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Basset is a scent hound that was originally bred for the purpose of hunting hare.

text:
What is the romantic story associated with the origin of this object?
A. It was believed to have been a gift from a visiting foreign ruler.
B. It swam from a sinking ship and was so beautiful that it was used widely for breeding.
C. It was the chosen companion of a famous religious leader.
D. It was depicted as the hero in an ancient local legend.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: There is a romantic story of a blue dog swimming ashore from a shipwreck: the coat of this dog was so lovely that it was mated with all the female Wheaten Terriers in Kerry...

text:
What alternative material began impacting the popularity of this object in the early 20th century?
A. Synthetic leather
B. Silk
C. Faux fur
D. Organic cotton
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Intro of alternatives in the early 20th century brought tension to clothing industry as the faux fur manufacturers started producing faux fur.

text:
In which type of media has this object NOT been prominently featured?
A. Postal stamps
B. Film
C. Children's books
D. Television advertising
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: and has been featured in film, postal stamps, and many other types of media.

text:
Which country is credited with the invention of this object?
A. France
B. Germany
C. United States
D. United Kingdom
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The development of pencil sharpeners began in France.

text:
This object's teeth are best described by having which feature?
A. Large and flat
B. Sharp, pronounced serrations with a sideways-pointing tip
C. Small and blunt serrations
D. Smooth-edged and curved
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Tiger shark teeth are unique with very sharp, pronounced serrations and an unmistakable sideways-pointing tip.

text:
What is unique about the physical features of this object's hind legs?
A. Unique double dewclaws
B. Presence of webbed feet
C. Extraordinarily long hind limbs
D. Absence of hind toes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: One singular characteristic of the Great Pyrenees is the unique double dewclaws on each hind leg.

text:
Which cooking method is not typically achievable with this object?
A. Boiling
B. Steaming
C. Baking
D. Frying
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Unlike conventional ovens, microwave ovens usually do not directly brown or caramelize food, since they rarely attain the necessary temperatures to produce Maillard reactions.

text:
Which of the following environments is this object NOT adapted to live in?
A. Brackish water
B. Subtidal zones
C. Rock crevices in marine environments
D. Intertidal zones
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Chitons are exclusively and fully marine. This is in contrast to the bivalves, which were able to adapt to brackish water and fresh water...

text:
What is a common size range for this object used in kitchens?
A. 20" to 22" inches square
B. 8" to 10" inches square
C. 15" to 17" inches square
D. 11" to 13" inches square
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Dishcloths are typically made of cotton or other cloth, such as microfiber, and measure 11" to 13" inches square.

text:
What is the traditional color combination of this object's coat?
A. Black with white markings
B. Solid red
C. Red with white markings
D. White with black markings
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The breed's coat only comes in a single colour combination of white with red markings, usually in a piebald pattern.

text:
Where did this object originate?
A. Kent, England
B. Brittany, France
C. Bavaria, Germany
D. Normandy, France
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The name "Brittany" is taken from the Brittany region in northwestern France where the dog originated.

text:
Which of the following features is characteristic of this object's coat?
A. Silky and long
B. Thick and wavy
C. Straight and wiry
D. Curly and soft
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The outer part of the double coat should be straight and wiry in texture.

text:
Which of the following diseases can this object carry that is harmful to humans?
A. Lyme disease
B. Influenza
C. Rabies
D. Herpes B virus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Nearly all (73–100%) pet and captive rhesus macaques are carriers of the herpes B virus. This virus is harmless to macaques, but infections of humans, while rare, are potentially fatal.

text:
What activity was historically the cause for a common alteration in this object's physical appearance in the UK?
A. Guarding
B. Racing
C. Herding
D. Swimming
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Artificial docking was needed for the dog to do its job as a herding dog in the United Kingdom.

text:
Which indigenous group's early garment is this object commonly associated with?
A. Maori
B. Vikings
C. Zulu
D. Inca
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Ponchos have been used by the Native American peoples of the Andes since pre-Hispanic time...

text:
This object displays which kind of temperament?
A. Passive and timid
B. Aggressive and uncontrollable
C. Primitive and energetic
D. Submissive and lethargic
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Xoloitzcuintli's 'primitive' temperament (very high intelligence, sensitivity, high energy, inquisitiveness, strong hunting, and social instincts) is apparent because the breed's temperament was not modified overall by selective breeding in their native history in Mexico.

text:
Which of the following best describes the steering mechanism commonly used in this object during World War II?
A. Fully tracked steering
B. Jet propulsion direction systems
C. Hydraulic steering mechanisms
D. Wheeled steering using a steering wheel augmented by track braking
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Although not a feature on American World War II vehicles, steering could be assisted by track braking, controlled by the steering wheel.

text:
What is the historic origin of this object, used both for hunting and as a guardian?
A. Germany
B. Ireland
C. Scotland
D. France
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Irish Wolfhound is a historic sighthound dog breed from Ireland that has by its presence and substantial size inspired literature, poetry and mythology.

text:
What is the scientific classification of this object?
A. Canis dingo
B. Felis catus
C. Canis lupus
D. Equus ferus caballus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The dingo (scientific name: 'Canis dingo', taxonomic classification: 'Canis familiaris', 'Canis familiaris dingo', 'Canis lupus dingo', or 'Canis dingo') is a dog that is found in Australia.

text:
Which of the following coat colors is NOT recognized by the AKC for this object?
A. Pure White
B. Belge
C. Red
D. Black and tan
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The FCI and KC breed standards specifies that the coat must be black, but the AKC also allows grey, silver, red, black and tan, and belge.

text:
How does this object generally move through its habitat?
A. Burrowing underground
B. Mainly by jumping from tree to tree
C. Flying short distances
D. Quadrupedal movement on the tops of branches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Howler monkeys generally move quadrupedally on the tops of branches, usually grasping a branch with at least two hands or one hand and the tail at all times.

text:
What is the correct collective noun for a group of this object?
A. Cluster
B. Covey
C. Herd
D. Pack
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The collective noun for a group of quail is a flock, covey, or bevy.

text:
This object is similar to which of the following in terms of physical appearance?
A. Bulldog
B. Dachshund
C. Shih Tzu
D. Greyhound
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: It is similar in shape to a greyhound

text:
Which of the following characters is based on the design of this object?
A. Goofy
B. Pluto
C. Snoopy
D. Scooby-Doo
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Animation designer Iwao Takamoto based the Hanna-Barbera character Scooby-Doo on this object.

text:
Which of the following items of furniture is similar in function to this object?
A. Desk
B. Dining chair
C. Glider
D. Sofa
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: BULLET::::- Glider (furniture), a chair that rocks via suspension from a four-bar linkage

text:
Which statement best describes the social organization of this object?
A. This object is solitary and avoids interaction with others of its species.
B. This object lives in large groups that are highly dependent on conspecifics.
C. This object forms large, stable packs similar to wolves.
D. This object typically lives in family units or loosely knit packs of unrelated individuals.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: It is highly flexible in social organization, living either in a family unit or in loosely knit packs of unrelated individuals.

text:
Which of the following is not a primary food source for this object in Ohio?
A. Maple seeds
B. Black walnuts
C. Hickory nuts
D. Acorns from bluejack oak
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Fox squirrels in Ohio prefer hickory nuts, acorns, corn, and black walnuts. The squirrels are absent where two or more of these mast trees are missing.

text:
Which of the following is NOT a typical use for this object in modern times?
A. Rescue operations
B. Detecting explosives
C. Participation in dog shows
D. Herding livestock
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Springer is not limited to detecting explosives. Springers are used for drug detection in the United Kingdom, Sweden, Finland, Isle of Man, Ireland, Canada CBSA and Qatar. The Springer Spaniel is also used as a search and rescue dog by mountain rescue and Lowland Rescue teams.

text:
What is the median lifespan of this object, according to a health survey mentioned?
A. 13.6 years
B. 10.5 years
C. 15.2 years
D. 11.8 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Basenjis in the 2004 UK Kennel Club survey had a median lifespan of 13.6 years

text:
What method unique among cats does this object sometimes use to kill its prey?
A. Using venom
B. Starvation
C. Strangulation
D. Piercing the skull through the temporal bones
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: ...it sometimes uses a killing method unique among cats: it pierces directly through the temporal bones of the skull between the ears of prey (especially the capybara) with its canine teeth, piercing the brain.

text:
What is the typical reproductive behavior of this object when it comes to nest-building?
A. Creates nests only in extremely cold climates
B. Builds nests by collecting material like twigs and leaves
C. Does not engage in nest-building activities
D. Only males are involved in nest-building for attracting females
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: First, the sow digs a depression about the size of her body. She then collects twigs and leaves, and carries these in her mouth to the depression, building them into a mound.

text:
What innovative use of this object was patented by C.B. Mirick in 1926?
A. Maneuvering aircraft remotely without a pilot
B. Electrically controlling a mechanical crane
C. Control system for unmanned aerial vehicles
D. Adjusting radio frequencies
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The electrical two-axis joystick was invented by C. B. Mirick at the United States Naval Research Laboratory (NRL) and patented in 1926 (U.S. Patent no. 1,597,416).

text:
What is the average lifespan of this object in the wild?
A. Up to 30 years
B. Up to 20 years
C. Up to 10 years
D. Up to 15 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Their average lifespan is 9 years with 19 years and 2 months being the longest recorded.

text:
What is the primary material used in the modern manufacturing of this object?
A. Plastic only
B. Metal alloys
C. Rubber
D. Wood
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Metal alloys (most often steel, aluminium alloys, titanium alloys)

text:
What is the typical body length of mature female specimens of this object?
A. 0.5 to 1.5 inches
B. 1.0 to 1.5 inches
C. 1.5 to 2.0 inches
D. 2.0 to 3.5 inches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The body length (excluding legs) of the mature female is 1.0 to 1.5 cm.

text:
Which category does this object belong to based on its morphological structure?
A. Agarics
B. Gasteromycetes
C. Polypores
D. Boletes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: "Bolete" is also the English common name for fungal species having this kind of morphology.

text:
In terms of taxonomy, where are species resembling this object classified?
A. Gasteromycetes
B. Boletales
C. Polyporales
D. Agaricales
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The boletes are classified in the Boletales; however, not all members of that order are boletes.

text:
What type of movement does this object traditionally allow for?
A. Glide
B. Swivel
C. Rock
D. Spin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The rockers contact the floor at only two points, giving the occupant the ability to rock back and forth by shifting their weight or pushing lightly with their feet.

text:
Which of the following is NOT a common use for this object?
A. Use in professional kitchen settings
B. Wearing during dental checkups
C. Identifying players' positions in sports
D. Protecting clothes when eating messy foods
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In sport, it may refer to a garment that identifies participants....Paper bibs are also commonly used in dentist offices...Bibs are also worn when consuming certain 'messy' foods.

text:
What is the primary purpose of this object?
A. Enhancing the photo quality by filtering light
B. Storing extra memory cards
C. Allowing different lenses to be attached to the camera
D. Providing protection from scratches and minor collisions
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A lens cover or lens cap provides protection from scratches and minor collisions for camera and camcorder lenses.

text:
What is the primary use of this object in medical settings?
A. To deliver oxygen for therapy
B. To monitor heart rates
C. To reduce physical pain
D. To measure blood pressure
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Medical plastic oxygen masks are used primarily by medical care providers for oxygen therapy because they are disposable and so reduce cleaning costs and infection risks.

text:
What is a significant environmental impact mentioned about this object when introduced to non-native regions?
A. It enhances biodiversity by creating habitats
B. It competes with local species for food
C. It depletes seabed flora creating a desert
D. It has no significant impact
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In the Barents Sea it is an invasive species and its population is increasing tremendously. This is causing great concern to local environmentalists and local fishermen, as the crab eats everything it comes across and is spreading very rapidly, eating most seabed life and creating a desert.

text:
What is the typical size of an adult this object?
A. Approximately 1 meter in length and 10 kilograms
B. Approximately 2.5 meters in length and 30 kilograms
C. Up to 2 meters in length and 50 kilograms
D. About 3 meters in length and 70 kilograms
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In the wild, adult Komodo dragons usually weigh around , although captive specimens often weigh more.

text:
What genetic condition is known to affect some of these objects, as noted within the related research?
A. Canine cyclic neutropenia or Grey Collie Syndrome
B. Hip dysplasia commonly found in large breeds
C. Progressive retinal atrophy, leading to blindness
D. High prevalence of congenital heart defects
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Collies may have a genetic disease, na canine cyclic neutropenia, or Grey Collie Syndrome.

text:
What is primarily the diet of this object in the wild?
A. Plankton
B. Seaweed
C. Coral polyps
D. Small fish and invertebrates
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Pterois fish prey mostly on small fish, invertebrates, and mollusks

text:
This object is recognized as one of the smallest in its category. What is its typical height at the withers?
A. 16 inches
B. 12 inches
C. 14 inches
D. 10 inches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: These terriers are one of the smallest working terriers (; at the withers), with prick ears and a double coat, which come in red, tan, wheaten, black and tan, and grizzle.

text:
Which of the following is known as the world's largest this object?
A. The LEGO Store
B. Hamleys
C. Toys "R" Us
D. FAO Schwarz
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Notable Examples. - Hamleys, the world’s largest toy shop

text:
What feature distinguishes many species of this object and helps them escape predators?
A. Leathery armour shell
B. Ability to fly short distances
C. Production of a loud, frightening noise
D. Shooting quills at predators
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Armadillos are characterized by a leathery armour shell and long sharp claws for digging.

text:
Which type of this object is capable of indicating both time and date?
A. Horizontal sundials
B. Vertical sundials
C. Equatorial bow sundials
D. Nodus-based sundials
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Nodus-based sundials may use a small hole or mirror to isolate a single ray of light; the rays of light trace out a cone over the course of a day.

text:
This object, in its most precise form, usually includes which component to reduce friction at the fulcrum?
A. A silicone gel
B. A knife edge
C. A ball bearing
D. A rubber pad
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Very precise measurements are achieved by ensuring that the balance's fulcrum is essentially friction-free (a knife edge is the traditional solution).

text:
What is a key characteristic of this object's facial structure?
A. Pointed ears
B. Small eyes
C. Elongated nose
D. Short muzzle
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Persian cat () is a long-haired breed of cat characterized by its round face and short muzzle.

text:
In which traditional room setting is this object most commonly found?
A. Dining room
B. Kitchen
C. Bedroom
D. Living room
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A china cabinet is a piece of dining room furniture...

text:
Which environmental condition strongly affects the habitat preference of this object due to their inability to navigate it?
A. Open plains
B. Large bodies of water
C. Deep forests
D. Deep snow
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Since bighorn sheep cannot move through deep snow, they prefer drier slopes, where the annual snowfall is less than about 60 cm per year.

text:
Which materials are traditionally used for manufacturing this object in its cloth form?
A. Cotton, hemp, bamboo
B. PVC, polypropylene, acrylic
C. Wool, nylon, elastane
D. Silk, polyester, rayon
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Cloth diapers are composed of layers of fabric such as cotton, hemp, bamboo, microfiber, or even plastic fibers such as PLA or PU.

text:
In which type of climates does this object predominantly thrive?
A. Mediterranean
B. Subarctic
C. Tropical rainforest
D. Desert
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The plant tolerates seasonal drought, and the Middle Eastern and Mediterranean climates are especially suitable to it.

text:
What is a typical deduction in scoring for routines performed on this object?
A. Adjusting hand position in handstand
B. Performing extra swings
C. Skipping a dismount
D. Using additional equipment
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: There are specific deductions for adjusting hand position in handstand and not controlling swing elements; swing type elements should momentarily show handstand.

text:
What is the primary material used in the modern manufacturing of this object?
A. Plastic only
B. Metal alloys
C. Rubber
D. Wood
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Metal alloys (most often steel, aluminium alloys, titanium alloys)

text:
Which defense mechanism is commonly employed by certain species of this object when threatened by predators?
A. Releasing noxious chemical secretions
B. Producing a loud noise
C. Camouflaging by changing skin color rapidly
D. Spraying acid
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A

text:
What is a unique feature of this object's skin that contributes to its defense?
A. Slime-producing glands to slip from predators’ grasp
B. Bright colors to ward off predators
C. Armoured scales containing tiny bones called osteoderms
D. Poison glands within the skin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Komodo dragon skin is reinforced by armoured scales, which contain tiny bones called osteoderms that function as a sort of natural chain-mail.

text:
What is the original purpose of this object?
A. Herding cattle
B. Hunting gamebirds
C. To be kept as a luxury pet
D. Guarding properties
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The original purpose of the breed was to hunt gamebirds.

text:
Who typically steers this object?
A. The rear rider
B. The front rider
C. It is automatically steered
D. Both riders equally
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: On conventional tandems, the front rider steers as well as pedals the bicycle and is known as the 'captain', 'pilot', or 'steersman'; the rear rider only pedals and is known as the 'stoker', 'navigator' or 'rear admiral'.

text:
In which region is this object historically named after?
A. Prussia
B. Bavaria
C. Saxony
D. Pomerania
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Pomeranian is named for the Pomerania region in north-west Poland and north-east Germany in Central Europe.

text:
What are the particular spots on the back of this object's ears thought to play a role in?
A. Camouflage
B. Communication
C. Hunting
D. Attracting mates
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The whitish spots on the back of its ears are thought to play a role in communication.

text:
Which of the following is closely related to this object, according to its historical ties and functional similarities?
A. Whirligigs
B. Friction cars
C. Action figures
D. Dolls
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: It is a predecessor to more complex whirligigs.

text:
What kind of feeding habit is exhibited by all species of this object?
A. Herbivorous
B. Omnivorous
C. Parasitic
D. Carnivorous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Adult and larval leaf beetles feed on all sorts of plant tissue, and all species are fully herbivorous.

text:
Which life stage is NOT part of this object's lifecycle?
A. Adult
B. Nymph
C. Larva
D. Pupal
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Ticks have four stages to their lifecycle, namely egg, larva, nymph, and adult.

text:
For what purpose is this object utilized in watercraft?
A. Nautical weaponry
B. Propulsion
C. Communication signals
D. Crew accommodation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Propulsion of watercraft (as a paddlewheel)

text:
Which ancient civilization is credited with the development of this object?
A. Egyptian
B. Etruscan
C. Greek
D. Roman
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Triumphal arches are one of the most influential and distinctive types of architecture associated with ancient Rome.

text:
What historic event contributed significantly to the decline of this object's numbers?
A. The Industrial Revolution
B. The French Revolution
C. World War I
D. The signing of the Magna Carta
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: During World War I breeding was stopped entirely causing their numbers to decrease to a record low.

text:
In which traditional room setting is this object most commonly found?
A. Dining room
B. Kitchen
C. Bedroom
D. Living room
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A china cabinet is a piece of dining room furniture...

text:
Which health issue is not commonly associated with this object?
A. Cardiomyopathy
B. Osteosarcoma
C. Bloat
D. Hip dysplasia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The serious health issues in the breed include cardiomyopathy; osteosarcoma; bloat; stomach or splenic torsion, called Gastric dilatation volvulus; and cystinuria.

text:
How many pairs of ribs does this object typically have?
A. 23 pairs
B. 17 pairs
C. 21 pairs
D. 19 pairs
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Indian elephants... have 19 pairs of ribs.

text:
Which subfamily does this object NOT belong to?
A. Cerambycinae
B. Necydalinae
C. Lepturinae
D. Chrysomelinae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The ten subfamilies are: Anoplodermatinae, Apatophyseinae, Cerambycinae, Dorcasominae, Lamiinae, Lepturinae, Necydalinae, Parandrinae, Prioninae, Spondylidinae

text:
What type of fertilization does this object use?
A. Partial internal fertilization
B. Internal fertilization
C. External fertilization
D. Asexual reproduction
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: These are the only North American frog species that reproduce by internal fertilization.

text:
What is the primary material used for the reeds of this object?
A. Aluminum
B. Brass
C. Wood
D. Plastic
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The reed plate is a grouping of several reeds in a single housing. The reeds are usually made of brass, but steel, aluminium and plastic are occasionally used.

text:
What primarily defines the distribution range of this object in the Northern Hemisphere?

B. Proximity to water bodies
C. Availability of prey
D. Presence of human population
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The red species' northern limit is linked to the availability of food.

text:
What is a primary diet component for this object?
A. Small rodents and insects
B. Primarily algae and other aquatic plants
C. Primarily berries and seeds
D. Strictly carnivorous diet of fish and small birds
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: American coots eat primarily algae and other aquatic plants.

text:
What are the common health issues that may affect this object's lifespan?
A. Common colds
B. Cancer and neurological disorders
C. Skin allergies
D. Mostly injury related
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The most common causes of death for the breed were cancer (28.3%), old age (24.6%), and neurological disorders (15.2%).

text:
What is a defense mechanism of this object?
A. It secretes a toxic milky liquid when perturbed
B. It has the ability to blend into its surroundings
C. It can fly away from predators
D. It emits a loud sound to scare off predators
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: "Ambystoma maculatum" has several methods of defense....and a toxic milky liquid it excretes when perturbed.

text:
How does this object typically move?
A. Stiff and stilted
B. With a hopping gait
C. Slow and deliberate
D. Jaunty, smooth, flowing gait
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Maltese moves with a jaunty, smooth, flowing gait.

text:
Which classification below correctly includes this object?
A. Nematoda
B. Angiosperms
C. Basidiomycetes
D. Cnidaria
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Old systems of classification place all agarics in the Agaricales and some (mostly older) sources use 'agarics' as the colloquial collective noun for the Agaricales.

text:
Where in its phylogenetic lineage does this object stand according to genetic studies?
A. A direct descendant of the fox
B. Descended directly from the gray wolf
C. A non-canine related species
D. A basal member of the domestic dog clade
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Whole genome sequencing indicates the dog to be a genetically divergent subspecies of the grey wolf, the dog is not a descendant of the extant grey wolf, but these are sister taxa which share a common ancestor from a ghost population of wolves that went extinct at the end of the Late Pleistocene, and the dingo and the Basenji are basal members of the domestic dog clade.

text:
What is the primary method this object uses to detect prey?
A. Uses tactile sensors in the feet
B. Relies mainly on its acute sense of smell
C. Predominantly uses vision to identify prey
D. Emits sounds that echo back from prey
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The robin uses auditory, visual, olfactory and possibly vibrotactile cues to find prey, but vision is the predominant mode of prey detection.

text:
Which of the following features might this object include?
A. Velcro straps
B. Zippered back
C. Plunging neckline
D. Detachable sleeves
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: However, a maillot may also include a plunging neckline.

text:
Which regions are mentioned as habitats for this object?
A. Exclusively in coastal areas below 100 meters
B. Primarily in tropical zones near the equator
C. In desert regions, particularly around oasis
D. Most commonly found between altitudes of 300 and 1000 meters
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: They are most commonly found at altitudes between 300m and 1000m.

text:
During the mating season, how do males of certain species of this object assess the readiness of females for copulation?
A. By audial signals
B. Through chemical signals
C. By visual cues
D. Using electrical signals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: ...may rely on their ampullae of Lorenzini to sense certain electrical signals given off by mature females...

text:
This object's modern form includes a triangular frame primarily supported by which structural element?

B. Pedal box
C. Tuning Pegs
D. Soundbox
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The longest side of the harp is called the column or pillar, though some earlier harps, such as a 'bow harp', lack a pillar.

text:
How are the eyes and mandibles described for the oldest fossil of this object found?
A. Wide eyes and long mandibles shaped like sickles
B. No eyes and very long mandibles
C. Small eyes and short rounded mandibles
D. Compound eyes with no visible mandibles
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Traits that identify 'Cretotetracha' as Cicindelinae include long mandibles shaped like sickles, simple teeth arranged along the mandible's inner surface, antennae that attach to the head between the base of the mandibles and the eye.

text:
Unlike many of its relatives in the same family, this object exhibits what kind of reproductive behavior?
A. The female is predominantly responsible for incubation.
B. It is monogamous throughout its life.
C. It displays brood parasitism.
D. The male provides most of the parental care.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Unlike many Old World cuckoos, coucals are not brood parasites, though they do have their own reproductive peculiarity: all members of the genus are (to varying degrees) sex-role reversed, so that the smaller male provides most of the parental care.

text:
In what anatomical location do this object's primary respiratory processes occur?
A. Near the mouth
B. Within the cloaca
C. In the tentacles
D. On the dorsal surface
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Sea cucumbers extract oxygen from water in a pair of 'respiratory trees' that branch in the cloaca just inside the anus...

text:
Where was this object originally developed?
A. Pembrokeshire, Wales
B. Edinburgh, Scotland
C. Dublin, Ireland
D. London, England
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The breed was developed between 1850 and 1891 by Captain John Edwardes, at Sealyham House, near Wolfscastle in the Welsh county of Pembrokeshire.

text:
On which holiday is the consumption of this object particularly noted to increase in the U.S.?
A. Easter
B. Christmas
C. Super Bowl Sunday
D. Thanksgiving
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Guacamole has increased avocado sales in the U.S., especially on Super Bowl Sunday and Cinco de Mayo.

text:
What specifications does the 3x3 version of this object combine?
A. Same weight and circumference as a size 7 ball
B. Circumference of a size 7 ball, weight of a size 6 ball
C. Weight of a size 7 ball, circumference of a size 6 ball
D. Same weight and circumference as a size 5 ball
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Note that the ball used for all competitions (men's, women's, and mixed) in the formalized halfcourt game of 3x3 combines characteristics of the size 6 and size 7 balls. Its circumference is that of a size 6 ball, but its weight is that of a size 7.

text:
Where was a historic version of this object found?
A. In the remains of Herculaneum
B. Near the River Thames in London
C. In the catacombs of Paris
D. In the ruins of Athens
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A carbonized cradle was found in the remains of Herculaneum left from the destruction of the city by the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE.

text:
What percentage of the global production of this object, combined with cauliflowers, was accounted for by China and India in 2017?
A. 83%
B. 43%
C. 73%
D. 53%
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In 2017, China and India produced 73% of the world's broccoli and cauliflower crops.

text:
When was the term for this object first integrated into the English dictionary?
A. 1980
B. 1928
C. 1950
D. 1905
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The term maillot was inducted into the English dictionary in 1928.

text:
During the 1950s, what new type of fuel did these objects begin using more consistently for its advantages such as controllable flame and reduced odour?
A. Alcohol
B. Butane
C. Naphtha
D. Propane
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the 1950s, there was a switch in the fuel of choice from naphtha to butane, as butane allows for a controllable flame and has less odour.

text:
Considering the design objectives of separate this object, which characteristic is considered critical for matching this object to the morphology of its user?
A. Length and internal volume of the tube
B. The number of straps for securing the object
C. Flexibility of the mouthpiece
D. External color
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Although snorkels come in many forms, they are primarily classified by their dimensions and secondarily by their orientation and shape. The length and the inner diameter (or inner volume) of the tube are paramount...

text:
What notable style of this object became popular in the 1960s?
A. Metallic finish designs
B. Simple, unadorned styles
C. Colourful flower petal designs
D. Graphic prints designs
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: During the 1960s colourful flower petal swim caps became popular.

text:
Which type of this object’s construction feature allows it to be rolled with minimal friction?
A. Conical shape
B. Cylindrical symmetry
C. Bulging center
D. Rectangular base
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Barrels have a convex shape and bulge at their center, called bilge.

text:
Which of the following materials is NOT typically used to make this object?
A. Leather
B. Paperboard
C. Foil
D. Polyethylene
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Pails can be made of: Steel, tinplate, Aluminium, Fibre, paperboard, Plastics.

text:
What happens to this object in dry weather?

B. The object splits into multiple smaller parts
C. Melanin production in the spore sac increases
D. The spore sac shrinks significantly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In dry weather the 'petals' will dry and curl up around the soft spore sac.

text:
Which event significantly demonstrated the effectiveness of this object leading to its proliferation?

B. The Vietnam War confrontation between the AK-47 and M14
C. Demonstration at the People's Commissariat of Arms of the USSR in 1943
D. The early stages of World War II
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: On July 15, 1943, a Sturmgewehr was demonstrated before the People's Commissariat of Arms of the USSR. The Soviets were so impressed with the Sturmgewehr, that they immediately set about developing an intermediate caliber automatic rifle of their own.

text:
What is the primary habitat of this object's species found in Africa?
A. Deserts
B. Rainforest
C. Grasslands
D. Mountainous regions
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: While different species are found in a wide range of habitats, the African species are predominantly found in rainforest.

text:
Which of these items is similar in function to this object?
A. Elbow pad
B. Sunglasses
C. Baseball cap
D. Wrist watch
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A

text:
Which of the following is NOT a health problem commonly associated with this object?
A. Cataracts
B. Epilepsy
C. Hip dysplasia
D. Lung cancer
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
Which health issue is not commonly associated with this object?
A. Cardiomyopathy
B. Osteosarcoma
C. Bloat
D. Hip dysplasia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The serious health issues in the breed include cardiomyopathy; osteosarcoma; bloat; stomach or splenic torsion, called Gastric dilatation volvulus; and cystinuria.

text:

D. 20 to 50 kg

wiki: Bloodhounds weigh from 36 to 72 kg.

D. To hold coins

text:
Which family does the Diamondback version of this object belong to?

C. Pelomedusidae
D. Emydidae

wiki: Diamondback terrapin or just 'terrapin', 'Malaclemys terrapin', a testudine of the family Emydidae, native to North America and Bermuda.

text:

C. Pairs
D. Solitary

text:

text:
How does this object ensure its eggs receive enough oxygen?

text:
Which subfamily does this object NOT belong to?
A. Cerambycinae
B. Necydalinae
C. Lepturinae
D. Chrysomelinae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The ten subfamilies are: Anoplodermatinae, Apatophyseinae, Cerambycinae, Dorcasominae, Lamiinae, Lepturinae, Necydalinae, Parandrinae, Prioninae, Spondylidinae

text:
What was a significant design evolution for this object around the 1950s?
A. Introduction of simulated wood panelling.
B. Development of the first lift-gate.
C. Introduction of the first all-steel body.
D. Addition of pneumatic struts to the tailgate.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: By the 1950s the wood rear bodywork had been replaced by an all-steel body.

text:
What social structure does this object exhibit?
A. Large clans without rigid dominance hierarchies
B. Solitary
C. Pairs
D. Small herds
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Dholes are more social than gray wolves, and have less of a dominance hierarchy, as seasonal scarcity of food is not a serious concern for them.

text:
What is the correct collective noun for a group of this object?
A. Cluster
B. Covey

text:
How does this object contribute to the ecosystem through biological control?

D. 1951

Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

text:

B. 10.5 years
C. 15.2 years
D. 11.8 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Basenjis in the 2004 UK Kennel Club survey had a median lifespan of 13.6 years

text:
What unique physical characteristic does the male of the hamadryas species of this object display?
A. Extra long tail
B. A vibrant blue facial color
C. A black stripe down its back
D. Large white manes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Males of the hamadryas baboon species also have large white manes.

text:
What are common health issues for this object?
A. Diabetes and heart disease
B. L-2 Hydroxy Glutaric Aciduria and Hereditary Cataract
C. Skin allergies and respiratory issues
D. Hereditary eye conditions and joint dysplasia
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
In the field of emergency medical services, this object's integration into ambulances includes which feature to prevent movement during transport?
A. Battery-powered hydraulics
B. Locking wheels
C. Adjustable side rails
D. Sprung latch integration
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D

text:
Which of the following best describes the nesting habits of this object?

B. Nests in cavities or abandoned burrows
C. Nests on the ground using rocks and leaves
D. Builds nests above the ground in bushes or trees
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: The nest is most commonly located above the ground in a dense bush or in a fork between two tree branches, and is built by the female alone.

text:
What is the recommended way to measure the effective protection provided by this object?
A. The Sun Protection Factor (SPF) rating
B. The Protection Grade of UVA (PA) system
C. The Persistent Pigment Darkening (PPD) method
D. The Ultraviolet Protection Factor (UPF) rating
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: The sun protection factor (SPF rating, introduced in 1974) is a measure of the fraction of sunburn-producing UV rays that reach the skin.

text:

B. Sweden and Finland
C. Spain and France
D. Russia and Ukraine
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. 30 degrees
C. 40 degrees
D. 50 degrees
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

text:

B. Sports leagues
C. Corporate competitions
D. Cooking contests
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

C. A short, smooth coat
D. No distinctive coloring
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Like the other Sennenhund, it is the only breed of Sennenhund dogs with a long coat.

text:

D. Sweet and pleasant

text:

text:

B. 1970s
C. 1980s
D. 1990s

text:

text:

B. Wood
C. Plastic
D. Fabric
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

text:

text:

text:

C. Sumer
D. Minoan Civilization
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C

text:

Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

A. 19th Century
B. 18th Century
C. 20th Century
D. 16th Century
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
Historically, what was one form that resembled the modern-day use of this object?

C. A metal box used on trains for goods transit
D. A woven basket used by farmers for crop collection
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
How does this object typically interact with its environment to feed?

C. Absorbing nutrients from the water
D. Capturing prey with tentacles
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

C. 20th century
D. Classical era

text:

D. Regular shaving

text:
What type of diet does this object primarily follow?
A. Insects and small mammals
B. Fish and aquatic plants
C. Berries and nuts
D. Seeds, grapes and insects
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: They nest on the ground and have a diet consisting of seeds, grapes and insects.

text:

B. Long tail
C. Shorter tail
D. No tail
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

A. Fabaceae
B. Rosaceae
C. Annonaceae
D. Rutaceae

text:

B. Dining chair
C. Glider
D. Sofa

text:
What unique physical characteristic does the male of the hamadryas species of this object display?
A. Extra long tail
B. A vibrant blue facial color
C. A black stripe down its back
D. Large white manes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Males of the hamadryas baboon species also have large white manes.

text:
What is the geographic range of this object in the United States?

B. Mostly the eastern states including forests and coastal areas
C. Primarily the southwestern desert regions
D. Mainly in the northern regions near the Great Lakes
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

C. Moche people of ancient Peru
D. Ancient Greeks

text:
What is the primary distinction between this object's fibers and hair or fur?

D. This object's fibers are inorganic.

C. Western Europe

Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
In the context of hybrid power sources, how does this object manage steep slopes within its route?

D. 15-18 years

text:

C. Ives W. McGaffey
D. Melville R. Bissell
