Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: When confronted by dholes, tigers will seek refuge in trees or stand with their backs to a tree or bush, where they may be mobbed for lengthy periods before finally attempting escape.

text:
Which type of this object is commonly found in restaurants and has a metal-mesh conveyor belt?
A. Toaster oven
B. Microwave oven
C. Pop-up this object
D. Conveyor this object
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A third type, most commonly found in restaurants, has a metal-mesh conveyor belt that moves the bread past constantly-powered heat elements.

text:
From where is this object originally believed to have been brought?
A. Japan
B. India
C. Thailand
D. Egypt
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Derived from the Wichianmat landrace, one of several varieties of cat native to China and brought to Thailand (formerly known as Siam).

text:
Which color is NOT a recognized color for the coat of this object?
A. Red
B. Blue
C. Grey
D. Black
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The Briard can be tawny, black, grey, or blue, but variations in each color can occur.

text:
In what year was the first practical moving coil version of this object built?
A. 1916
B. 1886
C. 1923
D. 1963
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In 1923, the first practical moving coil microphone was built.

text:
Which of the following predators is considered a major threat to this object?
A. Raccoons
B. Kangaroos
C. Polar bears
D. Nile crocodiles
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Their principal predators are Nile crocodiles, lions, spotted and striped hyenas, leopards, and cheetahs.

text:
Which disease is this object highly prone to?
A. Citrus greening
B. Powdery mildew
C. Corn smut
D. Tomato spotted wilt virus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: It is moderately susceptible to fire blight and is highly prone to scab, powdery mildew, and cedar apple rust.

text:
What type of metabolism does this object exhibit in its lifecycle?
A. Amphimetabolism
B. Holometabolism
C. Hemimetabolism
D. Metamorphosis
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Crickets are hemimetabolic insects, whose lifecycle consists of an egg stage, a larval or nymph stage that increasingly resembles the adult form as the nymph grows, and an adult stage.

text:
What group classification does this object belong to according to the FCI?
A. Group 1 (Sheepdogs and Cattle Dogs)
B. Group 9 (Companion and Toy Dogs)
C. Group 7 (Pointer group)
D. Group 5 (Spitz and primitive types)
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: belongs to the FCI group 7 (Pointer group)

text:
Which of the following reproductive characteristics is true for this object?
A. Males and females come together annually to form breeding colonies.
B. They give birth to young every six months.
C. Reproduction occurs once a year with live young being born.
D. They lay eggs in coral reefs.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Reproduction occurs only once a year for hammerhead sharks, and usually occurs with the male shark biting the female shark violently until she agrees to mate with him.

text:
What is the primary material used for the reeds of this object?
A. Aluminum
B. Brass
C. Wood
D. Plastic
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The reed plate is a grouping of several reeds in a single housing. The reeds are usually made of brass, but steel, aluminium and plastic are occasionally used.

text:
Which of the following materials has historically NOT been used to fill the bulbs of this object?
A. Saltwater
B. Powdered marble
C. Sand
D. Pulverized burnt eggshell
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: While some early hourglasses actually did use sand as the granular mixture to measure time, many did not use sand at all. The material used in most bulbs was a combination of 'powdered marble, tin/lead oxides, and pulverized, burnt eggshell'.

text:
This object is sometimes used to refer to which type of store, particularly in North America?
A. A meat retail store
B. A fruit and vegetable store
C. A clothing store
D. A dairy store
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The term is sometimes used to refer to a meat retail store or butcher's shop, in particular in North America.

text:
How does this object primarily defend itself from predators?
A. By releasing a toxic substance
B. By emitting a loud sound to scare predators away
C. By shedding its tail
D. By camouflaging with the surroundings
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: This lizard sometimes sheds its tail (autotomy) to evade the grasp of a predator, regrowing it later.

text:
What additional benefit can this object provide besides toning the face?
A. It can be used as a facial cleanser
B. It can act as a sunscreen
C. It can hydrate the skin
D. It can reduce facial hair growth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Besides toning the face, some powders with sunscreen can also reduce skin damage from sunlight and environmental stress.

text:
What type of life cycle does this object exhibit?
A. Holometabolous
B. Hemimetabolous
C. Metamorphosis
D. Ametabolous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: They have a hemimetabolous life cycle with three stages: egg, nymph and adult.

text:
What type of social grouping does this object typically form?
A. Pairs
B. Pods
C. Flocks
D. Solitary
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Hippos are gregarious, living in groups of up to thirty animals. A group is called a pod, herd, dale, or bloat.

text:
What common nickname is associated with this object due to its behavioral characteristics?
A. Small tiger
B. Tiny bear
C. Little black fox
D. Little lion
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Schipperke is sometimes referred to as the 'little black fox'

text:
Which venomous action is reported to be similar between this object's venom and that of another genus?
A. Naja
B. Vipera
C. Elapidae
D. Echis
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: "C. cerastes" venom is reported to be similar in action to "Echis" venom.

text:
What is the typical social structure of this object?
A. Male-dominated groups
B. Pairs
C. Solitary
D. Matriarchal societies
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The species lives in matriarchal societies consisting of interrelated females and their young...

text:
What is a primary source of food for this object?
A. Plants and algae
B. Plankton and other microorganisms
C. Underwater carrion and detritus, as well as living shellfish and crab
D. Small fish and squid
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: As a carnivore, it feeds on both underwater carrion and detritus, as well as living shellfish and crab.

text:
Which of the following periods marks the first significant diversification of this object?
A. Cretaceous period
B. Carboniferous period
C. Triassic period
D. Jurassic period
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Ants evolved from wasp-like ancestors in the Cretaceous period, about 140 million years ago, and diversified after the rise of flowering plants.

text:
Which of the following regions is NOT a natural habitat for any species of this object?
A. Northern Europe
B. Central Africa
C. Southern Asia
D. Southwestern United States
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Eurasian lynx ranges from central and northern Europe across Asia up to Northern Pakistan and India.

text:
What evolutionary trait have this object and its relatives often developed in response to predation?
A. Ability to burrow rapidly into the sea floor
B. Hard external shells
C. High-speed swimming capabilities
D. Bright and colorful patterns for camouflage or warning
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The often bright colors of reef-dwelling species implies that these are under constant threat of predators, but the color can serve as a warning to other animals of the sea slug's toxic stinging cells or offensive taste.

text:
What social structure does this object typically exhibit?
A. Small groups of 6-15 animals with a mix of males and females
B. Large herds with complex hierarchies
C. Pairs
D. Solitary
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Most howler species live in groups of six to 15 animals, with one to three adult males and multiple females.

text:
What unique characteristic distinguishes the feet of this object from those of ducks?
A. Clawed toes for grasping branches
B. Broad, lobed scales on their lower legs and toes
C. Fully webbed feet like ducks
D. Sticky pads for better grip on wet surfaces
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Unlike the webbed feet of ducks, coots have broad, lobed scales on their lower legs and toes that fold back with each step in order to facilitate walking on dry land.

text:
What is this object primarily known for in terms of diet?
A. Herbivorous lifestyle
B. Omnivorous diet
C. Carnivorous preferences
D. Insectivorous habits
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A herbivore, it has adapted significantly with regard to locomotion and osmoregulation as a result of its diet.

text:
What were the primary duties of this object when originally bred?
A. Companion pet
B. Bird hunting
C. Guarding
D. Ratting
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Brittany is a breed of gun dog bred primarily for bird hunting.

text:
Which of the following is NOT typically a characteristic of this object compared to polypores?
A. Pore surface
B. Physical structure similar to polypores
C. Microscopic characters specific to boletes
D. Woody flesh
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Similar pore surface is found in polypores, but these species usually lack the overall physical structure of boletes; many have much firmer (often woody) flesh and lack the microscopic characters of boletes.

text:
What era marks the arrival of this object into high fashion?
A. Mid-20th century
B. Late 16th century
C. Beginning of the 19th century
D. Early 17th century
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The poke bonnet came into fashion at the beginning of the 19th century.

text:
Where does this object originate from?
A. The Scottish Highlands
B. The Swiss Alps
C. The Lake District in England
D. Welsh Countryside
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Lakeland Terrier is a dog breed, which takes its name from its place of origin, the Lake District in England.

text:
What colors does the AKC accept for showing this object?
A. Merle
B. All colors
C. Blue and fawn
D. Solid or stag red and the black or chocolate with rust points
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: For showing in the United States, the AKC disqualifies all colors but the solid or stag red and the black or chocolate with rust points.

text:
Which of the following descriptions best fits the physical characteristics of this object?
A. Large rounded head with heavy fur and large spots
B. Long face with striped fur patterns and retractable claws
C. Robust build with large rosettes and a loud roar
D. Small rounded head with short coarse fur covered with solid black spots
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Its yellowish tan or rufous to greyish white coat is uniformly covered with nearly 2,000 solid black spots. Its body is slender with a small rounded head...

text:
What two types of animal hides have historically been used to cover this object?
A. Buffalo hide and pigskin
B. Horsehide and cowhide
C. Alligator skin and snakeskin
D. Sheepskin and deerskin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The leather cover is commonly formed from two peanut-shaped pieces stitched together, typically with red-dyed thread.

text:
What kind of bait is most effective for catching this object?
A. Maggots, sweetcorn, and worms
B. Berries and small fruits
C. Small fishes and crustaceans
D. Artificial flies and lures
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The best methods and bait to catch tench are float fishing and legering with a swim feeder using maggots, sweetcorn, pellets, bread, and worms.

text:
What steering mechanism is traditionally associated with this object when it possesses four wheels?
A. A rudder
B. Turntable or fifth wheel
C. Flap control
D. A steering wheel
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A four-wheeled vehicle is also steered by the shafts or pole, which are attached to the front axle; this swivels on a 'turntable' or 'fifth wheel' beneath the vehicle.

text:
In a global context, what is a common transformative use for older working versions of this object when they become obsolete?
A. Used as training sites for divers
B. They are dismantled
C. Recycled as pleasure piers
D. Converted into residential areas
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Many other working piers have been demolished, or remain derelict, but some have been recycled as pleasure piers.

text:
In which year was this object first recognized by the American Kennel Club?
A. 1885
B. 1920
C. 1901
D. 1893
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In the early part of the twentieth century the breed gained social stature and was accepted by the American Kennel Club in 1936 and should not be confused with the Staffordshire Bull Terrier of the United Kingdom.

text:
In what anatomical location do this object's primary respiratory processes occur?
A. Near the mouth
B. Within the cloaca
C. In the tentacles
D. On the dorsal surface
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Sea cucumbers extract oxygen from water in a pair of 'respiratory trees' that branch in the cloaca just inside the anus...

text:
In which countries is this object usually consumed during traditional parties?
A. Mexico and Nigeria
B. Sweden and Finland
C. Spain and France
D. Russia and Ukraine
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Crayfish is a popular dish in Sweden and Finland, and is by tradition primarily consumed at a crayfish party, called 'kräftskiva', during the fishing season in August.

text:
What factor contributed to this object's ignition in a specific U.S. city as documented by its first installation in 1935?
A. The desire to increase city revenue
B. The need for better traffic management
C. The request by a local lawyer and newspaper publisher
D. A university study on urban development
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Holger George Thuesen and Gerald A. Hale began working on the parking meter in 1933 at the request of Oklahoma City, Oklahoma lawyer and newspaper publisher Carl C. Magee.

text:
What unique health condition is this object genetically predisposed to?
A. Hip dysplasia
B. Epilepsy
C. Deafness
D. Blindness
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A genetic predisposition for deafness is a serious health problem for Dalmatians.

text:
What traditional use did Native Americans find for this object?
A. Used as decoration in pottery
B. Prepared as a simple soup
C. Utilized as a natural dye for fabrics
D. Processed into a type of jelly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: One ecology researcher of Yurok and Karuk heritage reports that 'his traditional acorn preparation is a simple soup, cooked with hot stones directly in a basket.'

text:
How often does this object descend to the ground?
A. Twice a week
B. Once a day
C. Once a week
D. Once a month
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: They live high in the canopy, but descend once a week to defecate on the forest floor.

text:
What traditional use did Native Americans find for this object?
A. Used as decoration in pottery
B. Prepared as a simple soup
C. Utilized as a natural dye for fabrics
D. Processed into a type of jelly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: One ecology researcher of Yurok and Karuk heritage reports that 'his traditional acorn preparation is a simple soup, cooked with hot stones directly in a basket.'

text:
Which region does NOT have native this object species but commonly keeps them as pets?
A. Southeastern North America
B. Western Europe
C. Australia
D. Singapore
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In Singapore, the term 'crayfish' typically refers to 'Thenus orientalis', a seawater crustacean from the slipper lobster family. True crayfish are not native to Singapore, but are commonly found as pets.

text:
What was the primary use of the technology that preceded the development of this object?
A. Communicating encrypted messages
B. Radar detection systems
C. Guiding ships and aircraft
D. Broadcasting radio programs
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The invention of the cavity magnetron made possible the production of electromagnetic waves of a small enough wavelength (microwaves). The magnetron was originally a crucial component in the development of short wavelength radar during World War II.

text:
How does the toxicity level of this object typically compare to that of ornamental varieties within the same family?
A. Toxicity levels are identical to ornamental varieties
B. It is bred for lower levels of toxins compared to ornamental varieties
C. It contains no toxins at all
D. It has higher levels of toxins to defend against predators
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Cultivated cucurbitaceae are bred for low levels of the toxin and are safe to eat. However, ornamental pumpkins can have high levels of cucurbitacins.

text:
How many species are contained within the genus of this object?
A. Five
B. Twelve
C. One
D. Two
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The genus 'Phacochoerus' contains two species.

text:
What were the primary duties of this object when originally bred?
A. Companion pet
B. Bird hunting
C. Guarding
D. Ratting
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Brittany is a breed of gun dog bred primarily for bird hunting.

text:
What is a significant environmental impact mentioned about this object when introduced to non-native regions?
A. It enhances biodiversity by creating habitats
B. It competes with local species for food
C. It depletes seabed flora creating a desert
D. It has no significant impact
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In the Barents Sea it is an invasive species and its population is increasing tremendously. This is causing great concern to local environmentalists and local fishermen, as the crab eats everything it comes across and is spreading very rapidly, eating most seabed life and creating a desert.

text:
How are the dorsal scales of this object typically arranged at midbody?
A. In 20 or 22 rows
B. In 15 or 17 rows
C. In 9 or 10 rows
D. In 13 or 14 rows
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Dorsal scales smooth or weakly keeled, with apical pits, and arranged in 15 or 17 rows at midbody.

text:
What was the typical capacity of the older galvanised iron conical version of this object?
A. 25 gallons
B. 17 gallons
C. 5 gallons
D. 10 gallons
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The older galvanised iron conical type held 17 gallons.

text:
What additional benefit can this object provide besides toning the face?
A. It can be used as a facial cleanser
B. It can act as a sunscreen
C. It can hydrate the skin
D. It can reduce facial hair growth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Besides toning the face, some powders with sunscreen can also reduce skin damage from sunlight and environmental stress.

text:
What is the genus name of this object?
A. Calidris
B. Limnodromus
C. Tringa
D. Charadrius
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The three dowitchers are medium-sized long-billed wading birds in the genus Limnodromus.

text:
As of the latest studies, how many species of this object are recognized?
A. Two
B. Four
C. Five
D. Three
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: From 1996, they were divided into two species: the Bornean orangutan ('P. pygmaeus', with three subspecies) and the Sumatran orangutan ('P. abelii'). In November 2017 it was reported that a third species had been identified, the Tapanuli orangutan ('P. tapanuliensis').

text:
During the 1950s, what new type of fuel did these objects begin using more consistently for its advantages such as controllable flame and reduced odour?
A. Alcohol
B. Butane
C. Naphtha
D. Propane
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the 1950s, there was a switch in the fuel of choice from naphtha to butane, as butane allows for a controllable flame and has less odour.

text:
What is a common contemporary use for this object in urban settings?
A. Display in museums
B. Storing chilled goods for retail
C. Transporting large amounts of heavy equipment
D. Delivering business mail across the city
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Messenger bag: one long strap worn across the body, inspired by bags worn by urban messengers to deliver business mail, a modern silhouette

text:
What specifications does the 3x3 version of this object combine?
A. Same weight and circumference as a size 7 ball
B. Circumference of a size 7 ball, weight of a size 6 ball
C. Weight of a size 7 ball, circumference of a size 6 ball
D. Same weight and circumference as a size 5 ball
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Note that the ball used for all competitions (men's, women's, and mixed) in the formalized halfcourt game of 3x3 combines characteristics of the size 6 and size 7 balls. Its circumference is that of a size 6 ball, but its weight is that of a size 7.

text:
Where was this object originally developed?
A. Pembrokeshire, Wales
B. Edinburgh, Scotland
C. Dublin, Ireland
D. London, England
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The breed was developed between 1850 and 1891 by Captain John Edwardes, at Sealyham House, near Wolfscastle in the Welsh county of Pembrokeshire.

text:
What object serves as the device where this object is mounted?
A. Hoist
B. Truck
C. Halyard
D. Finial
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The pole is usually topped by a flat plate or ball called a 'truck' (originally meant to keep a wooden pole from splitting).

text:
What ecological role does this object typically fulfill in its native environment?
A. Scavenger
B. Apex predator
C. Primary herbivore
D. Middle-level omnivore
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Dingoes are regarded as apex predators and possibly perform an ecological key function. Likely (with increasing evidence from scientific research), they control the diversity of the ecosystem by limiting the number of prey and keeping the competition in check.

text:
How has the function of this object evolved over time?
A. From a paper cutting tool to an envelope opening tool
B. From a writing tool to an envelope opener
C. From a measuring device to a paper cutting tool
D. From a bookbinding tool to a personal grooming device
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Letter openers "evolved" from paper knives into longer, blunter blades for the sole purpose of opening envelopes.

text:
What homeomorphic shape is this object equivalent to in the field of topology?
A. Doughnut
B. Cone
C. Cylinder
D. Sphere
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Thus in topology, a mug is equivalent (homeomorphic) to a doughnut (torus)...

text:
Which feature allows this object to adjust its height?
A. A pull string
B. An electric motor
C. A remote control
D. A foot-operated jack
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The chairs usually have adjustable height (with a foot-operated jack or a hand-operated lever on the side).

text:
Which of the following is a distinct characteristic of the horns this object's males feature?
A. Lyre-shaped and slender
B. Short and heavily ridged
C. Spiral-shaped and heavy
D. Straight and pointed
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The male's slender, lyre-shaped horns are long.

text:
How is this object typically held and operated?
A. Pulled toward the body, like in Japanese planes
B. Kept stationary as wood passes through it
C. Used in a circular motion
D. Pushed away from the body
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Though most planes are pushed across a piece of wood, holding it with one or both hands, Japanese planes are pulled toward the body, not pushed away.

text:
Which position is particularly important for this object when transporting a patient in shock?
A. Fowler's position
B. Upright position
C. Trendelenburg position
D. Flat position
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The feet can be raised to what is called the Trendelenburg position, indicated for patients in shock.

text:
Which anatomical feature is absent in this object?
A. Tail
B. Forepaws
C. Ears
D. Nose
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: It is easily recognisable by its stout, tailless body and large head with round, fluffy ears and large, spoon-shaped nose.

text:
What was the primary reason for the historical shift in the usage of this object from utilitarian to lifestyle in the 1950s?
A. Consumer desire for more comfortable vehicles
B. Introduction of automatic transmissions
C. Government regulations on vehicle emissions
D. Decrease in manufacturing costs
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Once a work tool with few creature comforts, in the 1950s consumers began purchasing pickups for lifestyle reasons.

text:
What is the typical reproductive behavior of this object when it comes to nest-building?
A. Creates nests only in extremely cold climates
B. Builds nests by collecting material like twigs and leaves
C. Does not engage in nest-building activities
D. Only males are involved in nest-building for attracting females
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: First, the sow digs a depression about the size of her body. She then collects twigs and leaves, and carries these in her mouth to the depression, building them into a mound.

text:
Which feature does NOT apply to this object's development?
A. Expands by inflating preformed cells
B. Develops primarily underground
C. May appear overnight after substantial rainfall
D. Can absorb fluids rapidly for growth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Though mushroom fruiting bodies are short-lived, the underlying mycelium can itself be long-lived and massive. A colony of "Armillaria solidipes"... spans an estimated .

text:
Which animal was this object historically bred to hunt?
A. Wolves
B. Bears
C. Boars
D. Deer
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Originally used to pursue game by speed; it was also famed as a guardian dog, specializing in protection against and for the hunting of wolves.

text:
What historical factor may have influenced the breed of this object?
A. There was no crossbreeding
B. Crossbreeding with a Dachshund
C. Crossbreeding with a Poodle
D. Crossbreeding with a German Shepherd
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Some interbreeding with other breeds took place in the mid-1800s, which may have introduced Dachshund blood into the breed.

text:
In which competitive context is this object given as a booby prize?
A. Chess tournaments
B. Sports leagues
C. Corporate competitions
D. Cooking contests
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In some regions, particularly British-influenced ones of the Commonwealth and the United States, the 'wooden spoon' is a booby prize for the team or individual finishing a competition in last position.

text:
What alternative materials have historically been used for the same purpose as this object?
A. Wool, linen, and silk
B. Leather, beads, and papyrus
C. Wool, lace, and hemp
D. Cotton, velvet, and satin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Elsewhere, wealthy people wiped themselves with wool, lace or hemp, while less wealthy people used their hand when defecating into rivers, or cleaned themselves with various materials such as rags, wood shavings, leaves, grass, hay, stones, sand, moss, water, snow, ferns, plant husks, fruit skins, seashells, or corncobs, depending upon the country and weather conditions or social customs.

text:
Which of the following species of this object is also known as 'snow morel'?
A. Gyromitra tasmanica
B. Gyromitra anthracobia
C. Gyromitra montana
D. Gyromitra perlata
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Gyromitra montana – North American snow morel, possibly a synonym of "G. gigas"

text:
Which one of these materials is NOT commonly used in the manufacture of this object?
A. Straw

text:
In historical terms, which ancient civilization is NOT one of those suggested as possible originators of this object?
A. Ancient Sumerians
B. Ancient Rome
C. Indus Valley civilization
D. Ancient Egypt
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Many modern scholars suggest that the first this object was first developed by the ancient Sumerians in Mesopotamia... southeastern Europe and China have also been claimed as possible places of origin as well as Egypt.

text:
What is the primary historical use of this object?
A. Herding livestock
B. Guarding estates
C. Fetching small game
D. Hunting red deer by coursing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mention of the breed can be found in old Hungarian texts. They have historically been royal guard dogs, or guarded livestock, but have been increasingly found in homes as pets over the last seventy years.

text:
Which statement about the historical human perception and utilization of this object in the British Isles is true?
A. Historically used in ceremonial roles during royal events.
B. Perceived negatively and associated with promiscuity in early literature.
C. It was once worshipped as a spiritual guardian of homes.
D. It was primarily seen as a beneficial guardian against vermin.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the British Isles especially, the polecat was persecuted by gamekeepers, and became synonymous with promiscuity in early English literature.

text:
In powerlifting competitions, how far apart are the grip marks spaced on this object?
A. 1000 mm
B. 910 mm
C. 1200 mm
D. 810 mm
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Powerlifting bars have their grip marks spaced closer, at 810 mm.

text:
What historical factor may have influenced the breed of this object?
A. There was no crossbreeding
B. Crossbreeding with a Dachshund
C. Crossbreeding with a Poodle
D. Crossbreeding with a German Shepherd
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Some interbreeding with other breeds took place in the mid-1800s, which may have introduced Dachshund blood into the breed.

text:
What is the typical diet composition of this object in the Western United States?
A. Primarily insectivorous and herbivorous
B. Primarily small mammals
C. Primarily birds
D. Primarily aquatic animals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In some parts of the Western United States (such as in the Zion National Park in Utah), the gray fox is primarily insectivorous and herbivorous.

text:
How many species are contained within the genus of this object?
A. Five
B. Twelve
C. One
D. Two
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The genus 'Phacochoerus' contains two species.

text:
What is the primary distinguishing feature of the skull of this object compared to other North American canids?
A. The widely separated temporal ridges forming a U-shape
B. A smaller overall skull size
C. Extra teeth compared to other canids
D. The presence of a pronounced sagittal crest
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The skull can be easily distinguished from all other North American canids by its widely separated temporal ridges that form a U-shape.

text:
Which ingredient is NOT typically found in the making of this object?
A. Sugar
B. Vinegar
C. Flour
D. Water
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Dough is typically made by mixing flour with a small amount of water and/or other liquid, and sometimes includes flour yeast or other leavening agents as well as other ingredients such as various fats or flavorings.

text:
What best describes the habitat of this object?
A. Deserts and temperate forests
B. Mountaintop ice fields
C. Strictly aquatic environments
D. Deep oceanic trenches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Porcupines occupy a short range of habitats in tropical and temperate parts of Asia, Southern Europe, Africa, and North and South America. They live in forests and deserts.

text:
Which position is particularly important for this object when transporting a patient in shock?
A. Fowler's position
B. Upright position
C. Trendelenburg position
D. Flat position
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The feet can be raised to what is called the Trendelenburg position, indicated for patients in shock.

text:
What is the average wingspan of this object?
A. 46-52 cm
B. 50-60 cm
C. 20-22 cm
D. 33-35 cm
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Its typical weight is 400g, with an approximate length of 33 cm, and a wingspan of 46-52 cm.

text:
Which of the following is a native habitat for this object?
A. Northern Africa
B. Northeastern United States
C. Western Europe
D. Southeastern United States
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: This species is native to North America, where it is found mainly in the subtropical southeastern parts of the continent.

text:
What is the primary method of prey incapacitation used by this object?
A. Venom injection
B. Constriction
C. Stunning with its tail
D. Biting and shaking
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The boa first strikes at the prey, grabbing it with its teeth; it then proceeds to constrict the prey until death before consuming it whole.

text:
What is the primary historical use of this object?
A. Guarding livestock
B. Performing in circuses
C. Guiding blind persons
D. Hunting game animals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Mention of the breed can be found in old Hungarian texts. They have historically been royal guard dogs, or guarded livestock, but have been increasingly found in homes as pets over the last seventy years.

text:
What is this object primarily known for in terms of diet?
A. Herbivorous lifestyle
B. Omnivorous diet
C. Carnivorous preferences
D. Insectivorous habits
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A herbivore, it has adapted significantly with regard to locomotion and osmoregulation as a result of its diet.

text:
Which of the following environments is this object NOT adapted to live in?
A. Brackish water
B. Subtidal zones
C. Rock crevices in marine environments
D. Intertidal zones
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Chitons are exclusively and fully marine. This is in contrast to the bivalves, which were able to adapt to brackish water and fresh water...

text:
What type of vision capabilities does this object have?
A. Trichromat
B. Monochromat
C. Dichromat
D. Tetrachromat
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: This object has one of the most studied senses of vision in fishes. It has four kinds of cone cells, which are respectively sensitive to different colours: red, green, blue and ultraviolet. The ability to distinguish between four different primary colours classifies them as tetrachromats.

text:
Which type of optical system was first developed by William Hutchinson and used in this object to increase and focus light intensity?
A. Catoptric system
B. None of the above
C. Holophotal system
D. Dioptric system
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: William Hutchinson developed the first practical optical system in 1763, known as a catoptric system.

text:
In which geographic regions is this object naturally found?
A. Africa and Middle East
B. Australia and New Zealand
C. Europe and Northern Asia
D. United States, southern Canada, and northern Mexico
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Green snakes of the genus 'Opheodrys' are found in the United States, southern Canada, and northern Mexico.

text:
What is the notable genetic trait influencing this object's ability to absorb a specific mineral?
A. Zinc absorption
B. Calcium absorption
C. Iron absorption
D. Magnesium absorption
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Another health issue with Malamutes is zinc deficiency. This breed cannot easily absorb zinc, and infections, skin, and coat problems can arise.

text:
What kind of bait is most effective for catching this object?
A. Maggots, sweetcorn, and worms
B. Berries and small fruits
C. Small fishes and crustaceans
D. Artificial flies and lures
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The best methods and bait to catch tench are float fishing and legering with a swim feeder using maggots, sweetcorn, pellets, bread, and worms.

text:
In the Hornbostel-Sachs classification system, this object is classified as which type of instrument?
A. Membranophone
B. Chordophone
C. Aerophone
D. Idiophone
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The drum is a member of the percussion group of musical instruments. In the Hornbostel-Sachs classification system, it is a membranophone.

text:
What is the reproductive feature of the eggs of this object?
A. Eggs are viviparous and hatch inside the body
B. Eggs have a toxic, adhesive coating
C. Eggs are attached to vegetation with sticky tendrils
D. Eggs have a hard, calcified outer shell
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Eggs have a toxic, adhesive coating to help them stick to substrates.

text:
This object has been a favorite of various historical figures. Which of the following is NOT listed as an enthusiast of the breed?
A. Catherine the Great
B. King Louis XIV
C. Frederick the Great
D. Queen Victoria
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The breed has been popular with royalty. Among the royal aficionados are Queen Anne, Queen Victoria, Catherine the Great, Frederick the Great.

text:
In what role is this object noted to be unreliable according to historical records?
A. As a sheepdog
B. As a racing dog
C. As a guard dog
D. As a rescue dog
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Although at some points in history they have been used as watchdogs, unlike some breeds, the Irish Wolfhound is usually unreliable in this role as they are often friendly toward strangers...

text:
Which of these tasks is this object not traditionally used for?
A. Pulling carts
B. Sledding across mountainous regions
C. Guarding properties
D. Herding livestock
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Greater Swiss Mountain Dog was bred as a draught dog to pull heavy carts, to guard and move dairy cattle, and as a watchdog and family companion.

text:
What is the primary use of the stalks of this object?
A. Used as a natural dye
B. Eaten after being braised
C. Crushed and used as a spice
D. Used in making perfumes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: While the flower buds can be eaten much as small (and spiny) artichokes, more often the stems are eaten after being braised in cooking liquid.

text:
In the field of emergency medical services, this object's integration into ambulances includes which feature to prevent movement during transport?
A. Battery-powered hydraulics
B. Locking wheels
C. Adjustable side rails
D. Sprung latch integration
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: For ambulances, a collapsible wheeled stretcher, or gurney, is a type of stretcher on a variable-height wheeled frame. Normally, an integral lug on the stretcher locks into a sprung latch within the ambulance in order to prevent movement during transport.

text:
This object is commonly used for which of the following cooking methods?
A. Steaming
B. Frying
C. Deep frying
D. Poaching
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A frying pan, frypan, or skillet is a flat-bottomed pan used for frying, searing, and browning foods.

text:
What unusual characteristic does this object's scales have?
A. Large and rough
B. Very small and deeply embedded
C. Bright and reflective
D. No scales at all
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The tench has very small scales, which are deeply embedded in a thick skin.

text:
What type of steering does this object require to increase its maneuverability in tight spaces?
A. Front-wheel steering
B. Rear-wheel steering
C. No steering required
D. All-wheel steering
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: An important aspect of forklift operation is that it must have rear-wheel steering.

text:
How were the earliest forms of this object constructed by primitive people?
A. Forging iron into a fence
B. Piling loose field stones
C. Baking clay bricks
D. Using dried mud and straw
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The first stone walls were constructed by farmers and primitive people by piling loose field stones into a dry stone wall.

text:
What type of fertilization does this object use?
A. Partial internal fertilization
B. Internal fertilization
C. External fertilization
D. Asexual reproduction
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: These are the only North American frog species that reproduce by internal fertilization.

text:
Which epoch marks the first appearance of this object?
A. Triassic
B. Jurassic
C. Miocene
D. Cretaceous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Ostriches first appeared during the Miocene epoch.

text:
What was a significant advancement in the 1980s that improved the functionality of this object?
A. Incorporation of microcontrollers for managing data streams
B. Implementation of echo cancellation techniques
C. Development of acoustic coupler technology
D. Introduction of automatic error-correction protocols
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Echo cancellation was the next major advance in modem design.

text:
What social structure does this object exhibit?
A. Large clans without rigid dominance hierarchies
B. Solitary
C. Pairs
D. Small herds
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Dholes are more social than gray wolves, and have less of a dominance hierarchy, as seasonal scarcity of food is not a serious concern for them.

text:
What is the ideal type of meat for creating a rich flavor in this object when using beef or veal?
A. Filet mignon due to its tenderness
B. Sirloin because of its balanced fat content
C. Shin meat because it is low in fat and high in gristle
D. Ribeye for its marbling
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: If beef or veal is used, shin meat is ideal because it is very low in fat and very high in gristle, and although it is undesirable for most other purposes, it is near essential for the flavour of the consommé.

text:
Which country is credited with the invention of this object?
A. France
B. Germany
C. United States
D. United Kingdom
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The development of pencil sharpeners began in France.

text:
Which of these names was NOT historically used to refer to this object?
A. Zàng áo
B. Bankhar
C. Leonberger
D. Bhote Kukur
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The guardian type from which the modern Tibetan Mastiff breed has been derived was known across the ancient world by many names. 'Bhote Kukur' in Nepali as 'bhote' means someone from Tibet and 'kukur' means dog. The Chinese name for the breed is 'Zàng áo' (Cantonese: 'Tzong ngou'), meaning 'Tibetan Mastiff-dog'. In Mongolia, a similar-looking dog is called 'bankhar'.

text:
What is the traditional color combination of this object's coat?
A. Black with white markings
B. Solid red
C. Red with white markings
D. White with black markings
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The breed's coat only comes in a single colour combination of white with red markings, usually in a piebald pattern.

text:
What does the word used to describe this object originally mean in Persian or Arabic?
A. Eagle
B. Falcon
C. Nightingale
D. Sparrow
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The word "bulbul" derives from Persian or Arabic (بلبل), meaning nightingale.

text:
What is the typical longevity range for this object?
A. 10-12 years
B. 12-15 years
C. 8-10 years
D. 15-18 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The typical longevity of beagles is 12–15 years, which is a common lifespan for dogs of their size.

text:
What is the typical behavior of this object in terms of vocalization?
A. Howls instead of barking
B. Meows
C. Mostly silent
D. Barks frequently
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The Husky usually howls instead of barking.

text:
How has the function of this object evolved over time?
A. From a paper cutting tool to an envelope opening tool
B. From a writing tool to an envelope opener
C. From a measuring device to a paper cutting tool
D. From a bookbinding tool to a personal grooming device
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Letter openers "evolved" from paper knives into longer, blunter blades for the sole purpose of opening envelopes.

text:
During what months does this object typically breed in the Northern Hemisphere?
A. December to February
B. April to May
C. September to November
D. June to August
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The black stork breeds between April and May in the Northern Hemisphere.

text:
What was the primary material used in the original construction of this object?
A. Cloth
B. Boiled leather
C. Plastic
D. Metal
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The basic Pickelhaube was made of hardened (boiled) leather, given a glossy-black finish, and reinforced with metal trim.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object?
A. Fish and marine invertebrates
B. Small mammals and birds
C. Primarily fruits and vegetables supplemented with small rodents
D. Large wild hooved mammals and occasionally smaller animals or livestock
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mantises are generalist predators of arthropods. Larger mantises sometimes eat smaller individuals of their own species, as well as small vertebrates such as lizards, frogs, small birds and fishes.

text:
Which of the following is a unique predatory strategy used by this object?
A. Stunning prey with sound waves
B. Breaching behavior to catch seals
C. Using bioluminescence to attract prey
D. Creating whirlpools to trap fish
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A breach is the result of a high speed approach to the surface with the resulting momentum taking the shark partially or completely clear of the water. This is a hunting technique employed by great white sharks whilst hunting seals.

text:
Which material became more commonly used in the construction of this object starting in the 1970s?
A. Copper
B. Aluminum
C. Plastic
D. Steel
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Starting in the 1970s, use of aluminium increased, eventually taking over the vast majority of vehicular radiator applications.

text:
Which ancient civilization is known for having this object as early as 3500 BC, and its findings in burial pits and royal tombs?
A. Ancient Egypt
B. Indus Valley
C. Sumer
D. Minoan Civilization
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The earliest harps and lyres were found in Sumer, 3500 BC, and several harps were found in burial pits and royal tombs in Ur.

text:
What steering mechanism is traditionally associated with this object when it possesses four wheels?
A. A rudder
B. Turntable or fifth wheel
C. Flap control
D. A steering wheel
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A four-wheeled vehicle is also steered by the shafts or pole, which are attached to the front axle; this swivels on a 'turntable' or 'fifth wheel' beneath the vehicle.

text:
Which color phenotype is considered the least common in this object?
A. Blue
B. Fawn
C. Black
D. Red
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The "fawn" coloration is the least common, occurring only when both the color and dilution genes have two recessive alleles (i.e., bbdd).

text:
What best describes the habitat of this object?
A. Deserts and temperate forests
B. Mountaintop ice fields
C. Strictly aquatic environments
D. Deep oceanic trenches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Porcupines occupy a short range of habitats in tropical and temperate parts of Asia, Southern Europe, Africa, and North and South America. They live in forests and deserts.

text:
Which of the following periods marks the first significant diversification of this object?
A. Cretaceous period
B. Carboniferous period
C. Triassic period
D. Jurassic period
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Ants evolved from wasp-like ancestors in the Cretaceous period, about 140 million years ago, and diversified after the rise of flowering plants.

text:
Which cooking method is not typically achievable with this object?
A. Boiling
B. Steaming
C. Baking
D. Frying
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Unlike conventional ovens, microwave ovens usually do not directly brown or caramelize food, since they rarely attain the necessary temperatures to produce Maillard reactions.

text:
How does this object ensure its eggs receive enough oxygen?
A. Eggs hatch underwater to access oxygen dissolved in water
B. Symbiotic algae within the eggs photosynthesize and produce oxygen
C. Parental care includes regularly moving eggs to the water surface
D. The eggs possess lungs for direct air breathing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Eggs of "A. maculatum" can have a symbiotic relationship with a green alga, "Oophila amblystomatis"... The "Oophila" alga photosynthesizes and produces oxygen in the jelly.

text:
What primary function does this object serve when interacted with by wind or breath?
A. It changes color
B. It spins
C. It produces sound
D. It illuminates
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: It is designed to spin when blown upon by a person or by the wind.

text:
What type of sensory organs does this object possess for light detection?
A. Ocelli with aragonite-based lenses
B. Simple photoreceptor cells
C. Statocysts
D. Osphradia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In some cases, however, they are modified to form ocelli, with a cluster of individual photoreceptor cells lying beneath a small aragonite-based lens.

text:
What unique physical characteristic does this object possess compared to other breeds of the same type?
A. A completely white coat
B. A long coat
C. A short, smooth coat
D. No distinctive coloring
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Like the other Sennenhund, it is the only breed of Sennenhund dogs with a long coat.

text:
What historical purpose did this object primarily serve in police duties?
A. Transport of heavy equipment
B. Surveillance and intelligence gathering
C. Transportation and detainment of prisoners
D. Patrol and traffic control
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Police vans are usually employed for the transport of prisoners inside a specially adapted cell in the vehicle.

text:
What is the primary method through which this object disperses its spores?
A. Attracting insects with its odor
B. By wind dispersion
C. Animal ingestion and excretion
D. Through water flow
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The spore mass typically smells of carrion or dung, and attracts flies, beetles and other insects to help disperse the spores.

text:
What classic mechanical principle does this object demonstrate?
A. None of the above
B. Third-class lever
C. Second-class lever
D. First-class lever
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The wheelbarrow is designed to distribute the weight of its load between the wheel and the operator, so enabling the convenient carriage of heavier and bulkier loads than would be possible were the weight carried entirely by the operator. As such it is a second-class lever.

text:
Which materials are most commonly used for the mesh of this object?
A. Nylon and polyester
B. Copper and stainless steel
C. Bronze and brass
D. Aluminum and fiberglass
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The most common materials used for the mesh of window screens are aluminum and fiberglass.

text:
What group classification does this object belong to according to the FCI?
A. Group 1 (Sheepdogs and Cattle Dogs)
B. Group 9 (Companion and Toy Dogs)
C. Group 7 (Pointer group)
D. Group 5 (Spitz and primitive types)
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: belongs to the FCI group 7 (Pointer group)

text:
What is a feature of the modern versions of this object that differs from earlier designs?
A. Is completely ornamental with no practical use
B. Includes digital components for electronic use
C. Made purely from organic materials
D. Incorporates a retractable razor blade
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Some modern openers have a retractable razor blade inside a plastic handle.

text:
What material consideration is important for the production of this object to ensure safety?
A. Flexibility to prevent damage
B. Hardness to enhance durability
C. Softness and BPA-free materials for health safety
D. Electrical insulation for electronic integration
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In 2011 use of bisphenol A in baby bottles was forbidden in all EU countries. From 2012, other countries started following the American Food and Drug Administration's initiative to regulate baby bottles.

text:
What is the typical lifespan of this object in the wild?
A. 1-3 years
B. 6-8 years
C. 3-5 years
D. 8-10 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Maximum lifespan in the wild is estimated to be 8 to 10 years, but one frog lived for almost 16 years in captivity.

text:
What is a distinctive feature of this object's trunk?
A. Three finger-like processes at the tip
B. Two finger-like processes at the tip
C. No finger-like processes at the tip
D. One finger-like process at the tip
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The tip of their trunk has one finger-like process.

text:
Which statement about the historical human perception and utilization of this object in the British Isles is true?
A. Historically used in ceremonial roles during royal events.
B. Perceived negatively and associated with promiscuity in early literature.
C. It was once worshipped as a spiritual guardian of homes.
D. It was primarily seen as a beneficial guardian against vermin.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the British Isles especially, the polecat was persecuted by gamekeepers, and became synonymous with promiscuity in early English literature.

text:
In which decade did this object become noticeably popular as a fashion trend?
A. 1950s
B. 1970s
C. 1960s
D. 1940s
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Instances of clothing resembling this object have been identified as far back as c. 1390–1370 BCE...they were generally not called 'mini' until the 1960s.

text:
What era popularized this object in America?
A. The Great Depression
B. The Industrial Revolution
C. The Roaring Twenties
D. The Hippie Era
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The 'hippie' era (1967–1980) popularized them in America in songs and movies.

text:
In which countries is this object commonly found?
A. Russia, Mongolia, China, and Japan
B. Malaysia, Indonesia, Philippines, and Thailand
C. India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and Bhutan
D. Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, and Fiji
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Indian cobra is native to the Indian subcontinent and can be found throughout India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and southern Nepal.

text:
What type of coat is considered typical for this object?
A. Short and smooth
B. Fine, straight, and silky
C. Curly and coarse
D. Wiry and rough
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: For adult Yorkshire Terriers, importance is placed on coat colour, quality, and texture. The hair must be glossy, fine, straight, and silky.

text:
What is the typical diet of this object?
A. Primarily insects
B. Fish and aquatic organisms
C. Small mammals and birds
D. Grass and small plants
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The eastern diamondback rattlesnake forages actively or lies in ambush for small mammals, especially rabbits and rice rats ("Oryzomys"). The diet also includes birds.

text:
What unique visual characteristic do pearls from this object typically possess?
A. Blue luminescence
B. Pink color
C. Square shape
D. Black color
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Conch pearls occur in a range of hues, including white, brown, and orange, with many intermediate shades, but pink is the colour most associated with the conch pearl.

text:
How does this object typically react when threatened?
A. It hides its head and exposes its tail
B. It curls its tail, exposing a brightly colored underside
C. It immediately attacks the predator
D. It releases a toxic spray
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Rather than trying to bite a predator, the snake winds up its tail into a corkscrew, exposing its brightly colored belly.

text:
What is the typical life expectancy of this object?
A. 14-16 years
B. 8-10 years
C. 9-11 years
D. 11-13 years

Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The moving-coil principle commonly used today in speakers was patented in 1924 by Chester W. Rice and Edward W. Kellogg.

text:
At what age does this object typically reach sexual maturity?
A. 4-5 years
B. 1-2 years
C. 10-12 years
D. 7-8 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Sexual maturity is attained at the age of four to five years.

text:
What type of time display does this object use?
A. Water flow measurements
B. Sundial markers
C. Numerals or other symbols
D. Rotating hands
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A digital clock is a type of clock that displays the time digitally (i.e. in numerals or other symbols), as opposed to an analog clock, where the time is indicated by the positions of rotating hands.

text:
What is the primary functional transformation achieved by this object?
A. It converts rotary motion of a shaft to linear motion of a fluid
B. It converts solar energy to electrical energy
C. It converts thermal energy into mechanical energy
D. It converts chemical energy into light energy
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The paddle wheel is a device for converting between rotary motion of a shaft and linear motion of a fluid.

text:
What is the primary distinguishing feature of the skull of this object compared to other North American canids?
A. The widely separated temporal ridges forming a U-shape
B. A smaller overall skull size
C. Extra teeth compared to other canids
D. The presence of a pronounced sagittal crest
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The skull can be easily distinguished from all other North American canids by its widely separated temporal ridges that form a U-shape.

text:
In the historical development of 'this object', which material was NOT typically used in its construction?
A. Hessian
B. Wooden stave
C. Sulfur
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Torches were usually constructed of a wooden stave with one end wrapped in a material which was soaked in a flammable substance. In ancient Rome some torches were made of sulfur mixed with lime.

text:
This object often contains which of the following materials to absorb impact?
A. Metal shavings
B. Grains, sand, rags
C. Liquid gel
D. Air only
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Punching bags are often filled with grains, sand, rags, or other material...

text:
Which of the following describes a key difference in construction between this object and the trumpet?
A. This object uses rotary valves, while the trumpet uses piston valves.
B. This object has a deeper mouthpiece cup than the trumpet.
C. The trumpet has a longer tubing compared to this object.
D. The trumpet uses a mute chamber for sound modulation.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The cornet mouthpiece has a shorter and narrower shank than that of a trumpet so it can fit the cornet's smaller mouthpiece receiver. The cup size is often deeper than that of a trumpet mouthpiece.

text:
Based on a 2010 genetic study, what was suggested about the taxonomy of this object?
A. No taxonomic changes are necessary
B. All species should be placed in separate genera
C. Two species could be placed in monotypic genera
D. Only one species is different enough to warrant its own genus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A 2010 study of mitochondrial DNA of the spoonbills by Chesser and colleagues found that the roseate and yellow-billed spoonbills were each other's closest relative, and the two were descended from an early offshoot from the ancestors of the other four spoonbill species.

text:
In historical terms, which ancient civilization is NOT one of those suggested as possible originators of this object?
A. Ancient Sumerians
B. Ancient Rome
C. Indus Valley civilization
D. Ancient Egypt
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Many modern scholars suggest that the first this object was first developed by the ancient Sumerians in Mesopotamia... southeastern Europe and China have also been claimed as possible places of origin as well as Egypt.

text:
What is the primary distinction between this object and a typical bassinet?
A. This object rocks but is non-mobile.
B. This object is typically more expensive.
C. This object is used for older children.
D. This object is always made of plastic.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A cradle is an infant bed which rocks but is non-mobile. It is distinct from a typical bassinet which is a basket-like container on free-standing legs with wheels.

text:
What colors does the AKC accept for showing this object?
A. Merle
B. All colors
C. Blue and fawn
D. Solid or stag red and the black or chocolate with rust points
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: For showing in the United States, the AKC disqualifies all colors but the solid or stag red and the black or chocolate with rust points.

text:
Which of the following animals is known to prey occasionally on this object?
A. Killer whale
B. Common dolphin
C. Blue whale
D. Great white shark
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Though apex predators, tiger sharks are sometimes taken by groups of killer whales.

text:
Which material is NOT commonly used to construct this object?
A. Polyester
B. Cotton
C. Polyethylene
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mosquito netting can be made from cotton, polyethylene, polyester, polypropylene, or nylon.

text:
In which decade was the dynamic version of this object invented?
A. 1920s
B. 1950s
C. 1930s
D. 1940s
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The moving-coil principle commonly used today in speakers was patented in 1924 by Chester W. Rice and Edward W. Kellogg.

text:
Which health issue is not commonly associated with this object?
A. Cardiomyopathy
B. Osteosarcoma
C. Bloat
D. Hip dysplasia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The serious health issues in the breed include cardiomyopathy; osteosarcoma; bloat; stomach or splenic torsion, called Gastric dilatation volvulus; and cystinuria.

text:
What alternative materials have historically been used for the same purpose as this object?
A. Wool, linen, and silk
B. Leather, beads, and papyrus
C. Wool, lace, and hemp
D. Cotton, velvet, and satin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Elsewhere, wealthy people wiped themselves with wool, lace or hemp, while less wealthy people used their hand when defecating into rivers, or cleaned themselves with various materials such as rags, wood shavings, leaves, grass, hay, stones, sand, moss, water, snow, ferns, plant husks, fruit skins, seashells, or corncobs, depending upon the country and weather conditions or social customs.

text:
What is the romantic story associated with the origin of this object?
A. It was believed to have been a gift from a visiting foreign ruler.
B. It swam from a sinking ship and was so beautiful that it was used widely for breeding.
C. It was the chosen companion of a famous religious leader.
D. It was depicted as the hero in an ancient local legend.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: There is a romantic story of a blue dog swimming ashore from a shipwreck: the coat of this dog was so lovely that it was mated with all the female Wheaten Terriers in Kerry...

text:
When did this object see remarkable decline in sales due to changes in popular hairstyle preferences?
A. In the 1960s
B. In the 1970s
C. In the 1990s
D. In the 1940s
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Sales of hairspray declined in the 1970s as hairstyles became predominately worn straight and loose.

text:
What is a notable reproductive method observed in this object?
A. External fertilization in water
B. Parthenogenesis exclusively
C. Egg laying with external incubation
D. Live birth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Boa constrictors are viviparous, giving birth to live young.

text:
What innovation was primarily responsible for the decline in use of this object from the 1980s onward?
A. Wireless communication
B. Internet-based calling
C. DTMF (dual-tone multi-frequency) push-button dialing
D. Optical fiber technology
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: From the 1980s onward, the rotary dial was gradually supplanted by DTMF (dual-tone multi-frequency) push-button dialing.

text:
Which ingredient is NOT typically found in the making of this object?
A. Sugar
B. Vinegar
C. Flour
D. Water
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Dough is typically made by mixing flour with a small amount of water and/or other liquid, and sometimes includes flour yeast or other leavening agents as well as other ingredients such as various fats or flavorings.

text:
What distinctive coat characteristic does this object possess for functional reasons?
A. Dense, white coat to distinguish from predators
B. Water-resistant fur for swimming
C. Black and tan coloration to enhance camouflage
D. Short hair to stay cool in desert conditions
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Shepherds purposefully bred the Kuvasz to have a light colored coat so that it would be easier for the shepherds to distinguish the Kuvasz from wolves that would prey on the livestock during the night.

text:
Which of the following coat types is associated with this object?
A. Thick and double-coated
B. Long and wiry
C. Short, smooth and close
D. Heavy and water-resistant
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The coat is short, smooth and close.

text:
What is the common Japanese name for this object, by which it is also known in the United States' supplement market?
A. Shiitake
B. Maitake
C. Umeboshi
D. Enoki
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the United States' supplement market, as well as in Asian grocery stores, the mushroom is known by its Japanese name maitake (舞茸, "dancing mushroom").

text:
Which of the following items of furniture is similar in function to this object?
A. Desk
B. Dining chair
C. Glider
D. Sofa
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: BULLET::::- Glider (furniture), a chair that rocks via suspension from a four-bar linkage

text:
Which health condition is this object NOT predisposed to?
A. Canine pemphigus
B. Diabetes mellitus
C. Chronic ear infections
D. Lymphoma
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Chow-Chow can suffer from entropion, glaucoma, juvenile cataracts, lymphoma, hip dysplasia, diabetes mellitus, canine pemphigus, and gastric cancer.

text:
Which condiment is the most popular topping for this object in the United States?
A. Mustard
B. Barbecue sauce
C. Ketchup
D. Mayonnaise
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In 2005, the US-based National Hot Dog & Sausage Council found mustard to be the most popular.

text:
Which of the following is NOT a feature introduced in the third-generation of this object according to the device's history?
A. High impedance headphone support
B. External headphone amplifier
C. Weak bass response
D. Wi-Fi connectivity
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The third-generation iPod had a weak bass response... this issue was completely masked when driving high-impedance (line level) loads, such as an external headphone amplifier.

text:
How has the fur of this object historically contributed to its economic value?
A. Fur from this object was considered worthless until the mid-19th century, then used for trimmings and dyes.
B. Its fur has always been a luxury item prized for its softness and used in royal garments.
C. The fur is too rough for use in clothing, so it has no economic value.
D. Its fur is highly durable and primarily used for making high-quality rugs.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Prior to the mid-19th century, coyote fur was considered worthless.

text:
What is a unique reproductive behavior observed in this object?
A. Copulations tend to last for half a minute
B. Males gestate and give birth to young
C. Females lay eggs
D. Copulations last for hours
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Copulations tend to last for half a minute.

text:
Which uniformed groups in the UK specifically require the use of this object when wearing their black tie?
A. All branches of the British Armed Forces
B. The Royal Navy and Marines
C. The British Army and Navy
D. The Royal Air Force and Royal Air Force Cadets
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Windsor knot is the only tie knot that is to be used by all personnel in the Royal Air Force and the Royal Air Force Cadets (ATC and CCF(RAF)) in the UK when wearing their black tie while in uniform.

text:
What genetic lineage is this object associated with?
A. Has no clear genetic lineage
B. Linked to a female wolf-male dog hybridization post-domestication
C. Descended directly from the Eurasian otter
D. Originated solely from ancient dog breeds
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The breed falls under the mitochondrial DNA sub-clade referred to as d1 that is only found in northern Scandinavia. It is the result of a female wolf-male dog hybridization that occurred post-domestication.

text:
What does the term 'mandarins' refer to concerning this object?
A. The characteristic gait of the run
B. The facial hair resembling a Fu Manchu mustache
C. A special diet followed
D. A unique training method developed
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A specimen may have facial hair that looks like a Fu Manchu mustache. The mustache is called mandarins.

text:
What genetic lineage is this object associated with?
A. Has no clear genetic lineage
B. Linked to a female wolf-male dog hybridization post-domestication
C. Descended directly from the Eurasian otter
D. Originated solely from ancient dog breeds
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The breed falls under the mitochondrial DNA sub-clade referred to as d1 that is only found in northern Scandinavia. It is the result of a female wolf-male dog hybridization that occurred post-domestication.

text:
What is the specific style of slicing this object found particularly in St. Louis?
A. Sliced vertically multiple times
B. Not sliced at all, sold whole
C. Diced into small cubes
D. Sliced horizontally
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The St. Louis style bagel...The St. Louis style bagels are sliced vertically multiple times, instead of the traditional single horizontal slice.

text:
What genetic health disorder is this object's breed screened for before breeding, particularly in field lines?
A. Hyperthyroidism
B. Dilated cardiomyopathy
C. Progressive retinal atrophy
D. Phosphofructokinase deficiency
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Health issues are usually similar in both types of English Springer however phosphofructokinase deficiency, in particular, can appear more in field lines, however, carriers in show lines have been identified.

text:
What is a primary component of the highest concentration form of this object?
A. Ethanol
B. Aroma compounds (15-40%)
C. Water
D. Essential oils
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: - parfum or extrait, in English known as perfume extract, pure perfume, or simply perfume: 15–40% aromatic compounds (IFRA: typically ~20%);

text:
What is the typical behavior of this object in terms of vocalization?
A. Howls instead of barking
B. Meows
C. Mostly silent
D. Barks frequently
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The Husky usually howls instead of barking.

text:
What adaptation does this object exhibit to protect against predators?
A. It plays dead when threatened
B. It emits a toxic substance when threatened
C. It camouflages with the environment
D. At least one individual keeps guard while others feed on the ground
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Species that feed on the ground are very vulnerable to predator attack. The cockatoo has evolved a behavioural adaptation to protect against this: whenever there is a flock on the ground, there is at least one high up in a tree (usually a dead tree), keeping guard.

text:
Which material is NOT commonly used to construct this object?
A. Polyester
B. Cotton
C. Polyethylene
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mosquito netting can be made from cotton, polyethylene, polyester, polypropylene, or nylon.

text:
Which of the following is a process associated with the formation of this object?
A. Wave refraction
B. Volcanic activity
C. Thermal erosion
D. Chemical precipitation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Shoaling can also diffract waves, so the waves change direction. Refraction also occurs as waves move towards a beach.

text:
This object has an unusual anatomical feature in its neck. What is it?
A. Flexible joint allowing 270-degree rotation
B. Fusion of the first two neck vertebrae
C. Ability to extend its neck to twice its original length
D. Presence of four additional vertebrae compared to similar species
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: They are the only birds in which the first and second neck vertebrae (the atlas and axis respectively) are fused together; this probably provides a more stable platform for carrying the bill.

text:
Which statement about the historical human perception and utilization of this object in the British Isles is true?
A. Historically used in ceremonial roles during royal events.
B. Perceived negatively and associated with promiscuity in early literature.
C. It was once worshipped as a spiritual guardian of homes.
D. It was primarily seen as a beneficial guardian against vermin.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the British Isles especially, the polecat was persecuted by gamekeepers, and became synonymous with promiscuity in early English literature.

text:
What type of metamorphosis does this object undergo?
A. Reversed metamorphosis
B. Partial metamorphosis
C. No metamorphosis
D. Complete metamorphosis
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Like other Exopterygota, the leafhoppers undergo direct development from nymph to adult without a pupal stage.

text:
In powerlifting competitions, how far apart are the grip marks spaced on this object?
A. 1000 mm
B. 910 mm
C. 1200 mm
D. 810 mm
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Powerlifting bars have their grip marks spaced closer, at 810 mm.

text:
What technical improvement was specifically noted to be integrated into this object by the 1980s?
A. On-board electronics to measure threshing efficiency
B. Automated steering systems
C. Solar power modules
D. On-board hydraulics
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In about the 1980s on-board electronics were introduced to measure threshing efficiency.

text:
In the field of emergency medical services, this object's integration into ambulances includes which feature to prevent movement during transport?
A. Battery-powered hydraulics
B. Locking wheels
C. Adjustable side rails
D. Sprung latch integration
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: For ambulances, a collapsible wheeled stretcher, or gurney, is a type of stretcher on a variable-height wheeled frame. Normally, an integral lug on the stretcher locks into a sprung latch within the ambulance in order to prevent movement during transport.

text:
What etymological origin does the term for this object have?
A. Derived from an ancient Greek word meaning 'house of nature'
B. Based on a French word meaning 'garden'
C. Originates from a Middle English word meaning 'safe haven'
D. Comes from a Latin word meaning 'bee'
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The base of the word comes from the Latin word 'apis' meaning 'bee'.

text:
What type of inflorescence does this object come from?
A. Raceme
B. Panicle
C. Spike
D. Umbel
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Flowers are showy, insect- or bird-pollinated, with four or five petals fused into a lobed corolla tube, arranged in a panicle inflorescence.

text:
In terms of feeding, this object can be classified as:
A. Insectivore
B. Herbivore
C. Carnivore
D. Omnivore
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Elephants are classified as megaherbivores.

text:
What is the typical hunting technique of this object?
A. Hunting by sound
B. Tracking by scent
C. Digging for prey
D. Chasing by sight
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Salukis are sighthounds – hunting by sight more than scent or sound – and run their quarry down to kill or retrieve it.

text:
What is the typical diameter of this object's web?
A. Up to 3 feet (90 cm)
B. Up to 1 foot (30 cm)
C. Up to 2 feet (60 cm)
D. Up to 4 feet (120 cm)
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The web of the yellow garden spider is distinctive: a circular shape up to 2 feet (60 cm) in diameter...

text:
What is the historic origin of this object, used both for hunting and as a guardian?
A. Germany
B. Ireland
C. Scotland
D. France
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Irish Wolfhound is a historic sighthound dog breed from Ireland that has by its presence and substantial size inspired literature, poetry and mythology.

text:
What type of usage is most associated with this object?
A. Long-distance interstate trucking
B. Local deliveries to residences and businesses
C. Race car transport
D. Heavy industrial equipment hauling
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Multi-stop trucks [...] are a type of light-duty and medium-duty truck created for local deliveries to residences and businesses.

text:
Which of the following was not a use of this object during its early development in Europe?
A. Siege weapon
B. Field artillery
C. Naval artillery
D. Anti-cavalry weapon
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: By the end of the 14th century cannon were widespread throughout Eurasia. Cannon were used primarily as anti-infantry weapons until around 1374 when cannon were recorded to have breached walls for the first time in Europe.

text:
In which Chinese province would this object traditionally contain mushrooms without strong spices to preserve the original flavor?
A. Sichuan
B. Fujian
C. Guangdong
D. Yunnan
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In neighbouring Yunnan, although spicy broths are equally popular, there is another predominant type of hot pot that is made with various wild or planted mushrooms.

text:
What is the primary reason for nesting behavior in this object?
A. To avoid predators during feeding
B. To prepare for migration
C. For sleeping and resting
D. For reproductive purposes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Gorillas construct nests for daytime and night use. Nests tend to be simple aggregations of branches and leaves about 1 m in diameter and are constructed by individuals.

text:
Which term is NOT commonly used to refer to a person who plays this object?
A. Flutist
B. Harmonist
C. Flautist
D. Fluter
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A musician who plays the flute can be referred to as a flute player, flautist, flutist, less commonly, fluter or flutenist.

text:
What was the original purpose of this object in early modern Europe?
A. As a fashion statement
B. To store food items
C. To carry books
D. To hold coins
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Early modern Europeans wore purses for one sole purpose: to carry coins.

text:
This object has an unusual anatomical feature in its neck. What is it?
A. Flexible joint allowing 270-degree rotation
B. Fusion of the first two neck vertebrae
C. Ability to extend its neck to twice its original length
D. Presence of four additional vertebrae compared to similar species
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: They are the only birds in which the first and second neck vertebrae (the atlas and axis respectively) are fused together; this probably provides a more stable platform for carrying the bill.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object?
A. Insects and small frogs
B. Small birds and eggs
C. Grasses and small plants
D. Toads and occasionally rodents and insects
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mantises are generalist predators of arthropods. Larger mantises sometimes eat smaller individuals of their own species, as well as small vertebrates such as lizards, frogs, small birds and fishes.

text:
This object has been a favorite of various historical figures. Which of the following is NOT listed as an enthusiast of the breed?
A. Catherine the Great
B. King Louis XIV
C. Frederick the Great
D. Queen Victoria
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The breed has been popular with royalty. Among the royal aficionados are Queen Anne, Queen Victoria, Catherine the Great, Frederick the Great.

text:
What special feature of this object's jaw increases its bite grip strength?
A. Elastic ligaments
B. Jaw locking mechanism
C. Mandibular condyles connect to long cavities in the skull
D. Multiple sets of teeth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Badger mandibular condyles connect to long cavities in their skulls, which gives resistance to jaw dislocation and increases their bite grip strength.

text:
What type of time display does this object use?
A. Water flow measurements
