B. Sundial markers
C. Numerals or other symbols
D. Rotating hands
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A digital clock is a type of clock that displays the time digitally (i.e. in numerals or other symbols), as opposed to an analog clock, where the time is indicated by the positions of rotating hands.

text:
Which location experiences nearly 300 days of clear skies and hosts an early modern version of this object?
A. Ural Mountains, Russia
B. Pyrenees, France
C. Appalachian Mountains, USA
D. Alps, Switzerland
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The first modern solar furnace is believed to have been built in France in 1949 by Professor Félix Trombe. It is now still in place at Mont Louis, near Odeillo. The Pyrenees were chosen as the site because the area experiences clear skies up to 300 days a year.

text:
Which mass extinction event marked the final disappearance of this object?
A. Permian-Triassic extinction event
B. Cretaceous-Paleogene extinction event
C. Late Devonian extinction
D. End-Ordovician mass extinction
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Trilobites disappeared in the mass extinction at the end of the Permian about 252 million years ago.

text:
What term is used to describe a group of this object?
A. Troop
B. Pack
C. Mob
D. Cluster
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A group of meerkats is called a "mob", "gang" or "clan".

text:
Which of the following best describes the physical characteristics of this object's carapace?
A. Thick, leathery skin with embedded minuscule osteoderms
B. Smooth and soft with no distinct textures
C. Highly flexible with a rubber-like consistency
D. Covered with hard, bony scutes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Instead of scutes, it has thick, leathery skin with embedded minuscule osteoderms.

text:
According to cultural references, why is this object unlikely to build its nest in trees?
A. Due to its inability to fly
B. Because it primarily inhabits caves
C. Due to a historical legend involving a fall
D. Due to its preference for wet climates
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: According to Greek legend, the first partridge appeared when Daedalus threw his nephew, Perdix, off the sacred hill of Athena in a fit of jealous rage. Supposedly mindful of his fall, the bird does not build its nest in the trees, nor take lofty flights and avoids high places.

text:
What type of life stages does this object undergo?
A. Metamorphosis from larva to adult
B. Binary fission
C. Complete metamorphosis with pupal stage
D. Partial metamorphosis with egg, nymph, and adult stages
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mantises go through three life stages: egg, nymph, and adult (mantises are among the hemimetabolous insects).

text:
What technical advancement in the early 20th century significantly contributed to the development of this object?
A. Development of durable Nichrome wire
B. Creation of non-stick surfaces
C. Discovery of microwave radiation
D. Invention of the vacuum tube
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The problem of the heating element was solved in 1905 by a young engineer named Albert Marsh, who designed an alloy of nickel and chromium, which came to be known as Nichrome.

text:
What is the distinctive feature of this object compared to most common necktie knots?
A. It features a unique single loop.
B. It is thicker and requires a special type of tie.
C. It is narrower and more asymmetric.
D. It is wider and more balanced.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Windsor is a wider knot than most common knots, and while not truly symmetric is more balanced than the common four-in-hand knot.

text:
In terms of grooming, what is the recommended procedure to maintain the ideal coat quality for this object as depicted?
A. Bathing with special shampoo
B. Minimal grooming required
C. Hand stripping only
D. Regular brushing and clipping
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Wire fox terriers kept for show are hand stripped; if the hair becomes too long, it is taken out by hand in order to preserve the colors and the glossiness of the coat.

text:
This object, used primarily in sexual bondage play, is designed to restrain or position individuals. What is it called?
A. Bondage strap
B. Bondage bar
C. Bondage hook
D. Bondage ring
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: - Bondage hook, used in sexual bondage play

text:
Which of the following is NOT a true characteristic of this object as a surname?
A. They have not been domesticated
B. Their young can fend for themselves soon after birth
C. They generally live in warrens
D. The European species can run up to 70 km/h
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: All rabbits (except the cottontail rabbits) live underground in burrows or warrens, while hares (and cottontail rabbits) live in simple nests above the ground, and usually do not live in groups.

text:
Which of the following diseases can this object carry that is harmful to humans?
A. Lyme disease
B. Influenza
C. Rabies
D. Herpes B virus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Nearly all (73–100%) pet and captive rhesus macaques are carriers of the herpes B virus. This virus is harmless to macaques, but infections of humans, while rare, are potentially fatal.

text:
What is the traditional shape of this object?
A. A single loop
B. A straight line
C. A twisted knot
D. A double loop
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The traditional pretzel shape is a distinctive symmetrical form...

text:
What kind of temperament is this object known for?
A. Shy and reserved
B. Aggressive and energetic
C. Dominant and territorial
D. Docile and friendly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Scottish Deerhound is gentle and extremely friendly, docile and eager to please, with a bearing of gentle dignity.

text:
What is a significant environmental impact mentioned about this object when introduced to non-native regions?
A. It enhances biodiversity by creating habitats
B. It competes with local species for food
C. It depletes seabed flora creating a desert
D. It has no significant impact
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In the Barents Sea it is an invasive species and its population is increasing tremendously. This is causing great concern to local environmentalists and local fishermen, as the crab eats everything it comes across and is spreading very rapidly, eating most seabed life and creating a desert.

text:
This object's diet predominantly consists of what type of food?
A. Freshwater algae
B. Grass and weeds
C. Tree and shrub leaves
D. Other insects
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Phasmids are herbivorous, feeding mostly on the leaves of trees and shrubs.

text:
What was a major transformation in the acceptance of this object in America during the 1960s?
A. They began to be paired with suits
B. They became associated with sports
C. They were worn with shorts
D. They were predominantly worn by women
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In the mid-1950s, further continental influences brought a more elegant image to light, lower-cut this objects, which moved from purely casual use to being paired with suits in the 1960s (but still only in America).

text:
Which of these materials is commonly associated with the manufacture of this object?
A. Canvas
B. Plastic
C. Glass
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Mail pouch is a strong material (e.g., canvas) mail bag designed to lock at the top to prevent access into the bag.

text:
Which description best fits the natural habitat of this object?
A. Rivers, lakes, and mangrove swamps
B. Deserts and arid regions
C. Tropical rainforests
D. Deep oceanic waters
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The common hippo inhabits rivers, lakes and mangrove swamps...

text:
In which country did this object painted red to celebrate Olympic achievements, later face vandalism?
A. United Kingdom
B. Canada
C. United States
D. Australia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In 2012, to celebrate Olympic gold medals for Team GB, selected boxes were painted gold. One was defaced briefly by a vandal with graffiti.

text:
Which type of this object would be considered inappropriate at most formal black or white tie events?
A. Clip-on
B. Self-tie
C. Pre-tied
D. Adjustable
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Wearing a ready-tied this object at formal occasions requiring a black or white tie dress code is usually considered a faux pas.

text:
What material is this object typically made from?
A. Cotton
B. Silk
C. Plastic
D. Paper
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Traditional envelopes are made from sheets of paper cut to one of three shapes: a rhombus, a short-arm cross or a kite.

text:
Which term best describes this object in terms of its digestion?
A. Folivorous
B. Insectivorous
C. Carnivorous
D. Omnivorous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Colobines are folivorous, though their diet may be supplemented with flowers, fruits and the occasional insect.

text:
What is the typical preparation method for this object in a home kitchen?
A. Grilled on a barbecue
B. In a skillet over a stovetop
C. Deep fried in oil
D. Cooked in a slow cooker
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Pot pie can be prepared in a number of ways including in a skillet over a stovetop, in a baking dish in an oven, or in a Mountain Pie Iron over a campfire.

text:
What type of coat is considered typical for this object?
A. Short and smooth
B. Fine, straight, and silky
C. Curly and coarse
D. Wiry and rough
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: For adult Yorkshire Terriers, importance is placed on coat colour, quality, and texture. The hair must be glossy, fine, straight, and silky.

text:
Which adaptation might this object feature for convenient placement of large and awkward loads?
A. An extended arm lever
B. A floating platform
C. An adjustable foot pad
D. A flexible beam
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: For greater convenience in placing large and awkward loads, a platform can be 'floated' on a cantilever beam system.

text:
What term is used to describe a group of this object?
A. Troop
B. Pack
C. Mob
D. Cluster
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A group of meerkats is called a "mob", "gang" or "clan".

text:
Which genetic study result was confirmed regarding this object's ancestry in 2019?
A. Partly descended from cattle dogs
B. Descended from wolves
C. Partly descended from foxes
D. No dingo ancestry
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In 2019, a genomic study indicated that the kelpie had no dingo ancestry.

text:
What unique feature is present in juvenile forms of this object?
A. An extra set of gills
B. A tentacle above their eye sockets
C. Bioluminescent spots
D. A distinct tail fin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Juvenile lionfish have a unique tentacle located above their eye sockets

text:
Which type of this object’s construction feature allows it to be rolled with minimal friction?
A. Conical shape
B. Cylindrical symmetry
C. Bulging center
D. Rectangular base
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Barrels have a convex shape and bulge at their center, called bilge.

text:
Which of the following is a distinct characteristic of the horns this object's males feature?
A. Lyre-shaped and slender
B. Short and heavily ridged
C. Spiral-shaped and heavy
D. Straight and pointed
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The male's slender, lyre-shaped horns are long.

text:
What is the distinctive feature of this object compared to most common necktie knots?
A. It features a unique single loop.
B. It is thicker and requires a special type of tie.
C. It is narrower and more asymmetric.
D. It is wider and more balanced.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Windsor is a wider knot than most common knots, and while not truly symmetric is more balanced than the common four-in-hand knot.

text:
What is the reproductive feature of the eggs of this object?
A. Eggs are viviparous and hatch inside the body
B. Eggs have a toxic, adhesive coating
C. Eggs are attached to vegetation with sticky tendrils
D. Eggs have a hard, calcified outer shell
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Eggs have a toxic, adhesive coating to help them stick to substrates.

text:
What is the typical maximum size most individuals of this object reach?
A. Most do not exceed 1 meter
B. Up to 1.5 meters
C. Most do not exceed 1.2 meters
D. Over 2 meters
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: This fish can reach a length of SL though most do not exceed SL.

text:
This object is generally shorter than which other type of swimwear?
A. Surf shorts
B. Wetsuits
C. Board shorts
D. Dive skins
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: are normally shorter than board shorts, which extend to the knees.

text:
What is the correct collective noun for a group of this object?
A. Cluster
B. Covey
C. Herd
D. Pack
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The collective noun for a group of quail is a flock, covey, or bevy.

text:
What is the specific style of slicing this object found particularly in St. Louis?
A. Sliced vertically multiple times
B. Not sliced at all, sold whole
C. Diced into small cubes
D. Sliced horizontally
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The St. Louis style bagel...The St. Louis style bagels are sliced vertically multiple times, instead of the traditional single horizontal slice.

text:
In what context can this object commonly represent the monarchy or Crown itself, as a form of metonymy?
A. In state ceremonies
B. In architectural designs
C. In judicial systems
D. In authoritative speeches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: "Throne" in an abstract sense can also refer to the monarchy or the Crown itself, an instance of metonymy, and is also used in many expressions such as "the power behind the throne".

text:
Which color is NOT a recognized color for the coat of this object?
A. Red
B. Blue
C. Grey
D. Black
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The Briard can be tawny, black, grey, or blue, but variations in each color can occur.

text:
What unique visual characteristic do pearls from this object typically possess?
A. Blue luminescence
B. Pink color
C. Square shape
D. Black color
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Conch pearls occur in a range of hues, including white, brown, and orange, with many intermediate shades, but pink is the colour most associated with the conch pearl.

text:
What unique physical trait does this object have compared to its close relative?
A. Longer ears
B. Long tail
C. Shorter tail
D. No tail
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Cardigan's tail is long (unlike the Pembroke Welsh Corgi, whose tail may be long, naturally bobbed or docked).

text:
What type of metamorphosis does this object undergo?
A. Complete metamorphosis
B. Incomplete metamorphosis
C. No metamorphosis
D. Reverse metamorphosis
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Like other Exopterygota, the leafhoppers undergo direct development from nymph to adult without a pupal stage.

text:
What was the original purpose of this object in early modern Europe?
A. As a fashion statement
B. To store food items
C. To carry books
D. To hold coins
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Early modern Europeans wore purses for one sole purpose: to carry coins.

text:
This object is closely related to which of the following geographical features?
A. Rivers and lakes
B. Plateaus and plains
C. Headlands and bays
D. Mountains and valleys
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: See also: Headlands and bays

text:
What does the word used to describe this object originally mean in Persian or Arabic?
A. Eagle
B. Falcon
C. Nightingale
D. Sparrow
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The word "bulbul" derives from Persian or Arabic (بلبل), meaning nightingale.

text:
Which historical factor significantly influenced the variety and proliferation of products offered in this object during the Middle Ages in Europe?
A. The introduction of corn
B. The rise of wheat cultivation
C. The discovery of sugar cane from the Indian subcontinent
D. The use of salt as a preservative
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Between the 6th and 4th centuries BC, the Persians, followed by the Greeks, adopted and then spread sugar and sugarcane agriculture.

text:
How many pairs of ribs does this object typically have?
A. 23 pairs
B. 17 pairs
C. 21 pairs
D. 19 pairs
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Indian elephants... have 19 pairs of ribs.

text:
How is this object secured when worn?
A. Clips attached to the hair
B. A single button at the neck
C. Ribbons tied under the chin
D. An elastic band around the head
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Typically, the bonnet would be secured by ribbons tied under the chin, which might also wrap around the bottom of the bonnet's crown, similar to a hatband.

text:
What is the primary method this object uses to detect prey?
A. Uses tactile sensors in the feet
B. Relies mainly on its acute sense of smell
C. Predominantly uses vision to identify prey
D. Emits sounds that echo back from prey
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The robin uses auditory, visual, olfactory and possibly vibrotactile cues to find prey, but vision is the predominant mode of prey detection.

text:
In North America, what is a common characteristic of this object?
A. Typically includes a secret compartment
B. Predominantly made of plastic
C. Usually has wheels for easy movement
D. Often features a mirror on top
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In North America, a chiffonier is quite different. There it refers to a tall, narrow and elegant chest of drawers, frequently with a mirror attached on top.

text:
What significant change began to appear in this object's design during the early Ming Dynasty?
A. Changing from vertical to horizontal use
B. The introduction of 1:5 bead configuration
C. The removal of the bamboo frame
D. The use of metal beads instead of wood
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the early Ming Dynasty, the abacus began to appear in the form of 1:5 abacus.

text:
What feature is distinctive about the newborn appearance of this object?
A. They are completely white with a pink face.
B. They are completely black with no additional markings.
C. They are born without fur.
D. They have striped patterns on their bodies.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Newborn colobi are completely white with a pink face.

text:
What type of life cycle does this object exhibit?
A. Holometabolous
B. Hemimetabolous
C. Metamorphosis
D. Ametabolous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: They have a hemimetabolous life cycle with three stages: egg, nymph and adult.

text:
When did the transition from the term 'brassiere' to this object's modern name occur?
A. Early 1900s
B. 1930s
C. Late 1800s
D. 1950s
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the 1930s "brassiere" was gradually shortened to "bra".

text:
In addition to its primary function, this object may sometimes double as which of the following?
A. A mobile phone case
B. A wallet
C. A sewing kit
D. A makeup bag
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Some pencil cases double as make up bags.

text:
Which of the following coat types is NOT found in the standard breed of this object?
A. Silky low-shedding
B. Feathered
C. Curly
D. Smooth with light fluffing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Two coat types – smooth and 'feathered' – are evident in the breed's gene pool.

text:
Regarding the breeding habits of this object, what is true?
A. They are monogamous but only for one season
B. They do not have a fixed mating pattern
C. They are monogamous for life
D. They are polygamous
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Spoonbills are monogamous, but, so far as is known, only for one season at a time.

text:
Which of the following subspecies of this object is recognized as endangered by the United States government?
A. Mexican
B. Nelson's
C. Sierra Nevada
D. Rocky Mountain
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Two populations are currently considered endangered by the United States government: Sierra Nevada bighorn sheep ('O. c. sierrae'), Peninsular bighorn sheep, a distinct population segment of desert bighorn sheep ('O. c. nelsoni')

text:
What specifications does the 3x3 version of this object combine?
A. Same weight and circumference as a size 7 ball
B. Circumference of a size 7 ball, weight of a size 6 ball
C. Weight of a size 7 ball, circumference of a size 6 ball
D. Same weight and circumference as a size 5 ball
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Note that the ball used for all competitions (men's, women's, and mixed) in the formalized halfcourt game of 3x3 combines characteristics of the size 6 and size 7 balls. Its circumference is that of a size 6 ball, but its weight is that of a size 7.

text:
What object serves as the device where this object is mounted?
A. Hoist
B. Truck
C. Halyard
D. Finial
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The pole is usually topped by a flat plate or ball called a 'truck' (originally meant to keep a wooden pole from splitting).

text:
What material is this object typically made from?
A. Cotton
B. Silk
C. Plastic
D. Paper
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Traditional envelopes are made from sheets of paper cut to one of three shapes: a rhombus, a short-arm cross or a kite.

text:
What significant development in this object's use occurred during the year 1878-79?
A. It was used for the first time in Olympic sports
B. It was first utilized in theatrical sound effects
C. It became a standard tool in automated manufacturing processes
D. It replaced handkerchiefs for signaling in football matches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: This became the first referee object used at association football matches during the 1878-79 Football Association Cup match.

text:
What characteristic dental feature is most prominent in this object for processing its typical diet?
A. Underdeveloped molars
B. Powerful carnassials
C. Multiple sets of teeth
D. Long, sharp incisors
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The carnassials, especially the upper, are very powerful and are shifted far back to the point of exertion of peak pressure on the jaws.

text:
Which aspect of this object makes it unique among extant reptiles?
A. Its skin is devoid of scales
B. Possesses the ability to breathe underwater
C. Its ability to regulate body temperature through endothermy
D. It has a shell composed entirely of keratin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Leatherbacks have been viewed as unique among extant reptiles for their ability to maintain high body temperatures using metabolically generated heat, or endothermy.

text:
During what months does this object typically breed in the Northern Hemisphere?
A. December to February
B. April to May
C. September to November
D. June to August
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The black stork breeds between April and May in the Northern Hemisphere.

text:
From where is this object originally believed to have been brought?
A. Japan
B. India
C. Thailand
D. Egypt
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Derived from the Wichianmat landrace, one of several varieties of cat native to China and brought to Thailand (formerly known as Siam).

text:
Which of the following materials has NOT been traditionally used in the construction of this object?
A. Rubber
B. Glass
C. Plastic
D. Metal
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Domes have been constructed from mud, snow, stone, wood, brick, concrete, metal, glass, and plastic over the centuries.

text:
On which holiday is the consumption of this object particularly noted to increase in the U.S.?
A. Easter
B. Christmas
C. Super Bowl Sunday
D. Thanksgiving
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Guacamole has increased avocado sales in the U.S., especially on Super Bowl Sunday and Cinco de Mayo.

text:
This object often contains which of the following materials to absorb impact?
A. Metal shavings
B. Grains, sand, rags
C. Liquid gel
D. Air only
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Punching bags are often filled with grains, sand, rags, or other material...

text:
Which region is this object notably absent from?
A. Tropical seas
B. Antarctic regions
C. Baltic and Black seas
D. Arctic Ocean
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A cosmopolitan species, they can be found in each of the world's oceans in a variety of marine environments, from Arctic and Antarctic regions to tropical seas, absent only from the Baltic and Black seas, and some areas of the Arctic Ocean.

text:
Which state in the U.S. officially recognizes this object as the state spider?
A. Virginia
B. South Carolina
C. Georgia
D. North Carolina
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Carolina wolf spider ('H. carolinensis') is the official state spider of South Carolina, designated as such in 2000.

text:
What is the typical size range for most species of this object?
A. Size of a rice grain
B. Size of a small bird
C. About the size of a thumbnail
D. Size of a human hand
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Most species of cockroach are about the size of a thumbnail...

text:
What is essential for the upkeep of this object's mental and physical health?
A. Consistent cooling periods to manage fur heat
B. Regular exercise and extensive training
C. Minimal exercise and frequent grooming
D. Frequent social outings
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Groenendael needs a large amount of exercise as a rule. It should include not only a walk but also a training session to keep the dog mentally stimulated.

text:
Which family does this object belong to?
A. Cardinalidae
B. Passeridae
C. Fringillidae
D. Corvidae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family (family Brassicaceae, genus 'Brassica')

text:
How does this object primarily capture its prey?
A. By producing a sticky substance
B. Luring them with mimicry
C. Snatching them opportunistically by sight
D. Ambushing prey from underground burrows
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: This object is mainly insectivorous, hunting prey by sight and snatching it opportunistically.

text:
What adaptation do spiders have to avoid getting stuck in their own this object?
A. Non-stick coated bodies
B. Special enzymes on their feet
C. They only walk on non-sticky parts
D. Careful movements and foot structures
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: They do this without sticking by using careful movements, dense hairs and nonstick coatings on their feet to prevent adhesion.

text:
How is this object typically held and operated?
A. Pulled toward the body, like in Japanese planes
B. Kept stationary as wood passes through it
C. Used in a circular motion
D. Pushed away from the body
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Though most planes are pushed across a piece of wood, holding it with one or both hands, Japanese planes are pulled toward the body, not pushed away.

text:
Which related family is closest to the family of this object, according to molecular studies?
A. Turdidae
B. Fringillidae
C. Corvidae
D. Ardeidae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The study also showed that the dipper family, Cinclidae, is most closely related to the thrush family, Turdidae.

text:
Which vitamin does this object provide in high amounts relative to the Daily Value?
A. Vitamin A
B. Vitamin D
C. Vitamin C
D. Vitamin E
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Raw cauliflower provides 25 calories, and has a high content (20% or more of the Daily Value, DV) of vitamin C.

text:
Which of the following materials is commonly cut green and made into this object?
A. Oat
B. Soybean
C. Sunflower
D. Corn
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Oat, barley, and wheat plant materials are occasionally cut green and made into hay for animal fodder.

text:
In the historical development of 'this object', which material was NOT typically used in its construction?
A. Hessian
B. Wooden stave
C. Sulfur
D. Silk
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Torches were usually constructed of a wooden stave with one end wrapped in a material which was soaked in a flammable substance. In ancient Rome some torches were made of sulfur mixed with lime.

text:
Which of the following terms has become almost obsolete in usage for referring to this object as a one-piece swimsuit?
A. Pretzel maillot
B. Maillot
C. Swimsuit
D. One-piece
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In the present day, the phrase one-piece swimsuit has almost completely replaced the term maillot in colloquial language.

text:
What is the primary reproductive mode utilized by this object's genus?
A. Obligate parthenogenesis
B. Sexual reproduction with both male and female
C. Budding
D. Spore formation
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: These all-female species reproduce by obligate parthenogenesis.

text:
Which of the following is a common method used for the commercial cultivation of this object?
A. Hydroponics
B. Aeroponics
C. Terracing
D. Plasticulture
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The bulk of modern commercial production uses the plasticulture system.

text:
What happens to this object in dry weather?
A. The petals dry and curl up around the spore sac
B. The object splits into multiple smaller parts
C. Melanin production in the spore sac increases
D. The spore sac shrinks significantly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In dry weather the 'petals' will dry and curl up around the soft spore sac.

text:
What historical purpose did this object primarily serve in police duties?
A. Transport of heavy equipment
B. Surveillance and intelligence gathering
C. Transportation and detainment of prisoners
D. Patrol and traffic control
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Police vans are usually employed for the transport of prisoners inside a specially adapted cell in the vehicle.

text:
Which of the following is a common method used for the commercial cultivation of this object?
A. Hydroponics
B. Aeroponics
C. Terracing
D. Plasticulture
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The bulk of modern commercial production uses the plasticulture system.

text:
Which of the following best describes the habitat preference of this object?
A. High altitude mountains
B. Dense forests and deep caves
C. Urban areas and man-made structures
D. Sandy surfaces like sea and lake shores, and woodland paths
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: They live along sea and lake shores, on sand dunes, around playa lakebeds and on clay banks or woodland paths, being particularly fond of sandy surfaces.

text:
How does this object primarily attract a mate during the breeding season?
A. Through elaborate dance routines
B. By building intricate nests
C. By displaying brightly colored plumage
D. By vocalizing loudly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The male displays brightly colored plumage during the breeding season to attract a mate.

text:
What is the reproductive feature of the eggs of this object?
A. Eggs are viviparous and hatch inside the body
B. Eggs have a toxic, adhesive coating
C. Eggs are attached to vegetation with sticky tendrils
D. Eggs have a hard, calcified outer shell
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Eggs have a toxic, adhesive coating to help them stick to substrates.

text:
What secondary function does this object often have, apart from cutting?
A. Hammering
B. Sawing
C. Bending metal
D. Measuring
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A hatchet ... has a sharp blade on one side used to cut and split wood, and a hammer head on the other side.

text:
Which ancient civilization is credited with the development of this object?
A. Egyptian
B. Etruscan
C. Greek
D. Roman
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Triumphal arches are one of the most influential and distinctive types of architecture associated with ancient Rome.

text:
What mathematical concept does this object exemplify through its shape?
A. Least surface area for a given volume
B. Constant volume displacement
C. Optimal gas exchange ratio
D. Maximum volume enclosure
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: will assume the shape of least surface area possible containing a given volume.

text:
Which statement best describes the social organization of this object?
A. This object is solitary and avoids interaction with others of its species.
B. This object lives in large groups that are highly dependent on conspecifics.
C. This object forms large, stable packs similar to wolves.
D. This object typically lives in family units or loosely knit packs of unrelated individuals.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: It is highly flexible in social organization, living either in a family unit or in loosely knit packs of unrelated individuals.

text:
Which genus does this object belong to?
A. Gekkonidae
B. Phelsuma
C. Hemidactylus
D. Coleonyx
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Coleonyx is a genus of terrestrial geckos commonly referred to as banded geckos.

text:
What genetic condition is known to affect some of these objects, as noted within the related research?
A. Canine cyclic neutropenia or Grey Collie Syndrome
B. Hip dysplasia commonly found in large breeds
C. Progressive retinal atrophy, leading to blindness
D. High prevalence of congenital heart defects
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Collies may have a genetic disease, na canine cyclic neutropenia, or Grey Collie Syndrome.

text:
Where is this object's natural habitat?
A. Deserts
B. Tropical rainforests
C. Temperate forests of the Himalayas
D. Savannah grasslands
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The red panda lives between altitude, inhabiting areas of moderate temperature between with little annual change. It prefers mountainous mixed deciduous and conifer forests, especially with old trees and dense understories of bamboo.

text:
In the context of hybrid power sources, how does this object manage steep slopes within its route?
A. Using diesel engines automatically
B. Regenerative braking systems
C. Cable assistance for slopes
D. Electrical traction alone
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Trieste–Opicina tramway in Trieste operates a hybrid funicular tramway system. Conventional electric trams are operated in street running and on reserved track for most of their route. However, on one steep segment of track, they are assisted by cable tractors.

text:
In the last two decades, how has this object's track typically been constructed?
A. Metal segments
B. Wood and leather
C. Kevlar composite
D. Rubber only
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Modern snowmobiles' tracks are usually made of a Kevlar composite.

text:
Which area is this object native to?
A. The Sahara Desert
B. The Siberian Taiga
C. The Arctic coastal tundra of northern Alaska
D. The Amazon Rainforest
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: This subspecies only inhabits the tundra regions along the Arctic coast of northern Alaska.

text:
What type of breathing apparatus does this object use to allow the diver to breathe while diving?
A. Closed-circuit rebreather
B. Open-circuit scuba
C. Semi-closed rebreather
D. All of the above
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Most recreational scuba diving is done using a half mask which covers the diver's eyes and nose, and a mouthpiece to supply the breathing gas from the demand valve or rebreather.

text:
What is the primary mode of predation used by this object?
A. Ambush
B. Constriction
C. Venom injection
D. Pursuit
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Kingsnakes use constriction to kill their prey and tend to be opportunistic in their diet; they eat other snakes (ophiophagy), including venomous snakes.

text:
How are most of these objects typically formed?
A. By volcanic activity
B. By artificial land reclamation
C. By the accumulation of coral and marine life
D. By resistance of a rock ridge to erosive forces
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Most promontories either are formed from a hard ridge of rock that has resisted the erosive forces that have removed the softer rock to the sides of it.

text:
What characteristic dental feature is most prominent in this object for processing its typical diet?
A. Underdeveloped molars
B. Powerful carnassials
C. Multiple sets of teeth
D. Long, sharp incisors
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The carnassials, especially the upper, are very powerful and are shifted far back to the point of exertion of peak pressure on the jaws.

text:
What is a traditional material used to manufacture this object?
A. Plastic
B. Wood
C. Ceramic
D. Steel
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Historically, wood has been the most popular material used for picket fences.

text:
In what year was this object reintroduced with the name we know today after Rival Company's acquisition and rebranding?
A. 1965
B. 1974
C. 1971
D. 1980
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The cooker was then reintroduced under the name 'Crock-Pot' in 1971.

text:
This object's lifespan is typically how many years?
A. 1 to 2 years
B. 10 to 12 years
C. 5 to 7 years
D. 2 to 4 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The normal lifespan of a pillow is two to four years.

text:
In terms of behavior and social structure, how does this object typically live?
A. Nomadic in small packs
B. In large groups
C. In nuclear families
D. Solitary
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: They live in groups, but in different group forms.

text:
In what year was the first practical moving coil version of this object built?
A. 1916
B. 1886
C. 1923
D. 1963
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In 1923, the first practical moving coil microphone was built.

text:
What historical variety of this object was typically sweetened, flavored with fruits, and served as a dessert?
A. Consommé Madrilène
B. Sweetened consommé with tendons and cartilage
C. Double strength consommé
D. Jellied consommé
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A special type of consommé that was boiled solely with tendons and cartilage without the addition of salt was sweetened, flavoured with fruits and served as dessert.

text:
In which year was this object first recognized by the American Kennel Club?
A. 1885
B. 1920
C. 1901
D. 1893
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In the early part of the twentieth century the breed gained social stature and was accepted by the American Kennel Club in 1936 and should not be confused with the Staffordshire Bull Terrier of the United Kingdom.

text:
What distinguishes this object from scooters in terms of physical and regulatory characteristics?
A. This object does not require any form of licensing or regulation.
B. This object tends to be less powerful and has pedals for propulsion.
C. This object tends to have a larger engine and no pedals.
D. This object is usually electric powered without any pedals.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Mopeds typically travel only a bit faster than bicycles on public roads, and possess both a motorcycle engine and pedals for propulsion. Mopeds are distinguished from scooters in that the latter tend to be more powerful and subject to more regulation.

text:
What method does this object primarily use for swimming?
A. Generating body waves which travel the length of their bodies
B. Using large, prominent fins
C. Propulsion by jets of water
D. Floating with ocean currents
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Eels swim by generating body waves which travel the length of their bodies.

text:
What secondary function does this object often have, apart from cutting?
A. Hammering
B. Sawing
C. Bending metal
D. Measuring
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A hatchet ... has a sharp blade on one side used to cut and split wood, and a hammer head on the other side.

text:
What feature in this object allows it to display events that briefly occur over time?
A. Probe configuration
B. Storage capability
C. Focus control
D. Horizontal controls
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A storage oscilloscope can capture a single event and display it continuously, so the user can observe events that would otherwise appear too briefly to see directly.

text:
Which region does NOT have native this object species but commonly keeps them as pets?
A. Southeastern North America
B. Western Europe
C. Australia
D. Singapore
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In Singapore, the term 'crayfish' typically refers to 'Thenus orientalis', a seawater crustacean from the slipper lobster family. True crayfish are not native to Singapore, but are commonly found as pets.

text:
What does the word used to describe this object originally mean in Persian or Arabic?
A. Eagle
B. Falcon
C. Nightingale
D. Sparrow
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The word "bulbul" derives from Persian or Arabic (بلبل), meaning nightingale.

text:
What is the typical width of this object used in international gymnastics competitions?
A. 10 inches
B. 4 inches
C. 6 inches
D. 8 inches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Beams are usually covered with leatherlike material, and are only 4 inches wide.

text:
What is the conservation status of this object globally according to the IUCN Red List?
A. Least concern
B. Endangered
C. Data deficient
D. Critically Endangered
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Although the global conservation status of 'Cypripedium calceolus' is least concern according to the IUCN Red List...

text:
Which genetic study result was confirmed regarding this object's ancestry in 2019?
A. Partly descended from cattle dogs
B. Descended from wolves
C. Partly descended from foxes
D. No dingo ancestry
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In 2019, a genomic study indicated that the kelpie had no dingo ancestry.

text:
What is the primary function of this object?
A. To serve as an environmental monitor for solar activity
B. To concentrate and utilize solar power to produce high temperatures for industrial purposes
C. To collect and store solar energy for long-term usage
D. To convert solar energy directly into electrical energy
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A respirator is a device designed to protect the wearer from inhaling hazardous atmospheres, including particulate matter such as dusts and airborne microorganisms, as well as hazardous fumes, vapours and gases.

text:
What is the primary material this object is designed to work with?
A. Metal
B. Stone
C. Wood
D. Plastic
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A hatchet (from the Old French , a diminutive form of "hache", 'axe' of Germanic origin) is a single-handed striking tool with a sharp blade on one side used to cut and split wood...

text:
Which training method is NOT typically used for this object?
A. Body language
B. Verbal commands
C. Goad or whip
D. Electric signals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: These signals are given by verbal command and body language, reinforced by a goad, whip or a long pole.

text:
How does this object primarily defend itself against predators like tigers?
A. By hiding in water bodies
B. By camouflage and hiding
C. By running away swiftly
D. By charging and crying loudly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: When confronted by tigers face to face, sloth bears may charge at them, crying loudly.

text:
What is the native region of this object?
A. Australia
B. Southeast Asia
C. Central America
D. Europe
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The custard apple is native to the New World

text:
What is a common genetic health issue NOT associated with this object?
A. Hip dysplasia
B. Progressive retinal atrophy
C. Von Willebrand's disease
D. Elbow dysplasia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Commonly, Pembrokes can suffer from monorchidism, Von Willebrand's disease, hip dysplasia, degenerative myelopathy (DM), and inherited eye problems such as progressive retinal atrophy.

text:
In which year was the first practical and widely used model of this object invented by Barthélemy Thimonnier?
A. 1851
B. 1790
C. 1832
D. 1829
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The first practical and widely used sewing machine was invented by Barthélemy Thimonnier, a French tailor, in 1829.

text:
Which of the following reproductive characteristics is true for this object?
A. Males and females come together annually to form breeding colonies.
B. They give birth to young every six months.
C. Reproduction occurs once a year with live young being born.
D. They lay eggs in coral reefs.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Reproduction occurs only once a year for hammerhead sharks, and usually occurs with the male shark biting the female shark violently until she agrees to mate with him.

text:
Which venomous action is reported to be similar between this object's venom and that of another genus?
A. Naja
B. Vipera
C. Elapidae
D. Echis
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: "C. cerastes" venom is reported to be similar in action to "Echis" venom.

text:
How far back can the use of this object be traced historically?
A. Middle ages
B. 16th century
C. 8th century A.D.
D. Around 1000 A.D.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The earliest mittens known to archeologists date to around 1000 A.D. in Latvia.

text:
In the context of hybrid power sources, how does this object manage steep slopes within its route?
A. Using diesel engines automatically
B. Regenerative braking systems
C. Cable assistance for slopes
D. Electrical traction alone
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Trieste–Opicina tramway in Trieste operates a hybrid funicular tramway system. Conventional electric trams are operated in street running and on reserved track for most of their route. However, on one steep segment of track, they are assisted by cable tractors.

text:
Which one of these materials is NOT commonly used in the manufacture of this object?
A. Straw
B. Silk
C. Fur-based felt
D. Leather
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Modern cowboy hats are made of fur-based felt, straw or, less often, leather.

text:
Which of the following materials is commonly cut green and made into this object?
A. Oat
B. Soybean
C. Sunflower
D. Corn
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Oat, barley, and wheat plant materials are occasionally cut green and made into hay for animal fodder.

text:
What significant change did this object undergo in Europe around the year 1480?
A. Introduction of wheeled gun carriages
B. Decreased in overall size
C. Reached a classic, consistent form
D. Development of smokeless powder
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: European cannon reached their longer, lighter, more accurate, and more efficient 'classic form' around 1480.

text:
What internal feature does this object have that allows for adjustments?
A. Temperature control lining
B. Moisture-absorbing panels
C. An internal elastic core
D. A valve for air pressure adjustment
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A valve permits the internal air pressure to be adjusted.

text:
Which of these items is similar in function to this object?
A. Elbow pad
B. Sunglasses
C. Baseball cap
D. Wrist watch
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: See also: Elbow pad

text:
What was the primary function of this object during the medieval period besides being a place of worship?
A. Royal residence
B. Marketplace
C. Educational center
D. Community gathering place
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Besides serving as a place of worship, the cathedral or parish church was frequently employed as a general gathering-place by the communities in which they were located, hosting such events as guild meetings, banquets, mystery plays, and fairs.

text:
How does this object predominantly reproduce?
A. Through cuttings
B. Through tubers
C. By wind-pollination
D. By water dispersion
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: It is predominantly a wind-pollinated plant

text:
Which of the following is NOT a trait commonly seen in the coat of this object?
A. Long and silky texture
B. Hard and wiry outer coat
C. Hypoallergenic quality
D. Black and tan coloring
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The coat is hypoallergenic, tending not to generate allergic reactions in people. The outer coat is hard, wiry and stiff, the undercoat softer.

text:
What is the defining characteristic of this object's rig configuration?
A. The foremast being taller than the mainmast
B. The use of only lateen sails
C. The foremast being slightly shorter than the mainmast
D. The use of only square sails
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Typically it has two or more masts, the foremast being slightly shorter than the mainmast.

text:
What method does this object primarily use for swimming?
A. Generating body waves which travel the length of their bodies
B. Using large, prominent fins
C. Propulsion by jets of water
D. Floating with ocean currents
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Eels swim by generating body waves which travel the length of their bodies.

text:
In which country did this object painted red to celebrate Olympic achievements, later face vandalism?
A. United Kingdom
B. Canada
C. United States
D. Australia
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In 2012, to celebrate Olympic gold medals for Team GB, selected boxes were painted gold. One was defaced briefly by a vandal with graffiti.

text:
What is the typical life expectancy of this object?
A. 14-16 years
B. 8-10 years
C. 9-11 years
D. 11-13 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Pembrokes have an average life expectancy of 12–15 years.

text:
What related item might be stored inside this object?
A. Toiletry kit
B. Books
C. Cooking utensils
D. Clothing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Toiletry kit

text:
What is a typical use of this object in American folk music?
A. It is used as a wind instrument producing a trombone-like tone.
B. It is not typically used in music.
C. It is used as a percussion instrument.
D. It is used as a string instrument.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In American folk music, an empty jug is sometimes used as a musical instrument, being played with buzzed lips to produce a trombone-like tone.

text:
Which of the following is a characteristic speed of this object?
A. 30 km/h
B. 40 km/h
C. 65 km/h
D. 55 km/h
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Reaching speeds of 55 km/h, it is the fastest runner among the primates.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object?
A. It primarily feeds on ungulates, especially deer.
B. It primarily feeds on insects and small mammals.
C. It generally consumes a variety of plants and fruits.
D. It is an omnivore that eats equal parts meat and vegetation.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Mantises are generalist predators of arthropods. Larger mantises sometimes eat smaller individuals of their own species, as well as small vertebrates such as lizards, frogs, small birds and fishes.

text:
What was a significant advancement in the 1980s that improved the functionality of this object?
A. Incorporation of microcontrollers for managing data streams
B. Implementation of echo cancellation techniques
C. Development of acoustic coupler technology
D. Introduction of automatic error-correction protocols
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Echo cancellation was the next major advance in modem design.

text:
How does this object primarily attract a mate during the breeding season?
A. Through elaborate dance routines
B. By building intricate nests
C. By displaying brightly colored plumage
D. By vocalizing loudly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The male displays brightly colored plumage during the breeding season to attract a mate.

text:
What is the typical maximum size most individuals of this object reach?
A. Most do not exceed 1 meter
B. Up to 1.5 meters
C. Most do not exceed 1.2 meters
D. Over 2 meters
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: This fish can reach a length of SL though most do not exceed SL.

text:
What related item might be stored inside this object?
A. Toiletry kit
B. Books
C. Cooking utensils
D. Clothing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Toiletry kit

text:
What is the name of the specialized structure resembling sepals that protects this object's flowers before they open?
A. Sepaloids
B. Phyllaries
C. Calyptra
D. Bracts
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: At the base of the head, and surrounding the flowers before opening, is a bundle of sepal-like bracts or scales called phyllaries, which together form the 'involucre' that protects the individual flowers in the head before opening.

text:
What is the primary historical use of this object?
A. Herding livestock
B. Guarding estates
C. Fetching small game
D. Hunting red deer by coursing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mention of the breed can be found in old Hungarian texts. They have historically been royal guard dogs, or guarded livestock, but have been increasingly found in homes as pets over the last seventy years.

text:
In which decade did this object first make its presence known in video gaming?
A. 1960s
B. 1970s
C. 1980s
D. 1990s
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Ralph H. Baer, inventor of the Magnavox Odyssey console, released in 1972, created the first video game joysticks in 1967.

text:
What is NOT a characteristic commonly seen in this object?
A. Blue eyes
B. Thick double coat
C. High energy levels
D. Large flopped ears
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Huskies are energetic and athletic. They usually have a thick double coat... Their eyes are typically pale blue...

text:
Which genetic study result was confirmed regarding this object's ancestry in 2019?
A. Partly descended from cattle dogs
B. Descended from wolves
C. Partly descended from foxes
D. No dingo ancestry
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In 2019, a genomic study indicated that the kelpie had no dingo ancestry.

text:
What is a common cultural interpretation of this object's actions according to Native American beliefs?
A. A sign of a speedy death when crossed
B. A trigger for seasonal changes
C. A symbol of peace and harmony
D. An omen of impending success
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In North America, Native Americans (in the region of Chatham County, North Carolina) deemed the weasel to be a bad sign; crossing its path meant a "speedy death".

text:
How does this object typically interact with its environment to feed?
A. Filtering food particles from water
B. Using teeth to chew food
C. Absorbing nutrients from the water
D. Capturing prey with tentacles
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Some sea cucumbers position themselves in currents and catch food that flows by with their open tentacles.

text:
What peaked the popularity of this object in southern Europe during the 1620s?
A. Their low maintenance costs
B. Their ability to live in very cold water
C. Their ability to perform tricks
D. Their metallic scales
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: During the 1620s, this object was highly regarded in southern Europe because of their metallic scales.

text:
Which disease is this object highly prone to?
A. Citrus greening
B. Powdery mildew
C. Corn smut
D. Tomato spotted wilt virus
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: It is moderately susceptible to fire blight and is highly prone to scab, powdery mildew, and cedar apple rust.

text:
What is a unique feature of vertical versions of this object compared to horizontal types?
A. Collect more dust
B. Easier to operate
C. More light control
D. Better for small windows
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Unlike horizontal blinds, vertical blinds are less likely to collect dust because they stand vertically. Since they draw to the side rather than lifting and lowering, they are easier and faster to operate.

text:
This object's modern form includes a triangular frame primarily supported by which structural element?
A. Column or Pillar
B. Pedal box
C. Tuning Pegs
D. Soundbox
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The longest side of the harp is called the column or pillar, though some earlier harps, such as a 'bow harp', lack a pillar.

text:
Which habitat does this object prefer in India and Southeast Asia?
A. Desert regions and open plains
B. Forested areas in alpine zones
C. Coastlines and mangrove swamps
D. Primarily urban areas
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In India, Myanmar, Indochina, Indonesia and China, they prefer forested areas in alpine zones and occasionally also in plains regions.

text:
Which type of this object is primarily used by individuals with long-term disabilities outside of Europe?
A. Underarm or axilla
B. Leg support
C. Platform
D. Forearm
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Outside of Europe forearm crutches are more likely to be used by users with long term disabilities, with axillary crutches more common for short term use.

text:
This object's diet predominantly consists of what type of food?
A. Freshwater algae
B. Grass and weeds
C. Tree and shrub leaves
D. Other insects
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Phasmids are herbivorous, feeding mostly on the leaves of trees and shrubs.

text:
Which of the following activities is this object known to excel in?
A. Sled pulling
B. Dock diving
C. Sheep herding
D. Desert racing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The breed is increasingly popular in dog agility competitions, obedience training, rally obedience, tracking, dock diving, flyball, weight-pulling, barn hunting and lure coursing.

text:
What are the particular spots on the back of this object's ears thought to play a role in?
A. Camouflage
B. Communication
C. Hunting
D. Attracting mates
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The whitish spots on the back of its ears are thought to play a role in communication.

text:
In what type of habitats are the larval and adult stages of this object found primarily?
A. Forests and wooded areas
B. Deserts and dry areas
C. Mountains and rocky regions
D. Fresh water ecosystems
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Several years of their lives are spent as nymphs living in fresh water; the adults may be on the wing for just a few days or weeks...often live near water.

text:
What style of this object became popular again during the Edwardian era?
A. Choker
B. Dog-collar style
C. Lariat necklace
D. Opera necklace
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Edwardian era saw a resurgence of pearl necklaces, in addition to a dog-collar style of necklace made of gold or platinum with inset diamonds, emeralds, or rubies.

text:
What unique genetic feature is found in the white color morph of this object?
A. A mutation in the MC1R gene
B. A mutation in the SLC45A2 gene
C. A recessive gene on the Y chromosome
D. An autosomal dominant trait
Choose A, B, C, or D.
