Which factor contributes to variations in the size of this object between different geographic locations?
A. Variations in genetic makeup
B. Availability and type of food resources
C. Predation pressure from other animals
D. Climate and temperature variations
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: American black bears on the East Coast tend to be heavier on average than those on the West Coast, although American black bears follow Bergmann's rule and bears from the Northwest are often slightly heavier than the bears from the Southeast.

text:
What does the term 'mandarins' refer to concerning this object?
A. The characteristic gait of the run
B. The facial hair resembling a Fu Manchu mustache
C. A special diet followed
D. A unique training method developed
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A specimen may have facial hair that looks like a Fu Manchu mustache. The mustache is called mandarins.

text:
What is a distinctive feature of this object's trunk?
A. Three finger-like processes at the tip
B. Two finger-like processes at the tip
C. No finger-like processes at the tip
D. One finger-like process at the tip
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The tip of their trunk has one finger-like process.

text:
What kind of fur does this object typically have?
A. Thick and curly
B. Long and silky
C. Wiry and coarse
D. Short and smooth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The traditional long silky coat, which tends to reach the floor, requires daily brushing to avoid tangles.

text:
Which adaptation might this object feature for convenient placement of large and awkward loads?
A. An extended arm lever
B. A floating platform
C. An adjustable foot pad
D. A flexible beam
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: For greater convenience in placing large and awkward loads, a platform can be 'floated' on a cantilever beam system.

text:
What is the typical flavor description of this object?
A. Sweet and spicy
B. Salty and umami
C. Bitter and sour
D. Sweet and pleasant
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The flavor is sweet and pleasant, akin to the taste of 'traditional' custard.

text:
What unusual method does this object use to drink water?
A. Sucking water into its mouth via buccal pumping
B. Using its long tongue to lap up water
C. Collecting dew with its scales
D. Sponging water with its skin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The Komodo dragon drinks by sucking water into its mouth via buccal pumping (a process also used for respiration), lifting its head, and letting the water run down its throat.

text:
What internal feature does this object have that allows for adjustments?
A. Temperature control lining
B. Moisture-absorbing panels
C. An internal elastic core
D. A valve for air pressure adjustment
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A valve permits the internal air pressure to be adjusted.

text:
What distinguishes this object from scooters in terms of physical and regulatory characteristics?
A. This object does not require any form of licensing or regulation.
B. This object tends to be less powerful and has pedals for propulsion.
C. This object tends to have a larger engine and no pedals.
D. This object is usually electric powered without any pedals.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Mopeds typically travel only a bit faster than bicycles on public roads, and possess both a motorcycle engine and pedals for propulsion. Mopeds are distinguished from scooters in that the latter tend to be more powerful and subject to more regulation.

text:
Apart from storage, what else might this object include?
A. Educational classrooms
B. Manufacturing equipment
C. Restaurant and other leisure facilities
D. Solar panels and wind turbines
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: It may also include a restaurant, bar, and other leisure facilities, perhaps for members of an associated club.

text:
In which region is this object historically used as a symbol for bakers and their guilds?
A. Eastern France
B. Northern Germany
C. Western Austria
D. Southern German areas
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The pretzel has been in use as an emblem of bakers and formerly their guilds in southern German areas since at least the 12th century.

text:
What feature is distinctive about the newborn appearance of this object?
A. They are completely white with a pink face.
B. They are completely black with no additional markings.
C. They are born without fur.
D. They have striped patterns on their bodies.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Newborn colobi are completely white with a pink face.

text:
This object has been a favorite of various historical figures. Which of the following is NOT listed as an enthusiast of the breed?
A. Catherine the Great
B. King Louis XIV
C. Frederick the Great
D. Queen Victoria
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The breed has been popular with royalty. Among the royal aficionados are Queen Anne, Queen Victoria, Catherine the Great, Frederick the Great.

text:
Which of the following is not a primary food source for this object in Ohio?
A. Maple seeds
B. Black walnuts
C. Hickory nuts
D. Acorns from bluejack oak
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Fox squirrels in Ohio prefer hickory nuts, acorns, corn, and black walnuts. The squirrels are absent where two or more of these mast trees are missing.

text:
Which is NOT a name used to describe a group of these objects?
A. Pack
B. Mob
C. Wisdom
D. Colony
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A group of wombats is known as a wisdom, a mob, or a colony.

text:
What significant advancement in the manufacturing of this object occurred during the 18th century?
A. Machine punching for dimples
B. Use of semi-precious stones
C. Creation of rubber versions
D. Introduction of glass materials
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Before the 18th century the small dimples on the outside of a this object were made by hand punching, but in the middle of that century, a machine was invented to do the job.

text:
Which of the following coat types is associated with this object?
A. Thick and double-coated
B. Long and wiry
C. Short, smooth and close
D. Heavy and water-resistant
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The coat is short, smooth and close.

text:
Which statement about the genetics and taxonomy of this object is correct?
A. It was once classified with some Asian species in the same genus.
B. It belongs to the family Cheloniidae.
C. There are currently two species recognized in its genus.
D. All subspecies are primarily found in South America.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Also several Asian box turtles have been formerly classified within the genus "Terrapene": e.g. "Terrapene bicolor" (now "Cuora amboinensis couro") and "Terrapene culturalia" (now "Cuora flavomarginata").

text:
What kind of social structure does this object exhibit?
A. Solitary
B. Matriarchal groups centered around dominant females
C. Pairs only
D. Large patriarchal societies
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: All macaque social groups are matriarchal, arranged around dominant females.

text:
What type of coat is considered typical for this object?
A. Short and smooth
B. Fine, straight, and silky
C. Curly and coarse
D. Wiry and rough
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: For adult Yorkshire Terriers, importance is placed on coat colour, quality, and texture. The hair must be glossy, fine, straight, and silky.

text:
Which of these is not a correct description of the physical traits of this object?
A. Black faces with distinctive white markings
B. Tails vary in length depending on the species
C. Has long, prominent ears with high mobility
D. Has short, wide bodies and short legs for digging
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Badgers have rather short, wide bodies, with short legs for digging. They have elongated, weasel-like heads with small ears.

text:
Which environmental condition strongly affects the habitat preference of this object due to their inability to navigate it?
A. Open plains
B. Large bodies of water
C. Deep forests
D. Deep snow
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Since bighorn sheep cannot move through deep snow, they prefer drier slopes, where the annual snowfall is less than about 60 cm per year.

text:
What would be the maximum allowable length for this object designed for use by individuals with larger lung capacities according to European standards EN 1972 (2015)?
A. 38 centimeters
B. 48 centimeters
C. 35 centimeters
D. 43 centimeters
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: To comply with the current European standard EN 1972 (2015), a snorkel for users with larger lung capacities should not exceed 38 centimeters in length and 230 cubic centimeters in internal volume.

text:
Which predator is known to prey on the larvae of this object after eggs are laid in flowers?
A. Coccinella septempunctata
B. Polistes carolina
C. Formica rufa
D. Apis mellifera
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Some species of wasps, such as "Polistes carolina", have been known to prey upon Chrysomelidae larvae after the eggs are laid in flowers.

text:
What is the typical diet composition of this object in the Western United States?
A. Primarily insectivorous and herbivorous
B. Primarily small mammals
C. Primarily birds
D. Primarily aquatic animals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In some parts of the Western United States (such as in the Zion National Park in Utah), the gray fox is primarily insectivorous and herbivorous.

text:
What is the primary function of the varied coat colors and patterns in this object?
A. Visual identification and communication
B. Attracting mates
C. Camouflaging in different habitats
D. Regulating body temperature
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Colour variation is extreme, and may serve in visual identification, as African wild dogs can recognise each other at distances of 50–100 m.

text:
What method unique among cats does this object sometimes use to kill its prey?
A. Using venom
B. Starvation
C. Strangulation
D. Piercing the skull through the temporal bones
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: ...it sometimes uses a killing method unique among cats: it pierces directly through the temporal bones of the skull between the ears of prey (especially the capybara) with its canine teeth, piercing the brain.

text:
As of the latest studies, how many species of this object are recognized?
A. Two
B. Four
C. Five
D. Three
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: From 1996, they were divided into two species: the Bornean orangutan ('P. pygmaeus', with three subspecies) and the Sumatran orangutan ('P. abelii'). In November 2017 it was reported that a third species had been identified, the Tapanuli orangutan ('P. tapanuliensis').

text:
In what type of habitats are the larval and adult stages of this object found primarily?
A. Forests and wooded areas
B. Deserts and dry areas
C. Mountains and rocky regions
D. Fresh water ecosystems
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Several years of their lives are spent as nymphs living in fresh water; the adults may be on the wing for just a few days or weeks...often live near water.

text:
What is the primary purpose for which this object was originally bred?
A. Guarding property
B. Herding sheep
C. Hunting hare
D. Companion pet
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Basset is a scent hound that was originally bred for the purpose of hunting hare.

text:
What is the primary function of this object's shell?
A. To serve primarily as a buoyancy control device
B. To enhance the animal's camouflage
C. To aid in the digestion of food
D. To provide a hard protective outer casing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The shell of the chambered nautilus fulfills the function of buoyancy, which allows the nautilus to dive or ascend at will, by controlling the density and volume of the liquid within its shell chambers.

text:
What adaptation does this object exhibit to protect against predators?
A. It plays dead when threatened
B. It emits a toxic substance when threatened
C. It camouflages with the environment
D. At least one individual keeps guard while others feed on the ground
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Species that feed on the ground are very vulnerable to predator attack. The cockatoo has evolved a behavioural adaptation to protect against this: whenever there is a flock on the ground, there is at least one high up in a tree (usually a dead tree), keeping guard.

text:
What is a common size range for this object used in kitchens?
A. 20" to 22" inches square
B. 8" to 10" inches square
C. 15" to 17" inches square
D. 11" to 13" inches square
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Dishcloths are typically made of cotton or other cloth, such as microfiber, and measure 11" to 13" inches square.

text:
When and where was this object invented?
A. 1850, China
B. 1869, Japan
C. 1880, India
D. 1900, United States
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Rickshaws were invented in Japan circa 1869, after the lifting of a ban on wheeled vehicles from the Tokugawa period (1603–1868), and at the beginning of a rapid period of technical advancement in Japan.

text:
When did this object see remarkable decline in sales due to changes in popular hairstyle preferences?
A. In the 1960s
B. In the 1970s
C. In the 1990s
D. In the 1940s
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Sales of hairspray declined in the 1970s as hairstyles became predominately worn straight and loose.

text:
From what types of breeds is this object descended?
A. Terrier and hound breeds
B. Molosser type dogs from the Romans
C. Spitz and primitive types
D. Herding and gun dog breeds
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: These dogs are thought to be descendants of molosser type dogs brought into the Alps by the ancient Romans.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object?
A. Insects and small frogs
B. Small birds and eggs
C. Grasses and small plants
D. Toads and occasionally rodents and insects
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Mantises are generalist predators of arthropods. Larger mantises sometimes eat smaller individuals of their own species, as well as small vertebrates such as lizards, frogs, small birds and fishes.

text:
What was a notable non-culinary use for this object mentioned in its historical context?
A. Building small furnitures
B. Formation of ceramic tiles
C. Manufacturing toys
D. Creating lightweight shoe soles
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Oregon track coach and Nike Co-founder Bill Bowerman used his wife's waffle iron to experiment with the idea of using waffle-ironed rubber to create a new sole for footwear.

text:
What kind of fur does this object typically have?
A. Thick and curly
B. Long and silky
C. Wiry and coarse
D. Short and smooth
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The traditional long silky coat, which tends to reach the floor, requires daily brushing to avoid tangles.

text:
Which of the following is NOT a typical cultivation issue for this object?
A. Early blight
B. Clubroot
C. Black rot
D. Necrotic spot
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Necrotic spot is where there are oval sunken spots...One of the most common bacterial diseases to affect cabbage is black rot...Clubroot, caused by the soilborne slime mold-like organism 'Plasmodiophora brassicae'

text:
What primary function does this object serve in the mining industry?
A. Transporting minerals to the surface
B. Exploring mineral deposits and structural geology
C. Refining extracted materials
D. Operating as a lift system for miners
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Mining drilling rigs are used for two main purposes, exploration drilling which aims to identify the location and quality of a mineral, and production drilling, used in the production-cycle for mining.

text:
Which of the following best describes the primary function of this object?
A. It is used as a loose over-garment that covers most of the body.
B. It is mainly used as a festive decoration.
C. It serves primarily as a raincoat.
D. It is worn for warmth during cold weather.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The abaya 'cloak'...is a simple, loose over-garment, essentially a robe-like dress, worn by some women.

text:
Which of these constructions was the first successful example of a modern this object design?
A. The Head Standard, introduced in 1950, which sandwiched aluminum alloy around a plywood core
B. The VR7, introduced in 1970, using a torsion box design with fibreglass
C. The Bucky Kashiwa’s steel ski design from 1989
D. The Kneissl White Star, a fiberglass design debuted in the 1960s
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The first successful laminate ski, and arguably the first modern ski was the Head Standard, introduced in 1950, which sandwiched aluminum alloy around a plywood core.

text:
What is the primary distinguishing feature of the skull of this object compared to other North American canids?
A. The widely separated temporal ridges forming a U-shape
B. A smaller overall skull size
C. Extra teeth compared to other canids
D. The presence of a pronounced sagittal crest
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The skull can be easily distinguished from all other North American canids by its widely separated temporal ridges that form a U-shape.

text:
In terms of feeding, this object can be classified as:
A. Insectivore
B. Herbivore
C. Carnivore
D. Omnivore
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Elephants are classified as megaherbivores.

text:
Which of the following subspecies of this object is recognized as endangered by the United States government?
A. Mexican
B. Nelson's
C. Sierra Nevada
D. Rocky Mountain
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Two populations are currently considered endangered by the United States government: Sierra Nevada bighorn sheep ('O. c. sierrae'), Peninsular bighorn sheep, a distinct population segment of desert bighorn sheep ('O. c. nelsoni')

text:
What unique characteristic is notable about the tail of this object?
A. Tail is plumed
B. Typically born with naturally short tails
C. Always has a long tail
D. The tail is prehensile
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Most Brittanys are born with naturally short tails, yet others are rarely born with long tails, which are docked to a length of

text:
What is a typical response of this object when encountering a predator such as a tiger?
A. It may mob the predator for lengthy periods
B. It immediately flees into water bodies
C. It stands its ground and fights back
D. It climbs trees to escape
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: When confronted by dholes, tigers will seek refuge in trees or stand with their backs to a tree or bush, where they may be mobbed for lengthy periods before finally attempting escape.

text:
Which area is this object native to?
A. The Sahara Desert
B. The Siberian Taiga
C. The Arctic coastal tundra of northern Alaska
D. The Amazon Rainforest
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: This subspecies only inhabits the tundra regions along the Arctic coast of northern Alaska.

text:
Which feature of this object's sensory capabilities is most developed?
A. Electroreception
B. Auditory perception
C. Vision
D. Olfactory senses
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The platypus's electroreception is the most sensitive of any monotreme.

text:
This object has traditionally served which function in military operations?
A. Weapons storage
B. Provision of shelter
C. Transportation of goods
D. Communication center
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Armies all over the world have long used tents as part of their working life.

text:
Which of the following was NOT a common material used for ribbons in this object?
A. Fabric
B. Wax paper
C. Plastic film
D. Dried ink
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: When a key was struck briskly and firmly, the typebar hit a ribbon (usually made of inked fabric), making a printed mark on the paper wrapped around a cylindrical platen.

text:
What is a unique feature of vertical versions of this object compared to horizontal types?
A. Collect more dust
B. Easier to operate
C. More light control
D. Better for small windows
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Unlike horizontal blinds, vertical blinds are less likely to collect dust because they stand vertically. Since they draw to the side rather than lifting and lowering, they are easier and faster to operate.

text:
Which family does the Diamondback version of this object belong to?
A. Bataguridae
B. Geoemydidae
C. Pelomedusidae
D. Emydidae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Diamondback terrapin or just 'terrapin', 'Malaclemys terrapin', a testudine of the family Emydidae, native to North America and Bermuda.

text:
Which factor contributes to variations in the size of this object between different geographic locations?
A. Variations in genetic makeup
B. Availability and type of food resources
C. Predation pressure from other animals
D. Climate and temperature variations
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: American black bears on the East Coast tend to be heavier on average than those on the West Coast, although American black bears follow Bergmann's rule and bears from the Northwest are often slightly heavier than the bears from the Southeast.

text:
What is a primary source of food for this object?
A. Plants and algae
B. Plankton and other microorganisms
C. Underwater carrion and detritus, as well as living shellfish and crab
D. Small fish and squid
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: As a carnivore, it feeds on both underwater carrion and detritus, as well as living shellfish and crab.

text:
Which of the following diseases is this object particularly at risk of developing due to a genetic predisposition?
A. Pancreatitis
B. Diabetes
C. Transitional cell carcinoma
D. Kidney stones
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Shetland Sheepdogs have four times the risk of other dogs of developing transitional cell carcinoma, a cancer of the bladder.

text:
When did this object begin to be recognized as a portable advertising tool?
A. Late 1940s
B. 1960s
C. 1980s
D. Early 1920s
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The sweatshirt's potential as a portable advertising tool was discovered in the 1960s when U.S. universities began printing their names on the medium.

text:
Where is this object's natural habitat?
A. Deserts
B. Tropical rainforests
C. Temperate forests of the Himalayas
D. Savannah grasslands
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The red panda lives between altitude, inhabiting areas of moderate temperature between with little annual change. It prefers mountainous mixed deciduous and conifer forests, especially with old trees and dense understories of bamboo.

text:
What distinguishes the Cobbler version of this object from others?
A. It doesn't require any separate strainer.
B. It is a single-piece with no removable parts.
C. It includes a cap that can be used as a measure.
D. It is only made from glass.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Cobbler Shaker: A three-piece cocktail shaker that has tapers at the top and ends with a built-in strainer and includes a cap. The cap can often be used as a measure for spirits or other liquids.

text:
What is a common cultural interpretation of this object's actions according to Native American beliefs?
A. A sign of a speedy death when crossed
B. A trigger for seasonal changes
C. A symbol of peace and harmony
D. An omen of impending success
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: In North America, Native Americans (in the region of Chatham County, North Carolina) deemed the weasel to be a bad sign; crossing its path meant a "speedy death".

text:
Which of these genera does not contain any species of this object?
A. Nymphicus
B. Anodorhynchus
C. Cyanopsitta
D. Primolius
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Of the many different Psittacidae (true parrots) genera, six are classified as macaws: 'Ara', 'Anodorhynchus', 'Cyanopsitta', 'Primolius', 'Orthopsittaca', and 'Diopsittaca'.

text:
Which characteristic describes the physical appearance and behavior of this object during the breeding period?
A. Develops a brightly colored coat
B. Develops subcutaneous armor for protection
C. Testicles decrease in size
D. Sheds its mane
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Prior to mating, the males develop their subcutaneous armour in preparation for confronting rivals.

text:
From where is this object originally believed to have been brought?
A. Japan
B. India
C. Thailand
D. Egypt
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Derived from the Wichianmat landrace, one of several varieties of cat native to China and brought to Thailand (formerly known as Siam).

text:
Which of the following was not a key advantage of this object over laptops as of the late 2000s?
A. Battery independence
B. Ease of overclocking
C. Integrated wireless technologies
D. Standardization of components
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Laptop computers, conversely, offer portability that desktop systems can not due to their compact size and clamshell design ... Laptops also commonly integrate wireless technologies like WiFi, Bluetooth and 3G.

text:
Which adaptation might this object feature for convenient placement of large and awkward loads?
A. An extended arm lever
B. A floating platform
C. An adjustable foot pad
D. A flexible beam
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: For greater convenience in placing large and awkward loads, a platform can be 'floated' on a cantilever beam system.

text:
According to cultural references, why is this object unlikely to build its nest in trees?
A. Due to its inability to fly
B. Because it primarily inhabits caves
C. Due to a historical legend involving a fall
D. Due to its preference for wet climates
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: According to Greek legend, the first partridge appeared when Daedalus threw his nephew, Perdix, off the sacred hill of Athena in a fit of jealous rage. Supposedly mindful of his fall, the bird does not build its nest in the trees, nor take lofty flights and avoids high places.

text:
Which of the following tools is NOT typically found on this object?
A. Ground ladders
B. Hydraulic rescue tools
C. Thermal imaging cameras
D. Portable defibrillators
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A typical modern fire engine will carry tools for a wide range of firefighting tasks, with common equipment including a pump, a water tank, hoses, ground ladders, hand tools, self-contained breathing apparatuses and medical supplies.

text:
Which of the following is NOT a typical use for this object in modern times?
A. Rescue operations
B. Detecting explosives
C. Participation in dog shows
D. Herding livestock
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Springer is not limited to detecting explosives. Springers are used for drug detection in the United Kingdom, Sweden, Finland, Isle of Man, Ireland, Canada CBSA and Qatar. The Springer Spaniel is also used as a search and rescue dog by mountain rescue and Lowland Rescue teams.

text:
Which is NOT a name used to describe a group of these objects?
A. Pack
B. Mob
C. Wisdom
D. Colony
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A group of wombats is known as a wisdom, a mob, or a colony.

text:
What is a specialized use of this object in a medical setting?
A. For patient meals
B. For administering medications
C. For carrying surgical instruments
D. For storing medical records
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Surgical trays are used to carry surgical instruments, are rectangular and made of stainless steel to resist the heat of sterilization without corrosion.

text:
What percentage of the global production of this object, combined with cauliflowers, was accounted for by China and India in 2017?
A. 83%
B. 43%
C. 73%
D. 53%
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In 2017, China and India produced 73% of the world's broccoli and cauliflower crops.

text:
How is this object most commonly packaged?
A. In a spray bottle
B. As a compact or loose powder
C. In a roll-on applicator
D. In a tube
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: It comes packaged either as a compact or as loose powder.

text:
This object, due to its original breeding purpose, should be observed cautiously around which type of pets?
A. Cats
B. Fish
C. Birds
D. Rodents
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Norwich are generally good with children, and if introduced to other household pets as a puppy they generally co-habit peacefully, though caution should be observed around rodent pets as they may be mistaken for prey.

text:
What type of time display does this object use?
A. Water flow measurements
B. Sundial markers
C. Numerals or other symbols
D. Rotating hands
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: A digital clock is a type of clock that displays the time digitally (i.e. in numerals or other symbols), as opposed to an analog clock, where the time is indicated by the positions of rotating hands.

text:
What adaptive management strategy has been implemented to safeguard the population of this object from the threat of coyote genes?

B. Targeted removal of coyotes
C. Reintroduction of gray wolves
D. Sterilization of coyotes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Coyote sterilization has been successful, with coyote genes being reduced by 2015 to < 4% of the wild red wolf population.

text:
Which characteristic describes the migration pattern of this object?
A. Night-time using the stars
B. Random, without a fixed pattern
C. Diurnal and uses landmarks
D. Non-migratory
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: It often migrates by night, using the stars to navigate.

text:
Which of the following is not a type of clawfoot this object?
A. Double ended
B. Classic roll rim
C. Single slipper
D. Double slipper
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Clawfoot tubs come in 4 major styles: Classic roll rim tubs, Slipper tubs, Double slipper tubs, Double ended tubs.

text:
Which of the following health issues is this object most likely to face according to studies?
A. Heart Disease
B. Obesity
C. Diabetes
D. Cancer
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: Cancer is the leading cause of death for dogs in general, but Bernese Mountain Dogs have a much higher rate of fatal cancer than other breeds.

text:
What type of coat does this object have?

B. Curly and moisture-resistant
C. Silky and single-layered
D. Long and smooth
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
What notable style of this object became popular in the 1960s?
A. Metallic finish designs
B. Simple, unadorned styles
C. Colourful flower petal designs
D. Graphic prints designs
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: During the 1960s colourful flower petal swim caps became popular.

text:
Which genus does this object belong to?
A. Gekkonidae
B. Phelsuma
C. Hemidactylus
D. Coleonyx
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Coleonyx is a genus of terrestrial geckos commonly referred to as banded geckos.

text:
Which type of this object is commonly found in restaurants and has a metal-mesh conveyor belt?
A. Toaster oven
B. Microwave oven
C. Pop-up this object
D. Conveyor this object
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A third type, most commonly found in restaurants, has a metal-mesh conveyor belt that moves the bread past constantly-powered heat elements.

text:
What is a unique reproductive behavior observed in this object?

B. Males gestate and give birth to young
C. Females lay eggs
D. Copulations last for hours
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. Deep ocean waters
C. Freshwater
D. Desert areas
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C

text:
What unique evolutionary adaptation do the eyes of this object possess?
A. High-density cone cells
B. Nictitating membrane
C. Infrared vision
D. Triple-layered retina
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Sharks do not have moveable upper or lower eyelids, but the tiger shark—among other sharks—has a nictitating membrane, a clear eyelid that can cover the eye.

text:
Which healthcare concern is NOT typically associated with this object?
A. Progressive retinal atrophy
B. Type 3 von Willebrand disease
C. Hip dysplasia
D. Excessive feathering leading to parasitic infestations
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: These include, but are not limited to: - Hip dysplasia - Progressive retinal atrophy - Type 3 von Willebrand disease - Cataract - Regional Alopecia in both sexes

text:
What is the primary material used for this object when designed for swimming?
A. Silk
B. Cotton
C. Nylon
D. Polyester
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: though most are made of nylon with a mesh lining for quick drying.

text:
Which related family is closest to the family of this object, according to molecular studies?
A. Turdidae
B. Fringillidae
C. Corvidae
D. Ardeidae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The study also showed that the dipper family, Cinclidae, is most closely related to the thrush family, Turdidae.

text:
What was a historical development in the evolution of this object?

B. Development of solar-powered versions
C. Use of nuclear power for high-energy pumps
D. Introduction of electric engines in the 20th century
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The first recorded fire-float was built in 1765 for the Sun Fire Insurance Company in London. This was a manual pump in a small boat, rowed by its crew to the scene of the fire.

text:
Unlike many of its relatives in the same family, this object exhibits what kind of reproductive behavior?
A. The female is predominantly responsible for incubation.
B. It is monogamous throughout its life.
C. It displays brood parasitism.
D. The male provides most of the parental care.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Unlike many Old World cuckoos, coucals are not brood parasites, though they do have their own reproductive peculiarity: all members of the genus are (to varying degrees) sex-role reversed, so that the smaller male provides most of the parental care.

text:
What is the native region of this object?
A. Australia
B. Southeast Asia
C. Central America
D. Europe
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The custard apple is native to the New World

text:
What is a distinctive characteristic of the coat color pattern of this object?
A. Large patches of color
B. Stripes and spots
C. Small specks or flecks distributed all over the body
D. Solid colors only
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The various speckled coat colours when occurring in English Setters are referred to as 'belton';... The flecking should not form large patches on the body and the flecks should be distributed all over the body.

text:
Which of these is not a correct description of the physical traits of this object?
A. Black faces with distinctive white markings
B. Tails vary in length depending on the species
C. Has long, prominent ears with high mobility
D. Has short, wide bodies and short legs for digging
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Badgers have rather short, wide bodies, with short legs for digging. They have elongated, weasel-like heads with small ears.

text:
Which of the following regions is NOT a current habitat for this object?
A. North America
B. Scandinavia
C. Hokkaido in Japan
D. Atlas Mountains of Africa
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Brown bears were once native to much of Asia, the Atlas Mountains of Africa, Europe, and North America, but are now extinct in some areas ...

text:
Which of the following was NOT a common material used for ribbons in this object?
A. Fabric
B. Wax paper
C. Plastic film
D. Dried ink
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: When a key was struck briskly and firmly, the typebar hit a ribbon (usually made of inked fabric), making a printed mark on the paper wrapped around a cylindrical platen.

text:
Which vitamin does this object provide in high amounts relative to the Daily Value?
A. Vitamin A
B. Vitamin D
C. Vitamin C
D. Vitamin E
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: Raw cauliflower provides 25 calories, and has a high content (20% or more of the Daily Value, DV) of vitamin C.

text:

A. Small tiger
B. Tiny bear
C. Little black fox
D. Little lion
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
Which characteristic describes the migration pattern of this object?
A. Night-time using the stars
B. Random, without a fixed pattern
C. Diurnal and uses landmarks
D. Non-migratory
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: It often migrates by night, using the stars to navigate.

text:
Which of these materials is NOT traditionally used to make this object?
A. Plastic
B. Wood
C. Metal
D. Glass
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Guitar picks are made of a variety of materials, including celluloid, metal, and rarely other exotic materials...

text:

B. Entirely green
C. Mostly yellow with blue near the tail
D. Entirely silver with black spots
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: The adult rock beauty is mostly yellow, turning blue toward the tail.

text:
What are common materials used to manufacture this object?

D. Silicone, latex, and lycra
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. By emitting a loud sound to scare predators away
C. By shedding its tail
D. By camouflaging with the surroundings
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
Which conservation agreement applies to this object?
A. Agreement on the Conservation of African-Eurasian Migratory Waterbirds
B. Biodiversity Treaty of the Americas
C. Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species
D. Global Raptor Impact Network
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The red-breasted merganser is one of the species to which the "Agreement on the Conservation of African-Eurasian Migratory Waterbirds" (AEWA) applies.

text:
Which country had the largest market for this object by 1995?
A. United Kingdom
B. France
C. United States
D. Japan
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The largest comic book market is Japan.

text:
Which area is not a leading producer of this object as of 2017?
A. China
B. India
C. Brazil
D. Italy
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: In 2017, 73 million tonnes of oranges were grown worldwide, with Brazil producing 24% of the world total, followed by China and India.

text:
What feature distinguishes many species of this object and helps them escape predators?

B. Ability to fly short distances
C. Production of a loud, frightening noise
D. Shooting quills at predators
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

B. Rear-wheel steering
C. No steering required
D. All-wheel steering

text:
What was the original purpose of this object in hunting?
A. To track large mammals
B. To chase foxes from their burrows
C. To retrieve game from water
D. For decorative purposes during hunts
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Their original purpose was to bolt foxes which had gone to ground.

text:

A. Glide
B. Swivel
C. Rock
D. Spin
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
Which training method is NOT typically used for this object?

B. Verbal commands
C. Goad or whip
D. Electric signals
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: These signals are given by verbal command and body language, reinforced by a goad, whip or a long pole.

text:

B. Attracting mates
C. Protection
D. Catching food
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: During the day, they use their tentacles for protection by wrapping them over the grooves on their surface.

text:
Where does this object originate from?
A. Sweden
B. Germany
C. Scotland
D. Wales
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: The Lakeland Terrier is a dog breed, which takes its name from its place of origin, the Lake District in England.

text:

text:

A. Early 1900s
B. 1930s
C. Late 1800s
D. 1950s
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
How are this object's nostrils adapted to its ecological niche?

C. Positioned along the sides of the bill, they measure exact airspeed in flight.
D. The nostrils can close completely to prevent water ingress during deep dives.
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: The tubes of all albatrosses are along the sides of the bill.

text:
Where was this object first described scientifically?
A. Germany, 1788
B. England, 1833
C. South Africa, 1833
D. France, 1798
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: "P. sebae" was first described by Johann Friedrich Gmelin, a German naturalist, in 1788.

text:
In which region is this object historically used as a symbol for bakers and their guilds?
A. Eastern France
B. Northern Germany
C. Western Austria
D. Southern German areas
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

D. Web spinning

text:
What is the average wingspan of this object?
A. 46-52 cm
B. 50-60 cm
C. 20-22 cm
D. 33-35 cm
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
What is primarily the diet of this object in the wild?

B. Seaweed
C. Coral polyps
D. Small fish and invertebrates

text:
What is the primary reason for the decline of the European species of this object?
A. Competition with the American species
B. Climate change
C. Overhunting by humans
D. Hybridization with other species
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: American mink are believed by some to have contributed to the decline of the less hardy European mink through competition.

text:
Which of the following regions is NOT a current habitat for this object?
A. North America
B. Scandinavia
C. Hokkaido in Japan
D. Atlas Mountains of Africa
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Brown bears were once native to much of Asia, the Atlas Mountains of Africa, Europe, and North America, but are now extinct in some areas ...

text:
What is the typical size range for most species of this object?
A. Size of a rice grain
B. Size of a small bird
C. About the size of a thumbnail
D. Size of a human hand
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Most species of cockroach are about the size of a thumbnail...

text:
What is the most distinctive physical characteristic of this object?
A. Long, flowing white coat
B. Golden, silky coat
C. Short, brindle fur
D. Distinctive black coat
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The Groenendael is recognized by its distinctive black coat.

text:
In what year did this object gain recognition by the American Kennel Club?
A. 2010
B. 1985
C. 1995
D. 2000
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
Which of the following describes the life cycle stage missing in this object compared to other members of its phylum?

B. Medusa stage
C. Adult stage
D. Larval stage
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Unlike jellyfish, sea anemones do not have a medusa stage in their life cycle.

text:
What historical variety of this object was typically sweetened, flavored with fruits, and served as a dessert?
A. Consommé Madrilène
B. Sweetened consommé with tendons and cartilage
C. Double strength consommé
D. Jellied consommé
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: A special type of consommé that was boiled solely with tendons and cartilage without the addition of salt was sweetened, flavoured with fruits and served as dessert.

text:
Which type of eyesight mechanism does this object utilize?
A. Multiple lens eyes
B. Tapetum lucidum in the secondary eyes
C. Single lens reflex
D. Tapetum lucidum in all eyes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Wolf spiders possess grate-shaped 'tapeta lucida'; the 'tapetum lucidum' is a retroreflective tissue found in eyes. This reflective tissue is only found in the four nonsmall eyes ('secondary eyes') of the wolf spider.

text:
Which type of this object would be considered inappropriate at most formal black or white tie events?
A. Clip-on
B. Self-tie
C. Pre-tied
D. Adjustable
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Wearing a ready-tied this object at formal occasions requiring a black or white tie dress code is usually considered a faux pas.

text:
What order is this object classified under?
A. Pelecaniformes
B. Gruiformes
C. Passeriformes
D. Ciconiiformes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The limpkin is placed in its own monotypic family, Aramidae, which is in turn placed within the crane and rail order Gruiformes.

text:
During which stages does this object live a primarily aquatic life?
A. Only as an adult
B. Only as a larva
C. Throughout its life
D. As a larva and an adult
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Newts metamorphose through three distinct developmental life stages: aquatic larva, terrestrial juvenile (eft), and adult.

text:
Which of these vehicles is historically associated as a precursor to the modern design of this object?
A. 1945 Jeep Willys
B. 1965 Ford Mustang
C. 1970 Chevrolet Impala
D. 1956 Fiat Multipla
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The 1956-1969 Fiat Multipla also had many features in common with modern minivans. The Multipla was based on the chassis of the Fiat 600 and had a rear engine and cab forward layout.

text:
Which event significantly demonstrated the effectiveness of this object leading to its proliferation?
A. The Red Square parade unveiling in 1977
B. The Vietnam War confrontation between the AK-47 and M14
C. Demonstration at the People's Commissariat of Arms of the USSR in 1943
D. The early stages of World War II
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: On July 15, 1943, a Sturmgewehr was demonstrated before the People's Commissariat of Arms of the USSR. The Soviets were so impressed with the Sturmgewehr, that they immediately set about developing an intermediate caliber automatic rifle of their own.

text:
What is the typical size range for most species of this object?
A. Size of a rice grain
B. Size of a small bird
C. About the size of a thumbnail
D. Size of a human hand
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Most species of cockroach are about the size of a thumbnail...

text:
Which of the following was not a use of this object during its early development in Europe?
A. Siege weapon
B. Field artillery
C. Naval artillery
D. Anti-cavalry weapon
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: By the end of the 14th century cannon were widespread throughout Eurasia. Cannon were used primarily as anti-infantry weapons until around 1374 when cannon were recorded to have breached walls for the first time in Europe.

text:
What unique feature is present in juvenile forms of this object?
A. An extra set of gills
B. A tentacle above their eye sockets
C. Bioluminescent spots
D. A distinct tail fin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Juvenile lionfish have a unique tentacle located above their eye sockets

text:
What classic mechanical principle does this object demonstrate?
A. None of the above
B. Third-class lever
C. Second-class lever
D. First-class lever
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The wheelbarrow is designed to distribute the weight of its load between the wheel and the operator, so enabling the convenient carriage of heavier and bulkier loads than would be possible were the weight carried entirely by the operator. As such it is a second-class lever.

text:
What is the primary function of this object's shell?
A. To serve primarily as a buoyancy control device
B. To enhance the animal's camouflage
C. To aid in the digestion of food
D. To provide a hard protective outer casing
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:

A. Pairs
B. Pods
C. Flocks
D. Solitary
Choose A, B, C, or D.

wiki: Hippos are gregarious, living in groups of up to thirty animals. A group is called a pod, herd, dale, or bloat.

text:
Which of these tasks is this object not traditionally used for?
A. Pulling carts
B. Sledding across mountainous regions
C. Guarding properties
D. Herding livestock
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
What is the typical dietary preference of this object's larvae?
A. None, they do not eat until maturation
B. Algae and plant matter
C. Small insects and molluscs
D. Only aquatic plants
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: After this, they start to eat freshwater plankton, and later insect larvae, molluscs, and similar foods...

text:
Which year was this object officially recognized as a breed by the American Kennel Club?
A. 2001
B. 2012
C. 1995
D. 1989
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: It was recognized by the American Kennel Club (AKC) in January 2012, making it the AKC's 174th recognized breed.

text:
In which year was the first practical and widely used model of this object invented by Barthélemy Thimonnier?
A. 1851
B. 1790
C. 1832
D. 1829
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: The first practical and widely used sewing machine was invented by Barthélemy Thimonnier, a French tailor, in 1829.

text:
What behavioral trait does this object display that is unique among its kind?
A. It lives in large social groups.
B. It migrates seasonally over long distances.
C. It climbs trees to escape predators.
D. It carries its young on its back.
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
What is a unique feature of vertical versions of this object compared to horizontal types?
A. Collect more dust
B. Easier to operate
C. More light control
D. Better for small windows
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
What materials is this object commonly made from?

B. Silver, brass, and melamine
C. Plastic, glass, and rubber
D. Wool, silk, and cotton
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B

text:
What was one of the modern uses of this object during World War I?

B. As an insulator in electric suits
C. All of the above
D. As a bulletproof vest
Choose A, B, C, or D.

text:
Which type of trials is this object known to participate in due to its physical capabilities?
A. Tracking events
B. Retrieval trials
C. Lure coursing events
D. Herding trials

text:
What was a significant design evolution for this object around the 1950s?

text:
Which type of this object is capable of indicating both time and date?

text:
In what year was this object reintroduced with the name we know today after Rival Company's acquisition and rebranding?
A. 1965
B. 1974
C. 1971
D. 1980
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The cooker was then reintroduced under the name 'Crock-Pot' in 1971.

text:
Which type of this object is commonly found in restaurants and has a metal-mesh conveyor belt?
A. Toaster oven
B. Microwave oven
C. Pop-up this object
D. Conveyor this object
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A third type, most commonly found in restaurants, has a metal-mesh conveyor belt that moves the bread past constantly-powered heat elements.

text:
What is the predominant color of the eggs of this object when they are first oviposited?
A. Reddish
B. Pale Yellow
C. Light Brown
D. White
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The large white eggs appear as a pale yellow colour.

text:
What style of this object became popular again during the Edwardian era?
A. Choker
B. Dog-collar style
C. Lariat necklace
D. Opera necklace
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The Edwardian era saw a resurgence of pearl necklaces, in addition to a dog-collar style of necklace made of gold or platinum with inset diamonds, emeralds, or rubies.

text:
What is the primary advantage of using Galilean optics in this object?
A. They offer an erect image with a wide field of view.
B. They provide the brightest image possible.
C. They are inexpensive and lightweight due to fewer components.
D. They provide a very high magnification.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The Galilean design has the advantage of presenting an erect image but has a narrow field of view and is not capable of very high magnification.

text:
What common feature do all species referred to as this object share?
A. They are all aquatic
B. They are all venomous
C. They are all arboreal
D. They all have fur
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki:
- Eastern green mamba ("Dendroaspis angusticeps"), an arboreal snake
- Western green mamba ("Dendroaspis viridis"), an arboreal snake
- Jameson's mamba ("Dendroaspis jamesoni"), an arboreal snake

text:
In what context can this object commonly represent the monarchy or Crown itself, as a form of metonymy?
A. In state ceremonies
B. In architectural designs
C. In judicial systems
D. In authoritative speeches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: "Throne" in an abstract sense can also refer to the monarchy or the Crown itself, an instance of metonymy, and is also used in many expressions such as "the power behind the throne".

text:
What is the primary nesting choice of this object?
A. On the ground
B. In shallow water
C. In high rocky cliffs
D. In trees
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: They nest on the ground and have a diet consisting of seeds, grapes and insects.

text:
What is the term used for a young one of this object in North America?
A. Cub
B. Calf
C. Kit
D. Pup
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In North America the young are usually called kits, while the terms male and female are generally used for adults.

text:
What type of mouthparts does this object possess?
A. Piercing
B. Siphoning
C. Sucking
D. Chewing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: They have chewing mouthparts, and undergo complete metamorphosis.

text:
How does this object primarily attract a mate during the breeding season?
A. Through elaborate dance routines
B. By building intricate nests
C. By displaying brightly colored plumage
D. By vocalizing loudly
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The male displays brightly colored plumage during the breeding season to attract a mate.

text:
What unique characteristic is notable about the tail of this object?
A. Tail is plumed
B. Typically born with naturally short tails
C. Always has a long tail
D. The tail is prehensile
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Most Brittanys are born with naturally short tails, yet others are rarely born with long tails, which are docked to a length of

text:
Which city was one of the first outside of Japan to adopt this object extensively in its transportation system?
A. Singapore
B. San Francisco
C. Kolkata
D. Berlin
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Singapore received its first rickshaws in 1880 and soon after they were prolific, making a 'noticeable change in the traffic on Singapore's streets.'

text:
What best describes the function of this object when moving through air?
A. It produces lift.
B. It serves to decrease the pressure around the object.
C. It is used to increase the speed of the object.
D. It primarily acts as a stabilizer.
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: A wing is a type of fin that produces lift, while moving through air or some other fluid.

text:
What is the primary diet of this object?
A. Insects and small vertebrates
B. Seeds and nuts
C. Leaves, fruits, and flowers
D. Fishes and aquatic plants
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Mantises are generalist predators of arthropods. Larger mantises sometimes eat smaller individuals of their own species, as well as small vertebrates such as lizards, frogs, small birds and fishes.

text:
In terms of behavior and social structure, how does this object typically live?
A. Nomadic in small packs
B. In large groups
C. In nuclear families
D. Solitary
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: They live in groups, but in different group forms.

text:
Which area is this object native to?
A. The Sahara Desert
B. The Siberian Taiga
C. The Arctic coastal tundra of northern Alaska
D. The Amazon Rainforest
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: This subspecies only inhabits the tundra regions along the Arctic coast of northern Alaska.

text:
What is the term used to describe the person in charge of this object?
A. Hotelier
B. Chef
C. Bartender
D. Restaurateur
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: A restaurant's proprietor is called a 'restaurateur', this derives from the French verb 'restaurer', meaning 'to restore'.

text:
This object's diet predominantly consists of what type of food?
A. Freshwater algae
B. Grass and weeds
C. Tree and shrub leaves
D. Other insects
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: Phasmids are herbivorous, feeding mostly on the leaves of trees and shrubs.

text:
Which family does this object belong to?
A. Cardinalidae
B. Passeridae
C. Fringillidae
D. Corvidae
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family (family Brassicaceae, genus 'Brassica')

text:
What order is this object classified under?
A. Pelecaniformes
B. Gruiformes
C. Passeriformes
D. Ciconiiformes
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The limpkin is placed in its own monotypic family, Aramidae, which is in turn placed within the crane and rail order Gruiformes.

text:
What is the primary mode of predation used by this object?
A. Ambush
B. Constriction
C. Venom injection
D. Pursuit
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: Kingsnakes use constriction to kill their prey and tend to be opportunistic in their diet; they eat other snakes (ophiophagy), including venomous snakes.

text:
Which company was the largest producer of American-made military versions of this object during World War II?
A. Diamond T
B. White Motor Company
C. International Harvester
D. Autocar
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: In America, 43,000 halftracks were produced by three primary manufacturers, the largest being the White Motor Company, with a total of 15,414 accepted by the War Department.

text:
Which of the following is NOT a type of heating mechanism used by this object?
A. Ultraviolet
B. Infrared
C. Combustion
D. Convection
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Electric space heaters fall into three main categories: - Convection heaters - Infrared heaters - Heat pumps

text:
What historical document was penned using this object?
A. The Magna Carta
B. The Treaty of Versailles
C. The U.S. Constitution
D. The Rosetta Stone
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Quill pens were also used to write the 'Magna Carta' and the Declaration of Independence.

text:
Which healthcare concern is NOT typically associated with this object?
A. Progressive retinal atrophy
B. Type 3 von Willebrand disease
C. Hip dysplasia
D. Excessive feathering leading to parasitic infestations
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: These include, but are not limited to: - Hip dysplasia - Progressive retinal atrophy - Type 3 von Willebrand disease - Cataract - Regional Alopecia in both sexes

text:
Which of the following health issues is this object most likely to face according to studies?
A. Heart Disease
B. Obesity
C. Diabetes
D. Cancer
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: D
wiki: Cancer is the leading cause of death for dogs in general, but Bernese Mountain Dogs have a much higher rate of fatal cancer than other breeds.

text:
In what context can this object commonly represent the monarchy or Crown itself, as a form of metonymy?
A. In state ceremonies
B. In architectural designs
C. In judicial systems
D. In authoritative speeches
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: "Throne" in an abstract sense can also refer to the monarchy or the Crown itself, an instance of metonymy, and is also used in many expressions such as "the power behind the throne".

text:
What was a historical development in the evolution of this object?
A. First use in the late 18th century with manual pumps
B. Development of solar-powered versions
C. Use of nuclear power for high-energy pumps
D. Introduction of electric engines in the 20th century
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: The first recorded fire-float was built in 1765 for the Sun Fire Insurance Company in London. This was a manual pump in a small boat, rowed by its crew to the scene of the fire.

text:
How is this object most commonly packaged?
A. In a spray bottle
B. As a compact or loose powder
C. In a roll-on applicator
D. In a tube
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: It comes packaged either as a compact or as loose powder.

text:
Where is this object's natural habitat?
A. Deserts
B. Tropical rainforests
C. Temperate forests of the Himalayas
D. Savannah grasslands
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The red panda lives between altitude, inhabiting areas of moderate temperature between with little annual change. It prefers mountainous mixed deciduous and conifer forests, especially with old trees and dense understories of bamboo.

text:
What is the primary purpose of this object when used with books?
A. To store additional notes about the book
B. To serve as a bookmark
C. To protect book covers from damage
D. To enhance the aesthetic appeal of a webpage
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: In addition to its promotional role, the dust jacket protects the book covers from damage.

text:
How do this object's physical adaptations assist its arboreal activities?
A. Strong forelimbs and sharp claws for climbing
B. Claws capable of gripping smooth surfaces
C. Long tails for balance in trees
D. Webbed feet for swimming and climbing
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: Their claws are short and rounded, being thick at the base and tapering to a point. Claws from both hind and front legs are almost identical in length, though the foreclaws tend to be more sharply curved.

text:
What was the primary use of the technology that preceded the development of this object?
A. Communicating encrypted messages
B. Radar detection systems
C. Guiding ships and aircraft
D. Broadcasting radio programs
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: B
wiki: The invention of the cavity magnetron made possible the production of electromagnetic waves of a small enough wavelength (microwaves). The magnetron was originally a crucial component in the development of short wavelength radar during World War II.

text:
What is the characteristic expression projected by this object due to its facial features?
A. Calmness and obedience
B. Aggression and alertness
C. Intelligence, pride, and kindliness
D. Playfulness and curiosity
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: C
wiki: The head is adorned with a striking black mask and projects the breed's distinct expression of intelligence, pride, and kindliness.

text:
What is the approximate life span of this object in the wild?
A. Approximately 15 years
B. More than 30 years
C. Up to 10 years
D. About 5 years
Choose A, B, C, or D.
label: A
wiki: They live to about fifteen years old in the wild.
